results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Since the Book Club within our group has been such a successful event, we'll continue having these each month, thank you for those who have participated since this started! :)

A big thank you to Emily - who hosts the Book Club!

February's Book: The Rosie Project by Graeme Simsion

Book Info: Now in paperback, the international bestselling romantic comedy “bursting with warmth, emotional depth, and…humor,” ( Entertainment Weekly) featuring the oddly charming, socially challenged genetics professor, Don, as he seeks true love. The art of love is never a science: Meet Don Tillman, a brilliant yet socially inept professor of genetics, who’s decided it’s time he found a wife. In the orderly, evidence-based manner with which Don approaches all things, he designs the Wife Project to find his perfect partner: a sixteen-page, scientifically valid survey to filter out the drinkers, the smokers, the late arrivers. Rosie Jarman possesses all these qualities. Don easily disqualifies her as a candidate for The Wife Project (even if she is “quite intelligent for a barmaid”). But Don is intrigued by Rosie’s own quest to identify her biological father. When an unlikely relationship develops as they collaborate on The Father Project, Don is forced to confront the spontaneous whirlwind that is Rosie―and the realization that, despite your best scientific efforts, you don’t find love, it finds you. 

Brunch Info:  Join us for good food and drinks while chatting about the book of the month!  This place is BYOB, so feel free to bring some champagne to share (the venue offers OJ for mimosas!)
results.name: February Book Club (& Brunch)!

Sorry for the very very late notice....

The spin statistics theorem holds that half integer spin particles are fermions whereas integer spin particles are bosons.  Fermions and bosons have very different properties...fermions despise being with other like particles whereas bosons love being with other like particles...this week we will finish up our discussion of Fadeev-Papov ghosts by discussing a treatment which naturally explains why ghosts had to be introduced...

https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/BRST_quantization


We will round out the discussion of the spin-statistics theorem...which fortunately holds true in Nature because without it, chemistry and spatial extent itself...and consequently human life....would not be possible.

<a>https://en.m.wikipedia.org/wiki/Spin–statistics_theorem</a>;


Hope to see you there!

Barry
results.name: The Spin- Statistics Theorem and BRST Quantization of Gauge Fields

results.description:
Acoustic Guitar for Beginners 102
Four 90-Minute Sessions Held on 4 consecutive Saturdays.
[FEBRUARY 6, 13, 20, 27] - MARCH - APRIL -- 11:00am

WHO CAN ATTEND:
Candidates for this course are those who have completed the Note-Reading Basics Guitar Course (now called "Acoustic Guitar for Beginners 101") or have equivalent experience.  Students registering for the "Beginners 102" are already able to read and play all 17 natural notes in the 1st position on the guitar, can play basic open string chords and are able to play with others in the classroom setting. This class is also good for Intermediate or Advanced players who want to improve sight reading skills, learn new structures for improvising over chord changes and get practice playing licks and phrases in an ensemble. NOTE:  Session #1 is MANDATORY for participation in the Series.


WHAT YOU WILL LEARN:
We will work from a book of materials authored by your Group Organizer and  instructor (Kenti), which is included at no additional cost to you.  You will expand the skills needed to effectively READ and PLAY NOTES, CHORDS and PLAY SONGS you know and love.  This course will cover Sharps and Flats, Accidentals, two and three note chords and more complex rhythmic structures. And what you learn is applicable to playing Rock, Blues, Folk, Country, Jazz, Classical or any other type of music the student is interested in playing.

TWELVE-WEEK CYCLE:
In this workshop, a specific set of concepts will be covered over a period of 12-week.  This listed on the calendar as three, 4-week cycles.  Each monthly, 4-week period will be closed to people who did not attend the 1st session of the month.  This allow the group to continue to progress through the lesson material and avoid the need to review all that came before each time a new person joins the group. There will be three to four monthly, 4-week cycles before the first cycle is repeated


WHAT TO BRING:
• Bring your own guitar for these lessons
• Also bring a three-ring binder (for the course material) and a pencil

COST:  The cost of this session is $15.00, which must be paid when you RSVP. 


IMPORTANT NOTE: If there are 5 or less people registered for this meetup, we will not meet at Ripley Grier Studios.  We will instead meet at the Sony Public Atrium, 550 Madison Avenue (Between 55th and 56th Street on Madison).  Watch for an email confirming where we will meet.

results.description:
This is a special, incredible sketch event.  The Lowline Lab is a laboratory and technical exhibit designed to test and showcase how the proposed Lowline park will grow and sustain plants underground. It's built inside an abandoned market on the Lower East Side, just two blocks from the site of the proposed future Lowline - the world's first underground park.


This is going to be a tricky sketch. It's in dark, crowded rooms, so we're only going to sketch for two hours. But it's also an exhibit that shouldn't be missed, in a really cool space. It's really a sight to see.

There's a suggested donation of $10.

Any problems on the day of the event, I can be reached at [masked]. 


Looking forward to sketching with you!


---------------------------------------------------------------

Unrelated to the event, but the Lowline is also looking for artists for a potential promotional coloring book they're producing. Reach out to me if you're interested and I'll mention it at the event, too.

---------------------------------------------------------------


What makes our Meetups different from other art groups and classes? There's no instruction, but we like to share our work, and chat and be inspired. Share tips and learn from people in a casual environment where all levels of artists are welcome! Don't be shy to ask anyone anything!

• We sketch for a bit, usually 45 minutes or so, and then get back together and share our drawings, and then sketch again, etc. There's usually time for 3 or 4 sketches.

• Please bring your own supplies - anything you like to work with - pens, pencil, watercolor, pastel, small sketchbook or large paper, iPad, whatever suits you.

• We hand out nametags so everyone can meet one another!

• We take photos to share on the site later. Bring your camera!

• Please take care to make sure we do not leave any trash behind. Please also leave any dogs at home; they tend to knock over the artwork. Thanks. 

• This Meetup is FREE and everyone at all skill levels is welcome!

How does the Wait List work? If the event is full, rsvp to be added to the Wait List. If someone from the regular list cancels, the first person on the Wait List is automatically bumped up to regular attendee.

Please note that if you add a comment below it will spam everyone with an email, so please use your judgement.
results.name: Draw the Lowline Lab!

results.description:
This 2-Day comprehensive workshop explores visual storytelling with dynamic camera movement and skillful actor blocking.

Through extensive, daily hands-on exercises, participants will learn to visualize the scene, work with actors, strategize with storyboards, and evoke the essence of the script: DRAMA!

Participants will learn how to visualize, choose optimum camera positions, camera movement, and lens choices in relations with actor blocking.

Through this process, participants will understand how to convey tone, mood, and style, as well as give the film a distinct look that belongs to the director's unique vision.

FEE: $425 Includes Studio and Equipment

results.description:
Calling all poets! Jersey City is now offering a weekly poetry workshop. 

This workshop will start by critiquing 3-4 poems, one by each person signed up ahead of time. The workshop will end, if time permits, with one 10 minute writing prompt (an idea to incorporate into a poem written on the spot).  Poets who sign up to be workshopped must bring printed copies of their poems for the group (recommended: 10 copies). To sign up for a workshop in advance, please contact Sarah Jewell at [masked]. 

While workshopping poems, we will “mind our P’s and Q’s” by Praising first what works in a poem, and then Questioning what might be improved. This helps to keep the feedback positive and constructive. If you are new to critiquing poetry, please see these guidelines:
http://triadwriters.org/inspiration/guidelines-critique-of-poem/ 

The workshop will be held in an upstairs room in the Brightside Tavern (upon arrival, go up the stairs to your left). On a final note, since Brightside Tavern is generously hosting our workshop, we request that workshop participants order brunch.
results.name: Jersey Plums: A Weekly Poetry Workshop

results.description:
Foundations of Mindfulness - Emotions

“You may have heard the old story, usually attributed to a Native American elder, meant to illuminate the power of attention. A grandfather (occasionally it’s a grandmother) imparting a life lesson to his grandson tells him, "I have two wolves fighting in my heart. One wolf is vengeful, fearful, envious, resentful, deceitful. The other wolf is loving, compassionate, generous, truthful, and serene." The grandson asks which wolf will win the fight. The grandfather answers, "The one I feed.” 

― Sharon Salzberg, Real Happiness: The Power of Meditation

Hello John,  

Hope you've had a good week.  We will continue our investigation of Mindfulness tomorrow and take a look at emotions and our relationship to them.

Working with emotions can be tricky for many of us. We fear being carried away or controlled by them. Often we create stories with rationalizations, causes and blame to help us stay far away from the emotion itself. We opt to just live with the discomfort in our hearts or in the places where they have left traces or pain or even sickness in our bodies.

What can we do instead? Well, with practice, as soon as emotional energy begins to rise, we can take a beat, a pause, before our stories begin.  Then, setting the stories aside, free of the added intensity they add, we can turn our attention to the emotion itself, by itself. How does the emotion feel? Where am I feeling it in my body? Leaving the story out doesn't mean it won't sometimes be painful to be with the energy of emotions, but we will have disarmed a good portion of the optional suffering the stories provide.

In meditation it's important to focus our attention on all of the emotions that arise in their basic, energetic state.  Any time we leave an emotion out of our awareness, it doesn't really go away. The emotional parts of ourselves we ignore or push away because we don't like them or don't want to deal with them become an low-level, but constant buzz in our ears that overtime can become destabilizing or corrosive.

It's also helpful to remember that everyone has to deal with emotions. It's important because in a way we can know it's not personal and it's not a moral failing.  We can begin to see our emotions are part of the human experience.  We can get curious about them without judgment.  We can treat ourselves with compassion and kindness.

Foundations of Mindfulness Mindfulness is more than just paying attention. It is powered by intention, but we also have to get out of our own way to experience clearly what’s actually appearing. We have to find an openness of heart and mind and suspend our judgements and theories and rationales so we can see more than what we always see. We have to begin to relinquish the "I" and "mine" kinds of ownership over what arises in our experience. We also have to unhook from the time line that may bind us to the past or project us to the future and be mindful now.

Over the next few weeks we will explore of the traditional Foundations of Mindfulness.

Introduction to Mindfulness
Mindfulness of the Breath
Mindfulness of the Body
Mindfulness of Emotions
Mindfulness of Thinking
Mindfulness of the Mind
Mindfulness in Daily Life

I hope you'll share your Saturday morning with us.

Class Structure:  

Each class begins with a very brief guided meditation of gathering and quieting followed by a topical teaching and an expanded guided mindfulness meditation. There is time for discussion and Q&A.  Please note that while there is benefit in participating in regular sittings and practice, you do not have to attend every class to find value. 

Fee by donation: Suggested starting donation is $10 and your generosity is greatly appreciated.  No one is ever turned away for lack of funds.  The donation box is on the sign-in table.
results.name: Foundations of Mindfulness - Emotions

NOTE THIS EXPERIENCE IS FOR NEW MEMBERS OR THOSE WHO HAVE YET TO TAKE A HARLEM TOUR WITH OUR GROUP!  There is another posting for all other members that has a long waiting list.

Harlem is perhaps New York’s most famous neighborhood and has a very rich history and has also had a great impact on the world! On this walking tour we’ll experience Harlem old and new, from the beautiful Hamilton Heights and Striver's row historic areas to the hustle and bustle of 125th Street.  We will see magnificent and varied architecture, beautiful 19th century townhouses, important historic sites, noted houses of worship and the famed Apollo Theatre. Tour covers four centuries of Harlem History as a center of commerce, culture and activism.  We'll also talk about Harlem's great contributions to JAZZ.  We'll check visit a local art gallery and a special exhibit at the Schomberg Library celebrating the 75th anniversary of the Negro Theatre, where Harry Belafonte, Ruby Dee and Sidney Poitier got their start. http://www.nypl.org/events/exhibitions/75th-anniversary-american-negro-theatre

results.description:
This is an open house and introduction to Lyndhurst Meditation. This introduction gives hope for those seeking happiness, peace, and truth.

At Lyndhurst Meditation we use a very simple, yet direct way of cleansing and freeing the mind. This meditation is a customized guided one-on-one practice through self-reflection.

Give your mind and heart a break from the chaos of everyday life! Deeply examine and empty your self to find absolute peace and freedom!

If you are interested in becoming a member of our meditation center we will offer a special discounted price for meetup members only! 

We are located at 306 Ridge Rd, Lyndhurst, NJ 07071. Our meditation center is located across the stress from Wendy's. You can park in the front and additional free parking is located in the rear of the building. This introduction will last about an hour to an hour and a half. If you have many plans for the day please say this before the meetup starts so we can accommodate you properly. 

**If you are not able to attend this event, but have an interest in Lyndhurst Meditation you can call our center to have a personal introduction today! Lyndhurst Meditation is a non-profit organization and is tax deductible. A $10 donation is appreciated for the introduction.
results.name: Lyndhurst Meditation Introduction

results.description:
Digital Photography DSLR-201 Entry Level

For Conventional and Mirrorless DSLR users.

Understanding your Camera II: Take Control

$39.99 (per person)
Our DSLR-101 class taught you what the features of your DSLR are, and showed you samples of their effects.
Now in DSLR-201 you will learn how to apply these building blocks to greatly improve your photos, and the way you think about taking your photos.
Gaining a deeper understanding of ISO, depth of field, the relationship of f-stops and shutter speeds, exposure compensation, on camera flash vs. off camera flash, and knowing how to read your histogram will be the focus of this class

Topics to include:
• Choosing the proper ISO. How and why it matters.
• Controlling depth of field. How to use it as a tool to create dramatic images .
• Why sometimes photos seem too light or too dark, and what you need to understand to master your meter.
• Understanding the resources your camera can give you to perfect your photos.
• Please bring your DSLR camera to this class. We will better be able to show you how to apply what you will learn
Please note that this class is NOT for point & shoot cameras
Next Available class: March. Please call.
Please call to book a seat.
Coffee & snacks included.

CAMERA LAND  - WHAT A CAMERA STORE SHOULD BE

results.description:
LEADER: John Jurasek ([masked] (pref.) or[masked]) RATING: B 6 B

Feb 27 (Sat) CLAUSLAND MOUNTAIN- 6 Miles- We will climb up Clausland Mt. (700' not steep, fairly easy road climb) through historic Rockland Cemetery to an old Nike missal base with splendid views of the area. See how close nuclear missiles were stored, ready to launch, to where we live. Bring hiking boots, lunch, 2 quarts of water. We will lunch at the summit of Clausland Mt.

Don't worry, this will be a moderate paced (2 mph) fun hike, a little snow won't bother us. Adverse conditions will modify the route. We meet in front of 450 Piermont Ave. (building with mural), corner of Tate and Piermont Ave. in Piermont NY (10968) at 11:15 AM. Park in municipal lot D which is located to the right off Gair Street which is just across the street from our meeting location. Some directions can be found at Driving Directions They will take you just a half block away from our meeting spot. Leader: John P. Jurasek:[masked] (no calls after 10pm) or [masked].

Public transportation from the city is available on the 10:40 AM Rockland Coaches 9A bus from the George Washington Bridge Bus Terminal to meet us in Piermont by 11:17. Tell the driver you are going to Piermont, NY. Ask the driver to drop you off just across the street from 450 Piermont Ave. (building with mural) on the corner of Gair and Piermont Aves., in front of the 14 and Hudson Kitchen and Bar. We will be waiting on the corner right across the street. You can take the 9:15 Bus from Port Authority Bus Terminal to arrive in Piermont at 10:17 but you will be an hour early. There are shops in town to pass the time.

Return buses depart at 47 minutes past each hour for the hour long trip to Port Authority. During even-numbered hours, the bus also stops at the George Washington Bridge Bus Terminal. Last bus out is at 10:17 PM.

If all goes as planned, we will be out around 3 - 3:30.
Joint with other groups.

*   *   *   *   *   *

Our full hike schedule can be viewed on our website at hudsonhikers.org, and some hikes are also posted on our Facebook page.

After attending two hikes/events, please consider joining the North Jersey Ramapo Chapter of the Adirondack Mountain Club to support our outdoor recreation and conservation activities.  Membership comes with a variety of benefits including a 10% discount at Ramsey Outdoor; our annual holiday party and social; special events such as our traditional day-outing to the Mohonk Mountain House; a subscription to ADK’s bi-monthly magazine, Adirondac; and the opportunity to contribute to the preservation and extension of hiking lands and viewsheds in our region.

New hikers are strongly encouraged to select hikes appropriate to their capabilities. North Jersey Ramapo Chapter hikes are rated for pace (A, B or C), mileage, and terrain (A, B or C), with "C" designating easier hikes and "A" more challenging ones. We recommend that new hikers should first try a "C" or short "B" hike before undertaking a more difficult one; otherwise, you may not fully enjoy the hiking experience. If you have any doubts, please contact the hike leader in advance. 

Pace Ratings: 
     A = Fast - 2.5 mph or faster 
     B = Moderate - about 2 mph 
     C = Easy - 1.5 mph or less 

Distance: Noted in miles 

Terrain Ratings:
     A = Strenuous, long/steep climbs and descents, 
             possible rock scrambling
     B = Moderate climbs and descents
     C = Generally flat with little elevation change 

For example, a hike rated “B 7 A” is a moderately paced hike of approximately 7 miles with steep climbs and/or descents and possible rock scrambling. 

If you join us for a hike, please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness, including ensuring that the hike is appropriate for your level of fitness, that you wear the proper clothing, and bring the proper gear, food and water (see the ADK's recommended Hiking Essentials and guidelines, below).

Leaders have the right, responsibility and sole discretion to refuse any hiker he/she deems to be not properly attired, prepared, or otherwise fit to safely complete the hike. 

HIKERS' GUIDELINES:

  Risks:  As with all physical activities, hiking involves hazards. Persons participate at their own risk and will be asked to sign a statement acknowledging that fact before starting the hike. Prior to the hike please advise the leader of any medical condition or physical impairment that could affect you during the hike.

  Footwear and Clothing:  Wear clothing suited to the weather and carry extra garments for unexpected weather conditions. Dress in thin layers so that you can adjust the number of layers as required to maintain comfort. In winter carry a wool cap and wool or polypropylene gloves or mitts and a windproof shell. Be prepared for rain. Bring a rain jacket and rain pants, preferably of the type that permits venting body moisture. Wear comfortable, sturdy boots/shoes.  Do not wear cotton garments in winter.

  Drink and Food:  Adequate hydration is important year round. Drink frequently during the hike. Carry food to enjoy during the midday lunch stop.

  Other responsibilities:  Hikers with children under 16 and new hikers are required to contact the hike leader in advance to determine if the hike is suitable for them.  Minors under 16 are welcome on day hikes when accompanied by a parent or guardian.  No person under 18 shall participate in overnight outings unless accompanied by a parent or adult sponsor over 21.  The hike leader may refuse to allow a person to hike who is judged to be poorly equipped or unable to do the published hike.  Participants should get to the hike at least 10 minutes prior to the starting time.

  Maps:  The TC number indicates a NY-NJ Trail Conference map for the area of the hike. For example: TC-118 refers to the Southern Harriman Park map.

  Abbreviations:  NCA-No Calls After . . . , Pref.- Leader’s contact preference.

  Expense Sharing:  When car-pooling, passengers are expected to offer the driver funds sufficient to cover the cost of fuel, tolls and parking fees. A $3.00 minimum per person is recommended. Most hike trailhead meeting locations can be found on NY-NJ Trail Conference maps.

  Dog-Friendly Hikes:  Pets are not permitted on hikes unless the hike description clearly states that it is "dog friendly."  If it is, all hikers with dogs must abide by park leash regulations.
results.name: Clausland Mountain Hike

results.description:
Another 6 Nations Rugby tournament is upon us and on this day we'll watch one of the best rugby rivalries that almost always has an impact on who wins the tournament: Ireland vs. England.

So join us for a fry-up and a few pints at Beckett's Bar & Grill for this breakfast-time event, live from Twickenham. The match starts at 11:50 a.m. New York time and should last about 2 hours. $20 cover charge at the door, charged by Premium Sports, which holds US TV rights for the 6 Nations. The bar is not able to waive this charge.


Whether you're supporting the Wolfhounds or the Saxons, the Shamrock or the Rose, you'll be most welcome at this meetup.

After the match, hit some more pubs in the area, including places we haven't been before like Pier A and Dead Rabbit or get on with your Saturday.


See you there!

CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES in Sara D. Roosevelt Park!

                                NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS

                           See our page on Facebook!:

       facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=CCuNsd9JXVE

Game description:

We'll play two simultaneous games of 7 on 7.
There will be 4 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team.

RULES OF THE GAME:

First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!
Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.
No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

What to bring with you:

A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:


You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                                        Slánte

                                                  304 Bowery

                                           New York, NY 10012

                                               (212)[masked]

                                          www.slaintenyc.com

PARTICIPATING IN MANHATTAN-INTERNATIONAL-COED-SOCCER ACTIVITIES AGREEMENT:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. Therefore, I, individually, hereby release and discharge, Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and Assistant Organizers from any and all claims, actions, damages, losses, liabilities, costs and expenses of any kind whatsoever, including but not limited to any claims of negligence, arising out of, resulting from, by reason of, or in connection with my participation in any of Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer programs or activities. Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer Organizer and its Assistant Organizers reserve the right to take and utilize photographs, video, or any type of recording of participating person while engaged in our or associated activities. I consent to Manhattan-International-COED-Soccer use the photograph, video, or recording of me, for advertising, promotional, or related purposes, and waive all rights to compensation and other rights which may arise as a result.

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there 15 minutes earlier so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. 

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and throw-ins and 6'x15' big goals. Rotate goalies

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 134th street and Amsterdam Ave. Click on this Google link for location: Click here.

Directions: By train: 1 train to 137th St. City College Station

Time: The game will start at the scheduled time sharp. Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a credit for any future game (please email me to issue the credit) This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, an automated e-mail will be sent letting you know that a spot has just openned :). You can also check our calendar for other games. Click here for calendar.

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text or call Mane at[masked]-6601.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Since our group is international, I figured why don't we start a international Brunch. This way we can taste different type of food and learn about different culture with friends from all over the world . Let's start with Chinese ( Dim Sum), and then Japanese, Italian, Indian... the list goes on.  Feel free to offer suggestions!! 

Dim sum /ˈdimˈsʌm/ (simplified Chinese: 点心; traditional Chinese: 點心; pinyin: Diǎnxīn) is a style of Cantonese cuisine prepared as small bite-sized portions of food traditionally served in small steamer baskets or on small plates. Dim sum is also well known for the unique way it is served in some restaurants, whereby fully cooked and ready-to-serve dim sum dishes are carted around the restaurant for customers to choose their orders while seated at their tables.


Popular dishes include ( but not limited to) : 

Steamed shrimp dumpling （ 虾饺）

Lo mai gai (糯米雞) wrapped in lotus leaf

shumai(燒賣) dumpling

Chinese baked barbecue pork bao (烤包子)

and so on....
results.name: International Brunch -  Chinese Dim Sum

results.description:
Here's a video from our last performance; "Santa Baby"


https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=6Eq5zNQPuFw

This Season we are playing The Beatles!

We have done Classic Rock, The Rolling Stones, Reggae, Motown, Summer Songs, Fleetwood Mac, Funk and Christmas ensembles, The Beatles is certainly due in our selection!

Acoustic guitars, bass and ukeleles welcome. If electric bring a portable amp:)


This ensemble welcomes ALL LEVELS, so pick your part and let's play! 

To join:

• RSVP before you attend the session.

• Choose your guitar part from TAB>MORE>FILES download/print and bring it to practice to follow. (check by 12/30) 

• Bring acoustic guitar or electric with a portable amp. 

• Have an amazing time!

Practice days are:

Every Saturday 12-2pm starting January 9th til April 23rd, the day before the performance, 16 practice sessions.

Season Pass

You can purchase the Season Pass (16 sessions at discount + $30 show fee) for $380  (you save $50 on practice sessions)

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=MWF56937BM6Q8


Show Day is Sunday, May 1st at 2pm

The show will be at Arlene's Grocery in the East Village April 24th at 1pm(soundcheck) and doors at 2pm. Arlene's is an awesome show venue with professional stage, sound and lights, everyone will be miked or amplified. If you are coming to rehearsal with a portable amp you should also bring it to the venue.

We will have a drummer and a singer TBA.

There will be tickets for this show, they can be purchase before hand at $5 or at the door for $10.

There is a show fee of $30 for each ensemble member that will go toward venue, sound engineer and hired musicians costs.

Arlene's Grocery is strictly 21+ and no children will be allowed at the show even if they are accompanied by the parent, I'm sorry:( :(

There are two bars on site and lots of food spots and great restaurants in the area for before or after the show.

All you need is love and some Beatles!

Check out our website at http://edelage.wix.com/edge

venue.name: New York Public Library

results.description:
Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-behind-the-scenes-new-york-public-library-main-branch-tickets-21677273308?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for a behind-the-scenes tour of the New York Public Library Main Branch, the flagship building in the New York Public Library system and a prominent historic landmark in Midtown Manhattan.

Our experience through this four-story, 646,000 square foot Beaux-Arts masterpiece designed by Carrère and Hastings, and completed in 1911, will include visits to:

• Astor Hall with its magnificent sweeping double staircase

• The Map Division with one of the largest map collections in the world

• The DeWitt Wallace Periodical RoomThe second floor balcony with photos and objects highlighting the library's history and development

• The McGraw Rotunda with its ornately carved ceiling, murals, and the library's copy of the Gutenberg Bible

• The Children's Center with the original stuffed animals that inspired Winnie-the-Pooh stories

• Famous marble lions (Patience and Fortitude) at the Fifth Avenue entrance

As a New York Adventure Club exclusive, our tour will conclude in the Manuscripts and Archives Division, which holds over 29,000 linear feet of manuscripts and archives in over 5,500 collections.

Afterwards, we'll grab food and drinks in the neighborhood!

*Note: The Rose Main Reading Room is temporarily closed while a part of the ceiling is being restored. It is due to reopen in late 2016.
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Behind-the-Scenes @ New York Public Library Main Branch

results.description:
Come celebrate 20 years of Pokemon! If you're an old veteran from the beginning or a newcomer who's just dipping their toes in, all are welcome as we join in the celebration at NintendoNY for Pokemon Day!

UPDATE: Nintendo NY  has dropped the FULL explanation of their event on Facebook! Details below:

Join us for an exciting Pokémon Celebration on 2/27! The New Nintendo 3DS Pokémon 20th Anniversary Edition will be available along with exclusive Pokémon 20th merchandise. Event festivities will start at 11AM. We will have game demoes, Pokémon themed activities, a photo booth, giveaways and more. Pikachu will be here to take photos with fans. Color-coded wristbands will be distributed at 9AM to those waiting in line to attend the event. The wristbands will designate what time attendees can enter the celebration. There will be five
time slots for entry. Each time slot will allow guests one hour to participate in the event. The last two hours of the event will allow guests who did not receive a wristband to enter.

9AM : New Nintendo 3DS Pokémon 20th Anniversary Edition & Pokémon 20th merchandise will go on sale
11AM - 12PM : First time slot open to attendees with color coded wristbands
12PM - 1PM : Second time slot open to attendees with color coded wristbands
1PM - 2PM : Third time slot open to attendees with color coded wristbands
2PM - 3PM : Fourth time slot open to attendees with color coded wristbands
3PM - 5PM : Guests who did not receive a wristband may attend during this time

However, that doesn't mean the fun will stop, because after their event ends, our TOURNAMENT begins!!!

That's right, we said TOURNAMENT! Full disclosure: We wanted to do a tournament of only the original 151 Pokemon, but The Pokemon Company beat us to the punch with it's Kanto Classic Online Competition! So our tournament will use the same rules as the Kanto Classic, with one slight addition: #150, Mewtwo, and #151, Mew, will be allowed in our version! So bring your teams and test 'em out at our event! Signups will begin shortly after Nintendo NY's event ends, in the Rockefeller Concourse located under Nintendo NY!
results.name: Pokemon 20th Anniversary Celebration - Pokemon Day at NintendoNY!

results.description:
This is a group for anyone interested in Kickboxing and Muay Thai. . It's one hour Kickboxing Boot Camp includes warm up, Kickboxing and Muay Thai techniques in a shadowboxing form, Pad work cool down and stretching.
All skills are welcome. Please bring your hand wraps your gloves and your sneakers and be ready for a great workout and have some fun!
The meet up place is Champions Studios in, 257 W 39th St, New York, NY 10108
This is a limited group class 12 people capacity
I hope you will take the time to fill up the survey https://www.surveymonkey.com/r/Y6PD7QZ

results.description:
Prepay required athttp://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5998  -- NO DOOR RESERVATIONS 

Museum of Natural History Singles Tour (prepay only) 

Date & Time: Saturday, February 27, 2016 
11:45 am-6 PM 

Male ages: all 
Female ages: all 

Location: Museum of Natural History 
81st Central Park West 
New York, NY 10024 

Cost: $49.75-$55.75 depending on when yu register.


This event sold out very quickly the last time we did it so if you'd like to attend, please purchase a ticket ASAP. This is a great informal event where you can experience the American Museum of Natural History and at the same time, meet fun new people and make some new friends

The tour starts at 2pm, however we will have a pre-mingle starting at 11:45 am at a local bar/pub close to the museum (location announced only to those who registered/paid) where we will introduce you to the other attendees and give you admission tickets to the museum.

We'll have a dedicated tour guide for our group that will give us an hour tour providing a general overview of the Museum’s treasures. Afterwards, we will experience some of the fantastic shows. Your ticket includes:

12pm-1:30pm - Pre-Mingle & Museum ticket pick up

2pm - Group Highlights Tour

3:30pm - Imax Movie : Secret Ocean or other

4:30pm - Planetarium show or Special Exhibi 


*NOTE: You must pick up your tickets at the pre-mingle location no later than 1:15. If you arrive after 1:15 you will not be able to find the group.

This event is open to all ages and is not meant to be gender/age specific. Please attend if you have an interest in the museum and/or are looking to meet new people.

PRE-PAY required REQUIRED- NO DOOR RESERVATIONS

Buy tickets at http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5998

group.name: Alternative to the Bar Fun Things To Do In NYC Today!

results.description:
*THERE IS A MANDATORY $15 MINIMUM PURCHASE OF FOOD OR DRINK AT THIS EVENT*

*

Saturday will allow us more time to play!  Let's grab a bite to eat, maybe some drinks, and play some games! Yes, there are games you may never have heard of ... Splendor, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Saboteur, Imperial Settlers, Suburbia and many many more!! Not to worry! People who bring the games will teach you how to play.  If you have a game you want to play, bring it along! 


We will get there around noon and will stay to around 5 - 6 p.m.!!  But, if you can't get there until later or need to leave earlier, no problem.  As you can see, we'll be there for several hours.   Don't want to eat there?  No problem, you can order some drinks.  Just keep in mind ... each attendee is required to purchase at least $15 of food or drinks.

If anyone has a specific game they wish to play,  feel free to ask.  And again, if you want to bring one of your own games, that's cool too!  As a matter of fact, it's encouraged!  ;-)
results.name: Saturday Board Games

results.description:
This week in Naach Xpress class JC we are doing a dance to a a very recent Bollywood song with a little bit of Bhangra. Want a hint? The song is from the movie Dil Dhadakne Do. You don't want to miss this one for sure. What is Naach Xpress? NAACH XPRESS is high-energy, fitness fueled dance class to Bollywood beats. It's one big dance PARTY! Students sweat it out to the best of Bollywood Funk NYC's signature dance moves. With a mix of jazz, hip hop, contemporary, and other well known dance techniques, we bring to you our fast track class to sweating it out with some style. Make some friends and dance the night away in this amazing class! There are no worries, come to class tension free and get your weekly dose of fitness and cardio! Each class will focus on ONE hot and popular Bollywood dance song. With a new song featured every week. ALL levels are welcome! Not a dancer? DON'T YOU WORRY! This class is for all, anyone can do it!


Here is a class snip-it:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=70UcFvuNy1g

For further details and pricing for the class, please visit our website

www.bollywoodfunknyc.com

Looking forward to seeing you all there!!
results.name: Naach Xpress JC - Bollywood With A Touch Of Bhangra

group.name: Naach Xpress- Dance and Exercise the Bollywood way!

results.description: I have decided to sell my tiny house. I need to sell it ASAP due to certain personal situations. I'm making an open house if anyone is interested in it or knows someone who is interested. Asking the very very reasonable price of $35,000, very limited time only!!(Original asking price was $48,000). I've already spent close to $20k in materials. All quality materials. Cedar siding and trim, granite kitchen, etc. This event is only for people to come see the tiny house if you're interested in buying it. This is not a general meeting like we've had in the past. Message me for more info and pics. [masked] or[masked]

results.description:
Hey ALL,

If you would like to play for 2 sessions then you can also sign up for back to back time slots as well.

We will be having TWO 1.5 hr sessions each Saturday.

If you'd like, you can sign up for both and play all 3 hours or you can just sign up for either one.

We will be playing FUTSAL - 8 minute round robin matches with THREE teams of 5 (4 and a sub). Music PROVIDED!

GYM FLOOR/BRING FLATS!!!!! Please make sure to show up a little early to <a>CHECK</a> IN and to get changed and warmed up so we can start ASAP. We will wait for noone!
See you out there!

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe. 


PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP AT LEAST MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

• RSVPs close by 10:30AM


No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP at least 2 hours before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:


2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.


By RSVP-ing YES you agree to the following:

I certify that I have no known medical or other conditions that could interfere with my participation in Brooklyn Soccer Club activities. I also understand and accept that the practice of soccer, both indoor and outdoor, involves certain risks of physical injury. results.description:
VIDEO HERE!</a>

It's often said that many people would rather die than talk to a room full of strangers. I understand that feeling. And I can help you better deal with the fear and anxiety that often comes with having to present yourself to a large group of people.

Public speaking is a useful skill to have, and there is a powerful way to build upon and enhance your public speaking presence and have a good laugh at the same time: by learning how to improvise!

Improv takes focus, a willingness to embrace the group dynamic and a commitment to fostering your sense of play. It also helps tremendously to build you resolve and self-confidence.

ABOUT YOUR INSTRUCTOR:

Dewey Chaffee, a professional comedian and improvisor, will lead you through each of these areas with skill, kindness and most importantly, patience, creating an environment that is safe, comfortable, and creatively inspiring.

Improv will make you a better listener, a more open and accepting communicator in life, and a master at slinging bullshit when you need to appear more confident than you feel on the inside!

MORE at <a href="http://www.PlayWithDewey.com">www.PlayWithDewey.com
results.name: Improv for the Public Speaker

results.description:
Our last Amazing Scavenger Brooklyn Museum Hunt was a big hit so we're doing it again! 

This is an INDOOR hunt and includes admission to the Brooklyn Museum. You will receive a series of clues and perform mental and physical (nothing too strenuous) challenges along the way. 

It is a great way to connect with friends or meet new ones. You can sign up as a team (2-4 members) or as an individual and we will put you with a team. Each member of the winning team receives a gift package.

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Feb-27-2016_at_1230PM

Prepay Only Event. No tickets sold at door. 

What to expect:  

• Admission to the Brooklyn Museum

• A fun day with with new friends 

• Mental and physical challenges

• A memorable adventure with photos

• A story to tell

PREPAY ONLY EVENT (No tickets sold at door)  

*Tickets $35-$40 depending upon when you purchase - 

https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Feb-27-2016_at_1230PM

*We only have a limited # of tix available. Ticket price will go up as event gets closer so get yours ASAP.

Who can attend? All are welcome. This is not an age/ethnic/gender specific event. 

What should I wear? Dress comfortable – Most teams wear sneakers. 

What should I bring? A fun attitude, a smart phone if you have (fully charged). The hunt is run through an app called ScanQuest. You can download that before you come.

Where do we go? There’s no set course. Find your own way. It’s a ‘choose your own adventure hunt. 

What if it rains/snows? No problem, the scavenger hunt is all indoors.

Why RSVP says +25? Multiple Meetup groups are organizing this event so don't just go by the RSVPs here. There will be up to 50 members attending and this will sell out! 

Where do I get a ticket? You must prepay here to attend. Tickets will not be sold at the door. We expect this event to sell out so please get your tickets ASAP here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/bkmuseum/dates/Feb-27-2016_at_1230PM
results.name: The Amazing Brooklyn Museum Scavenger Hunt (includes entry to Museum)PREPAY ONLY

results.description:
This is a casual hangout and open discussion for fully automated trading.  This meet will be geared more towards experienced traders and/or programmers building automated strategies looking to network or collaborate together.  It will be an open discussion but more in the context of people already knowing how to trade and program, so please keep that in mind (this is not a workshop or talk on learning how to trade).  

I personally will be working on a fully autonomous trading system I built called Tech Trader (http://www.techtrader.ai), which has been trading live without human intervention since 2012.  I'll be happy to share my progress and my experiences working on that.  It's traded for both myself and actual hedge funds since inception.

You are also more than welcome to bring your own stuff to work on or share.  I'm always interested to see if there are others out there working on fully automated trading algorithms, particularly those in the industry or trading at scale. 

As usual though, the event will be fairly casual and more hangout-oriented, so those looking for something more lecture or workshop oriented should look elsewhere.


I'll be in the basement where the lounges/tables are. Call[masked] if you can't find.
results.name: Fully Automated Trading Discussion and Hangout

results.description:
Many members have been asking for our Saturday Figure Drawing Session.

Join us for three hours of figure drawing in the heart of The Flatiron District.

This session is open to sketchers of all levels.


What makes our sessions different? 

• We work in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.) 

• Every hour we take a break to look each others drawings (if you choose to put yours out.) This is a nonjudgmental and very valuable part of the session. 

• This is a three hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.   

• We start with 5 minute poses and work up to 20 minute poses by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 

• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels.  

• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

Our amazing space!

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon
results.how_to_find_us: We meet in Studio #505
results.name: Saturday - Live Figure Drawing - Flatiron District

results.description:
St. Bart's Church. Flickr CC by Steven Kelley

St. Patrick's Cathedral. Flickr CC by Ted LaBar

Join us as we photograph two New York City houses of workshop and prominent landmarks.

We will begin at  St. Bartholomew's Church, commonly called St. Bart's. This is a historic Episcopal parish founded in January 1835. It is the lesser known of the two houses of worship but just as beautiful. 

After we photograph both the interior and exteriors we will make our way to the Cathedral of St. Patrick, commonly called St. Patrick's Cathedral. This is a Neo-Gothic-style Roman Catholic Church that you will quickly recognize as one of NYC's more visual locations.

Bring your fast lenses but leave the tripods at home for this event.


Stick around after we photograph both locations. We will find a nearby location for coffee and beverages.
results.how_to_find_us: We will meet outside the main entrance
results.name: Photograph St. Bart's & St. Patrick's, two prominent NYC houses of worship

results.description:
Hey Pebblers,

The next Pebble NYC Meetup will take place on Saturday, February 27, 1:00 pm to 5:00 pm at Grovo. We are thrilled to offer our first workshop in the Pebble From A to Z series: Pebble App Development with Pebble.js and CloudPebble.

During the workshop, you will have a chance to learn about Pebble app development using Pebble.js and CloudPebble. We will walk you through a Pebble app that will get the weather and update when you shake your Pebble (example project subject to change). We will not focus on watchface development this time around.

To get the most out of the workshop, you should come prepared to **actively** follow along.

Please bring your Pebble(s), relevant power supplies, a laptop with the ability to connect to the wireless network and your mobile phone.

If you are new to Pebble, we recommend you get your Pebble set up before the workshop begins. Check: https://help.getpebble.com/ for setup resources. 

Please also be sure to sign up on Open Weather Map to get an API for the walkthrough.

http://home.openweathermap.org/users/sign_up

You can also check in with us ten minutes before the official start of the workshop (12:50 pm) for assistance.


You may also want to establish a CloudPebble account ahead of the gathering: https://cloudpebble.net/.

Of course, we'll leave room following the workshop for snacks, hacking, demos and a raffle.

See you there!

Agenda:

12:50 pm

Pre-workshop Set Up

Pebble: So You Got a Pebble? Now What? Android – Getting Started | iOS – Getting Started

1:00 pm

Pebble: A Brief Overview and Introduction

OG Kickstarter | Steel | Time and Time SDK | Time Round | Time for OG | Health | Community

1:10 pm

Hacking Pebble: Software

Helper Tools | SDK vs Cloud | Pebblekit for iOS and Android | Languages | Architecture, Design and Debugging | Timeline | Health | Libraries & Other Resources | Publishing Software

1:55 pm

Demo/Workshop Project: Creating Pebble Apps with Javascript

2:10 pm

Break

2:25 pm

Hacking Pebble: Hardware

Helper Tools | Anatomy of a Pebble | Smartstraps | Arduino | Digital Fabrication | Soldering | Libraries & Other Resources Hardware

3:10 pm

Demo/Workshop Project: Incorporating Pebble's Sensors

3:25 pm

Putting it All Together

Snack While You Hack | Lightning Demos | Raffle

4:30 pm

Wrap up
results.name: Pebble From A to Z series: Pebble App Development with Pebble.js and CloudPebble

results.description:
It's a 11v11 game w/ full size goals at Williamsburg's BIP Field. Pls arrive early and be ready to go on time - Intermediate level.

All players must bring a white and black t-shirt. Pass the ball & have fun!

****************************************************************

Details:

1) Teams divide into equal ability - players are welcome to signup with friends.

2) No metal cleats. Turf shoes / molded cleats only. Wear proper Soccer attire.

3) Played in a fun & chill environment. Rough play, tackles, or sliding are not tolerated.

4) If no dedicated goalkeepers, all players need to rotate in goal. Full size goals.

5) If you arrive late, pls wait until a break in the game. Inserting players in the middle of the game disrupts the flow- it's not fair to those that arrive on time.


All players must RSVP and make payment before game time. This goes toward  field permits, equipment, meetup & CC fees.

CANCELLATIONS/REFUNDS:

If you cannot attend, you'll need to update the RSVP 24 hours before the match, in order to receive a match credit. This is so other members have a chance to take your place.

See you pitch side!

Grand FC

By joining this group and attending events you agree to the Waiver Of Liability.

results.description:
If you went to the Solstice Session last summer with us, I'm sure you remember what an awesome time we had!!  Well this event is the winter version of that.  Pitmaster, Tyson Ho, will be serving up all you can eat sausages, and not just any sausages, but crazy sausages like Thai green curry sausage!!  On the other hand we have NYC beer king, Chris Cuzme, organizing local breweries and homebrewers to bring rare, one off winter seasonals to go along with the endless links of sausage.  They estimate there will be around 25 rarely tasted beers to try out.  

**This is a ticketed event** You need to buy a ticket via the link below to attend this event.  However, for 45 bux, unlimited sausage and rare beer is a helluva deal!

http://www.brownpapertickets.com/event/2492401


The Logistics:  I will be there at 1 or hopefully a little before.  There are plenty of tables in the actual restaurant/bar plus they said they will set up heated tents in their outside area so we will take over a table as home base.  The Morgan Ave L train stop is the closest subway.  The event lasts 3 hours but we will likely hang around Arrogant Swine after it's over.

We will have returning Instructor Demond Carter from Purple Charlotte Steppers, NC

                                                                              317 Clermont Avenue

                                                                               Brooklyn, N.Y. 

                                                                                2nd Floor, Room 2 North

There will be instruction in the Fundamental basics of the dance in a way that will get you moving and executing moves with comfort your very first class!

For those with previous Ballroom Experience, this will give you the opportunity to increase your repetoire,  and perfect mechanics.

We recommend (but don't require) that women wear comfortable shoes with a slight heel and that the Gents wear leather soled shoes.

$15pp

No partner necessary

RSVP is encouraged and helpful to your hosts.

New York, New Jersey and Connecticut, Please join us!

results.description:
Storytelling is an empowering and enriching tool for building confidence, self-awareness and creativity. This is a 3-week workshop to EMPOWER you to tell your STORY, with your own VOICE, in your own WAY. 

Did you know that public speaking is one of the biggest fears next to death? So, it’s no surprise that many people have a difficult time expressing and articulating their thoughts, feelings and opinions in front of an audience, whether it be an audience of one or one hundred. 

• Are you looking to enhance your ability to speak more effectively?

• Have you had a difficult time engaging in conversations with others in social gatherings?

• Are you a little shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking?

• Are you a professional hoping to be more confident during work meetings and in interactions with co-workers? 

In this class you will obtain that and a whole lot more! I'm confident that you will leave more knowledgeable, self-confident, motivated and enthusiastic, to tackle the challenges of daily life, whether at work or in your personal life. 

This workshop is designed with interactive activities to teach the basics of good storytelling. You will learn how to create fun, engaging, and stimulating stories, and have a chance to practice speaking and sharing those stories with personalized feedback.

YOU WILL LEARN:

•  How to tell your story effectively

• How to engage in personal practices that will assist you in building your confidence

• How to make any story interesting and engaging by adding your own uniqueness

• Why your story is important

• How learning to craft your story leads to more confidence, freedom and empowerment

WHO IS THIS CLASS IS FOR? 

Anyone who wants to strengthen their skills in storytelling to transform themselves in social interactions, work presentations, and build overall confidence when engaging with others

LOGISTICS:


• Please bring water.


• Door closes at 1:15pm, so please get there before then or else you might be locked out.

CLASS DATES:

• Workshop 1: Saturday, Feb 27


• Workshop 2: Saturday, Mar 5


• Workshop 3: Saturday, Mar 12

INSTRUCTOR:

Pasha Cook is a life and personal development coach. She facilitates athlete transition workshops, leadership development trainings, and character-building seminars. She has a mission to empower others with her encouraging message, “Discovering Your Inner Champion.” 


Learn more about Pasha at pashacook.com.
results.name: Storytelling Workshop: Your Story, Your Voice, Your Way (3-WEEK SERIES)

results.description:
Haunted all her life by feelings of terror and emptiness, forty-nine-year-old Urania Cabral returns to her native Dominican Republic - and finds herself reliving the events of 1961, when the capital was still called Trujillo City and one old man terrorized a nation of three million. Rafael Trujillo, the depraved ailing dictator whom Dominicans call the Goat, controls his inner circle with a combination of violence and blackmail. In Trujillo's gaudy palace, treachery and cowardice have become a way of life. But Trujillo's grasp is slipping. There is a conspiracy against him, and a Machiavellian revolution already underway that will have bloody consequences of its own. In this 'masterpiece of Latin American and world literature, and one of the finest political novels ever written' ("Bookforum"), Mario Vargas Llosa recounts the end of a regime and the birth of a terrible democracy, giving voice to the historical Trujillo and the victims, both innocent and complicit, drawn into his deadly orbit.

The sum of votes from the poll and the December Meetup was as follows--
The Feast of the Goat by Mario Vargas Llosa--9
We Need New Names by NoViolet Bulawayo--8
City of Bohane by Kevin Barry--3
results.name: February -- The Feast of the Goat by Mario Vargas Llosa

results.description:
** Saturday Afternoon Open Play/Clinic Combos**

We now offer, Beginner, Intermediate and occasionally Advanced, Saturday afternoon Combined Open Play/Clinics for the UNBELIEVABLE PRICE of $14.00 for a 3 hr. Session!

An Open Play/Clinic! What’s that?........It is our unique creation! Three hours of Open Play and Clinic combined! Here’s how it works. 3 teams of 8 players each alternate playing games on one of our 2 main courts at Brandeis H.S. (84th st. bet Columbus & Amsterdam) Now get this, while the third team is out, instead of sitting around, that team gets a clinic (8 players to one coach) on our back court at Brandeis with a top instructor. When the two teams finish their game on the main court, one comes off for instruction. Meanwhile, the players that just received instruction take what they just learned and use it in the next game. This rotation continues for 3 hrs! It is a great way to meet new players and improve your skills at the same time.  It is an absolutely unbelievable deal!

***Please note- RSVP'g on Meetup will not reserve your spot. Please go to our website to sign up.*** A credit card payment is required to reserve your space.

http://nyurban.com/open-play-registration-vb/?filter_id=1&gametypeid=1

results.description:
CO-ED PICKUP SOCCER GAMES in Sara D. Roosevelt Park!

                       NO CLEATS or PLASTIC STUDS

                           See our page on Facebook!:

       facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=TS2aJpXPgho

Game description:
We'll play two simultaneous games of 7 on 7.
There will be 4 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team.

RULES OF THE GAME:
First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!
Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.
No power shots allowed.
If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.
If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.
Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.
Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location and Directions:

Sara D. Roosevelt Park, Nike Field
Take the F train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side, and walk for about 3 minutes on Chrystie Street to the Nike Field between Stanton St & Rivington St
New York, NY 10002
Call me if you can’t find the field - [masked] Manny S.

What to bring with you:
A positive attitude, pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes, shin guards (recommended) and lots of water.

Fee:
You will be asked to pay $9.50 dollars when you RSVP. This $9.50 dollars is used to pay for, permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:
Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled.
The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Slánte for brunch and a Pint or Two:

                                                        Slánte

                                                  304 Bowery

                                           New York, NY 10012

                                               (212)[masked]

If you’re experiencing a little cabin fever, hike on over to the Bergen County Players for a warm, cultural Saturday afternoon! 

 Why pay Broadway prices when we can enjoy our local theaters with free parking and tickets ONLY $11 for this exceptional limited show! SOLD OUT AS OF FEB. 11TH. CHECK[masked] FOR POSSIBLE TICKET CANCELLATIONS. 

The Irish Curse 

February 27th - February 28th

Written by Martin Casella
Directed by Ray Yucis

A basement meeting hall in a Catholic church is the setting for this wickedly funny play about a self-help group for men with certain “shortcomings” regarding their anatomy.  From its blistering language to its brutally honest look at sex and body image, the 90 minute production performed without intermission is “one of the best plays of the year!  Truly original, truly hysterical and truly touching. You will be enthralled!” TALK ENTERTAINMENT

Contains Intense Adult Themes and Strong Language

Should make for some interesting dinner conversations!

Call the box office at[masked] or order online at www.bcplayers.org.

and  RESERVE SEATS IN ROWS  L, M, O,  P, Q, R, S and T  so that we can sit together.  The sooner you get your tickets the better chance we have of sitting together, though it is a small theatre so we can always visit one another!    Please post your seats in the comment boxes so others can see where you will be sitting. results.description:
All levels practice. Coached by Granger.

This practice is about water polo. Emphasis is on playing and learning the game by playing. Some of us have been playing since childhood. Others have picked it up as adults. We're friendly and inclusive, but we play hard.

Requirements:

-You have to join New York Recreation. $75 for 6 months for access to all rec centers and pools in the city. If you're under 25, you pay $25 for 1 year. http://www.nycgovparks.org/programs/recreation-centers/membership

-Beginners are welcome, but you must be a good swimmer.

-You MUST bring a lock for a gym locker.

results.description:
PLEASE READ THE INFORMATION BELOW CAREFULLY, ESPECIALLY THE BOLD TYPE.

If you are registered for this walk and can't attend, please change your RSVP online from "YES" to "NO". THERE IS NO NEED TO POST WHY YOU CAN'T MAKE THE EVENT. 

HAVE EXTRA LAYERS OF CLOTHING. PLEASE DRESS PROPERLY FOR THE WINTER CONDITIONS. WHEN WE ARE WALKING AROUND MALBA, WE WILL BE NEAR THE WATERFRONT, SO IT WILL FEEL COLDER THERE!

I also scheduled this same walk on Saturday, March 26th.

This is a sociable walk along a very scenic route filled with interesting places. I will occasionally comment on some things (the architecture and social history of some of the new/old buildings in the neighborhoods of Northern Flushing, Victorian Whitestone, and Malba) along the way, but you will have plenty of time to socialize with others. We will, once in a while, stop at points of interest. This walk is about 5 miles and moderate paced. (IF YOU CAN'T KEEP UP WITH A MODERATE PACE FOR 5 MILES, THEN THIS WALK IS NOT GOOD FOR YOU.)

According to the MTA website, the No. 7 subway train will have normal service going from Manhattan to Flushing on Saturday, February 27th.

http://travel.mtanyct.info/serviceadvisory/routeStatusResult.aspx?tag=7&date=02/27/2016&time=&method=getstatus4

If you have any questions for me, please contact me through my private Meetup inbox. The organizer for this Meetup event is John (the Event Host) who is listed on the top of the "going list" with a photo. 

Description: We'll be walking through three neighborhoods: Northern Flushing, Whitestone, and Malba. Some of the old houses in these neighborhoods have survived; while others have been demolished for modern development.  We'll be viewing a number of old houses including the "stockbroker" English Tudor, a surprisingly cute miniature French Second Empire house, a Queen-Anne style beauty, a green-roofed house with multicolored tiling, and a mansard roofed boarding house that once housed the working-class in the 19th century. We'll also be looking at some of the newer buildings including a salmon-colored stucco palazzo, Mediterrean-style palaces with red Spanish tiled roofs, Afghan Mosque made partly of mable, Greek Orthodox Church with multiple round domes, Korean Buddhist Temple made of wood, and Russian Orthodox Church with an onion-shaped blue dome.

The neighborhood of Malba doesn't have any commercial establishments, multi-family homes, or public transportation; therefore, people living in Malba usually travel around by automobile or boat/yacht. Some call Malba the "Beverly Hills of the East Coast." We'll first look at some of the houses in Northern Flushing and then head to Whitestone, which has some lovely Victorian-era houses and new churches. However, we'll have to walk (about 15 to 20 blocks) through a mostly ordinary-looking section of Whitestone to get to an interesting section of Whitestone and ritzy Malba.

Cost: The cost of this event is $2 per person, which is paid at the start of the walk. This is for the organizer’s Meetup preparation costs and fees.

Meeting Time/Place:  The meeting time is (after lunch) at 1:45 PM. The meeting place is outside of the entrance to McDonalds Restaurant at[masked] Roosevelt Avenue (on the north side of the street between Main Street and Union Street). Before the walk, restrooms are available in Macy's Department Store, which is directly across the street from McDonald's Restaurant. The restrooms in Macy's are located on the second floor, next to the Shoe/Sneaker Department.

Public Transportation by subway: Take the No. 7 subway train to Main Street, Flushing. This is the last stop on the No. 7 train subway. Allow extra time because this train makes local stops to Main Street, Flushing.

Public Transportation by the LIRR: You can also take the Long Island Railroad from Nassau County to Flushing, Queens OR the Long Island Railroad from Penn Station in Manhattan to Flushing, Queens. Below is the schedule of the Port Washington Branch of the Long Island Railroad.

http://web.mta.info/lirr/Timetable/Branch/PortWashingtonBranch.pdf

Finishing Time/Place:  The walk finishes about 5:10 PM at 14th Avenue/Parsons Bouvelard (just outside of Malba). At that point, we'll be taking a bus, the Q 44 (which is a NYC bus) back to Main Street/39th Avenue in Flushing. The Q 44 has frequent service on Saturdays, running every 8 or 9 minutes.

Because the Q 44 is a select bus service (SBS), passengers will have to pay the fare at a machine (which is at the bus stop) before boarding the bus and then get a receipt of payment from the machine. Paying the fare this way speeds up the boarding process. You can also buy a Metrocard at another machine located at this bus stop.

The bus ride from 14th Avenue/Parsons Boulevard to Main Street, Flushing takes about 14 minutes. You can then use the Metrocard to transfer from the city bus  to the subway (No. 7 train). This is only one fare.

Rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions will cancel this walk. Therefore, if it is rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions or the forecast is for rainy/snowy weather or cold/windy conditions, I will post a cancellation notice on Saturday morning. This walk will only happen in good weather conditions. If I don't post a cancellation notice, I plan to be at the meeting place. If I do cancel the walk, I will also post a cancellation notice on the Discussion Board.

(Source The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, March 13, 1927)

Below was Richard Hellman's mansion in Northern Flushing. Richard Hellman began selling mayonnaise that was made from his wife's recipe. He later trademarked his "Blue Ribbon" mayonnaise label. In 1915, Hellman built this stately mansion that was surrounded by plenty of lawn space, but a developer tore the mansion down in the 1950s and replaced it with a sprawling garden apartment complex. Even though a number of these beautiful houses on Northern Flushing have been torn down, some houses/mansions still stand.(Source Driscoll, James, Flushing[masked], NY:Arcadia Publishing, 2005)

The real estate partners who created Malba in 1908 arranged the initials of their surnames: George A. Maycock, Sammuel R. Avis, George W. Lewis, Nobel P. Bishop, and David A. Alling. They were affiliated with the Realty Trust Company, run by William Ziegler, the Baking Powder King. (Source The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, October 3, 1908)

(Source The Brooklyn Daily Eagle, April 29, 1923)

Below is Malba today. Many of the big older homes were bought and gutted to the ground only to be replaced with even bigger and more spectacular mansions. Only zoning laws prevent these houses from becoming even bigger!

Not only are the houses big but also the birds' nests are big...
results.name: Northern Flushing to Malba, Queens Walk (Feb. 27)

group.name: NYC/NJ Walks: Explore Architecture, Art, History & Sculpture

results.description:
I have been a little flaky about scheduling events this winter for our group, so I am scheduling 2 for February.  This one takes place at the Good Shepherd Methodist Church.  If you haven't been to an APAC production, you are in for a surprise.  Right in our own backyard (near the hospital), APAC offers professional quality productions as well as community programs (like the Senior Stars---more on that later, but I hope you become part of the cast this year--or at least the audience!)

Anyway, this is an interesting production of a group of very short plays about Astoria.  Here is their description:

Following our recent <a>announcement of the writers for Astoria Stories</a>, we are pleased to announce the cast and creative team!

We have six APAC alums in our Astoria Stories cast: Alex Akin (Merrily We Roll Along), Marcie Henderson* (Ragtime, The Human Comedy, Allegro), Greg Horton* (Merrily We Roll Along, Lucky Stiff), Sheila Joon* (Carefully Taught), Nicholas Park* (Merrily We Roll Along), and Laura Stracko (Allegro).

We also welcome the newest members of our APAC artist family: Mauricio Pita (Theater 167), Sai Somboon* (Sleep No More), Vanessa Spica (New York City Children's Theater), and Production Stage Manager Jessica Pecharsky*.

In addition to the actors, the Astoria Stories creative team includes MORE APAC alums: Music Director James Higgins (Senior Stars 2015), Lighting Designer Dan Jobbins (Children of Eden, The Human Comedy, The Secret Garden, Blood Brothers, Allegro, In The Bones), Production Designer Katie White (The Cottage, Allegro, Merrily We Roll Along), and Director Dev Bondarin (In The Bones, Merrily We Roll Along)

To attend, please sign up on the Red Hats site to let us know you are going, then purchase tickets (only $10!) here:

https://apps.vendini.com/ticket-software.html?t=tix&e=fa41d9e380f3ea5be537a85ca0b1ceab&vqitq=77d70593-d0fa-4ef1-ad71-ed7a459f7e88&vqitp=aca92599-9392-4791-994a-c495d29ee9ee&vqitts=1454772586&vqitc=vendini&vqite=itl&vqitrt=Safetynet&vqith=13f00ec2cd75e39e321a975ed7f7aaf1


There are no reserved seats, so it is suggested you come about 1/2 hour early.  Earliest arrivals can save some seats for us.

See you there.

Pat

PS if anyone wants to go to lunch first at someplace within walking distance, let me know and I'll pass it on.
