results.description:
MUST Register here to attend!

On Feb. 27th at 11AM, TSAA-SF will host Anna and David Coulling who will be discussing Volume Price Analysis (VPA).


Anna Coulling is a full time currency, commodities and equities trader. Anna’s approach to the market is unique. She takes a three dimensional view, based on technical, fundamental and relational analysis. This powerful approach, when combined with price action and candle patterns, has given her a deep and detailed knowledge of the forces that drive the financial markets, which is then reflected in the underlying market sentiment.


David Coulling day trades most markets including the indices, commodities and forex. David also develops and programs trading tools and indicators. Anna has written many books (all available on Amazon), but if you could read just one, she recommends ‘A Complete Guide to Volume Price Analysis’. The reason being is that once you have mastered this methodology, it can be applied to all markets and all instruments and will then underpin your approach to trading using other technical indicators. In other words, this is the foundation on which your trading analysis is built – everything else just helps confirm your analysis.


In this TSAA-SF webinar, Anna and David will go over their trading approach and go into detail on how to use Volume Price Analysis (VPA) in your own trading. Please join us for this interesting and informative webinar.
results.name: Improve your trading success using VPA with Anna and David Coulling

This conversation is structured around the questions and answers in Pat Love, Ph.D. and Jon Carlson, Ph.D.'s summary episode aired TV Series "LOVE:  What Everyone Need to Know" shown CUNY TV every Tuesday at 10PM, TV Channel 25-3.  http://www.cuny.tv/show/love/PR1010105   

We will discuss the final episode titled "The True Source of Happiness."

Bring your questions and share your collective wisdom.

--Greet old friends and meet new ones.

https://youtu.be/t9inKtShHcI

CUNY TV - CH 25-3.  Tuesdays - 10:00am, 4:00pm, 10:00pm.  Wednesdays 3:00am. 

About the CUNY TV series, "Love:  What Everyone Needs to Know."

"According to psychologists, the single greatest predictor of happiness and success in life is a healthy love relationship. Yet, although we concede that knowledge is power, most of us have only a rudimentary understanding of what we’re in for when we go off in search of true love. 

LOVE demystifies this all-important predictor of happiness, defining the nature of true love and outlining the commitment it takes to keep it alive. This telecourse is taught by two distinguished doctors: Dr. Pat Love, a licensed Marriage and Family Therapist and relationship consultant, and Dr. Jon Carlson, a university professor and Psychologist. Both instructors are practicing clinicians and have authored books and articles that have attracted national recognition. They challenge students to confront assumptions on the nature of love and to critically analyze the ideals perpetuated by popular culture in order to realize the wisdom it takes to find lasting love."

Suggestions:

A. Listen to understand while suspending judgment.

B. Make one point at a time and allow others to respond. Speak from personal experience.

C. Identify the underlying assumptions. Look for new insights.

Note – Meetup nor the participants neither screens participants, nor supervises or controls meetings, and we have no special involvement with any of the individuals who participate. Therefore, we suggest that participants exercise good judgment when attending.

Participants are:

- expected to honor each other's stated boundaries and to respect their privacy 
- not obligated to provide information or answer any questions against their will 
- encouraged to share only information they feel comfortable with sharing 
- expected to maintain confidentiality and not reshare personal information without permission from the owner.

Please be advised that meetup is NOT a forum for dating, proselytizing, therapy, or for employees or independent contractors to introduce, promote, or sell goods and/or services, or for any unlawful activity. Participants voluntarily agree to participate by showing up. Thank you.

About the Moderator:  Yen is a divorced parent of two, manager, and former educator.  Yen is currently trading about $[masked] dollar.
results.name: Is Love the True Source of Happiness? Pat Love's CUNY TV Series Summary Episode

results.description:
My gay history and art tour company, Oscar Wilde Tours, has some pretty popular tours, but none is as popular as our "Gay Secrets" tour of the Metropolitan. On this tour, we discover some of the Met’s queer treasures, from ancient Greek nudes (and erotic vase-painting, which is my academic expertise) to homoerotic paintings from the Renaissance, and a panoply of modern works, some by LGBT artists, some portraying LGBT people and some expressing same-sex desire. We learn about famous pieces—from Michelangelo’s Cupid to Picasso’s portrait of Gertrude Stein—but in addition we explore lesser-known artists and works that are often ignored. And we delve into the fascinating forms of homosexuality in other cultures, such as same-sex initiation rites in New Guinea, represented in the Met’s Oceania collection. It’s all part of the hidden gay story in our city's great art museum, and I promise it will change your view of the Met!

I apologize in advance for charging so much ($35 regular, $15 students and Met members) but sadly the museum charges a steep admission for group members. And note that the tour usually costs $49, so this is a discount rate (of course).
results.how_to_find_us: We'll meet by the colossal statue of Pharaoh Amenhamet in the main (82nd St) lobby.
results.name: Learn about the LGBT secrets of the Metropolitan Museum!

results.description:
Hello meetup members of Bojagi and traditional Korean craft arts,

Create your own Korean/Asian Knotting bracelet/necklace at a workshop in Manhattan next Saturday. You can learn how to make your own modern artistic and practical works using traditional silk knots.
Join us. After learning the knots, you can make knot pin, necklace, hairpin and so on. For more information,visit the photo albums of Korean traditional knots on meetup.com
http://www.meetup.com...­

Space is limited. RSVP required. Date and Time: Saturday, February 27/ 2-4pm /$20(includes materials) 

Place: 69 Charlton Street(SOHO), New York, NY10014 

Maedeup, the traditional Korean knot, developed into a distinctive decorative art and practical use through its long history. It was used in not only fashion, household and ritual items but also court ceremonies, the lives of the common people. It was also used to adorn musical instruments, fans, dresses, flags and palanquins. Today, knots are widely used as modern ornaments in accessories and for art.

Thank you so much,
KJ Ahn
results.name: Asian/Korean Knot Jewelry Workshop in Manhattan

results.description:
****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****


Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 15 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.

Our typical agenda: - We orient new visitors and then chat a bit, as by sharing what's new or good in our lives. - Then we chant and meditate together, together with the beautiful sounds of a gong - And finally we share thoughts and questions, learning something new sometimes, generally supporting each other best we can at all times.

Note that we meet every Wednesday, 7:30 to 9 pm, and every Saturday, 2 to 3:30 pm on Midchester Ave. -- except for the first Saturday of the month, when we meet elsewhere and begin our meeting at 5 pm, followed by an informal potluck social starting about 7 pm.

(When you plan on staying for the potluck, see the log-in information posted at our monthly potluck page. That helps us get healthy, balanced meals.)

By the way, the meetup page may show only a few members planning to attend a particular meeting. That's because many people attend regularly and don't bother to RSVP for each meeting.  We never have only a few members at a meeting. Twenty members more usually attend each meeting.

Please set up a Python 3.5 virtual environment and preinstall:
• pip install jupyter
• pip install pandas

Topics Covered:
• Pandas vs. Excel
• Jupyter/IPython vs. traditional Python
• Importing data
• Filtering
• Calculated columns
• Exporting
• Data frames vs. series
• Date parsing
• Basic plotting
• Limits of Pandas
• If time:
• Groupby/aggregations
• Concatenation

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Saturday February 27, 2:00PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
Join us for our weekly Underwater Rugby (UWR) practice!

Underwater what? Underwater rugby is probably the most exciting activity you may have ever done. The only 3D sport (apart from Harry Potter’s Quidditch), great endurance, fast, strategic, and above all: extreme fun! Imagine a 13ft-deep pool, 2 baskets on the bottom of each side. Two teams, equipped with fins, mask&snorkel, and a salt-water filled ball. We hold our breath when playing at 3, 5, 13 feet below the surface and pass the ball standing on our heads, swimming sideways and swirling around. Yes, we can tackle the person who carries the ball. But no, no one ever drowned in the 60 years the sport has been around. Ladies and gents are equally welcome - we are co-ed :)

We have all the equipment you need if you want to try. Just let us know and jump with us into the water - we welcome all levels (though you should be able to swim and be comfortable with the idea of swimming under the water - but you don't need to be an expert diver). 

So just send us a quick line and new experiences await - we promise!

Contact Daniel or Rolexi at [masked]

And check out our Facebook profile www.facebook.com/NJ.UWH.UWR/

<a href="http://g.co/maps/ueppk"></a>

results.description:
NEW VOICES IN THEATER 2016 presents


a STAGED READING of "THE INEVITABLE SADNESS OF ALL THANGS GUD" by playwright Dui Jarrod

South Oxford Space- a project of A.R.T. New York

The Great Room

138 S. Oxford

Brooklyn, NY 11217 (2,3,4,5,Q,B to Barclays-Atlantic; A to Fulton; G to Lafayette)

Time:   2-5pm


             Open bar, refreshments 2pm

             Reading 2:30pm sharp!

Cost:    $10 (suggested donation)

              *Includes Open Bar and refreshments!

There will be a Talk-Back session with the author and cast following the Reading.  Become a part of the creative process!  Listen, enjoy, and provide our playwright the feedback he is looking for.

Synopsis

Before the water rose, there was a KING.

New Orleans, LA.

King, a hard-living hood dude, begins to face the realities of his mortality after the violent death of his best friend.  Upon seeking his own redemption, King gets a vision from “The One on Top” (God) to start a church to save the neighborhood from itself.  As he prepares for the opening of the church, his pain-ridden family, his past, and Hurricane Katrina swirl- threatening the only purpose he’s ever known.

About The Playwright- Dui Jarrod     


Jarrod is a screenwriter, director, playwright and essayist residing in Brooklyn, NY. His work focuses on the power of human connection in the landscape of modern America. As a screenwriter, Jarrod found acclaim with his most recent screenplay Lesson Before Love, which he directed as well. This work was rewarded with numerous festival accolades and awards, and a theatrical release of the film. The film went on to be named one of the years best by NewsOne and Rolling Out Magazine and is currently available at Redbox nationwide.

Dui has also found success as a director, working for BET, MTV Voices and several other production companies, where he served as the creative visionary for some high-profile projects. He was featured on the ABC News “What’s the BUZZ” segment, recognizing him as a young talented director on the rise. Through his work as a playwright, he has traveled on regional tours, garnering several writing and acting awards along the way.

In 2013, Jarrod presented his fourth play Unholy War to a Brooklyn audience and is currently presenting his one-man show The Definitive Loser’s Guide To Winning. His work focuses of the power of human connection in the landscape of modern America.

___

Any inquiries, please contact Marty Majeske, [masked], [masked] or (917) 302-3808.

results.description:
Basic Ground Rules for Participation

Please wear either a blue/black or white shirt to make things easy (Preferably bring both in case we need to mix the teams more evenly).


no need to respond at all if you can't/don't want to play

• if you do respond IN, please come unless something really urgent comes up (hangovers or better offers from your cooler friends not accepted for absences!)


• If you suck at Ultimate... you are more than welcome. This is open to ALL skill levels, ages etc. If you're really good, please pretend you suck every once in a while for the benefit of the rest of us! We're just here to run around and have fun. We all want to score and win but if you want to win at all costs, this is not the game for you.

• The trick with this group is making sure we have enough to play, so those who do show up don't waste a trip, so please make the effort this year to be honest with yourself and us about if you can/want to come down so we can make the right call for GAME ON or GAME OFF. If you are a "maybe" please indicate that via the comment section with a brief explanation (ie 80% chance I'll be there...). If you RSVP and are then unable to attend, please update your RSVP as soon as possible.

What is Ultimate Frisbee? In a nutshell <borrowed from Wiki> :

Ultimate is a limited-contact team field sport played with a disc (frisbee). Points are scored by passing the disc to a teammate in the opposing end zone. Other basic rules are that players must not take steps while holding the disc (maintain a pivot), and interceptions and incomplete passes are turnovers.

Closest analogy I could come up with = a mix of basketball and football, but played with a frisbee. You do not need to be an expert frisbee player/thrower etc. - it's all about having fun.
results.name: NEW TIME - Saturday Ultimate Frisbee (Anderson Park)

Under Lee Reiser, ACA level ll instructor, will help you hone your existing skills, learn new ones properly and introduce new people to the world of kayaking. The sessions are as follows:
Course 1 Saturday - Nov. 14,21; Dec. 5, 12 (completed)
Course 2 " - Jan. 9, 16, 23, 30 (completed)
Course 3 " - Feb. 6, 13, 27; March 5
The time for volunteers to practice is from 3 to 4 pm and the time to volunteer is from 4 to 6 pm. Please arrive at least 15 minutes before so you can get ready. Pack a small bag with your change of clothes. The pool is heated but you may want to wear a wet suit, bringing your own PFD, paddle and skirt can add to your comfort level. Pack a small bag with a change of clothes, towel etc and bring a lock for the lockers.
Please fill out the volunteer packet which can be obtained from the Yonkers Club site: http://www.yprc.org
click on the Riverbank link once you are in the site and download the NY community Kayak Program packet. If you commit to at least 1 session you will be provided with a parking pass.

DIRECTIONS- From 138th St. head west and make a left onto 12th Ave., Take the 1st right beneath the West Side Hwy (by the restaurant) then swing right again past the first guard booth. Follow the roadway in and around, curve left and make a hard left U-turn into the parking area. Use the elevator to get to the park on the upper level walk to the pool area. Make sure you have a parking permit in your car window. Please car pool as parking is limited.

SEE NOV. 21, 2015 FOR ADDITIONAL INFORMATION

results.description:
Get ready for a big shakeup at the U.S. Supreme Court in a run up to the 2016 Elections!  The theme for this meetup, as suggested by the title, will be on the current and future states of the Supreme Court in relation to the other branches of the government in this important Election Year.


-------------------------------------------------------


Part I: in light of the recent passing of the Supreme Court Justice, Antonin Scalia, we'll take a critical look at his jurisprudential legacy.  We'll look at different doctrines of Constitutional interpretation known as an "Originalism" or a "Textualism" -- often attributed to Justice Scalia. We'll also examine his legal philosophies, as one of the most influential and inimitable jurists in the recent decades in the following areas of the law: individual rights, "social" issues, Federalism, and the Separation of Powers.


To that end, we'll examine a handful of the seminal cases — some written by Fmr. Justice Scalia in a leading majority opinion; others in a concurring or plurality opinion; and some in a form of a scathing yet colorful dissenting opinions.

• Texas v. Johnson (1989) — upheld an act of flag burning as a "protected speech" under the First Amendment.

• Employment Div. v. Smith (1990) — held that an individual's religious beliefs (e.g., the use of peyote) do not excuse that individual from compliance with an otherwise valid law, prohibiting conduct that government is free to regulate.

• Lee v. Weisman (1992) — held that prayers in public schools violate the Establishment Clause of the First Amendment, based on the newly-adopted "Coercion Test."

• Planned Parenthood v. Casey (1992) — in upholding the constitutionality of abortions, as set forth in Roe v. Wade, the Court altered the standard for analyzing the restrictions on that right.


• Lawrence v. Texas (2003) — the Court struck down state sodomy laws, under the substantive due process protection of the Fourteenth Amendment.


• Gonzales v. Raich (2005) — an expansive interpretation of Commerce Clause allowing Congress to regulate noneconomic intrastate activities in some instances.

• D.C. v. Heller (2008) — held that the Second Amendment is an individual right, intimately tied to the natural right of self-defense.

• Citizens United v. F.E.C. (2010) — held that the First Amendment prohibited the government from restricting independent political expenditures by certain corporations.

-------------------------------------------------------


Part II: exploring the intersection of politics and the Court -- we'll discuss how the sudden vacancy at the Court will impact the Capitol Hill politics and the 2016 Elections, including:


• The legal precedent and parliamentary maneuvers likely to be invoked by both sides of the aisle to advance their agenda.


• The likely political tensions to be faced during the Senate approval process — presuming that the nomination is not blocked.

• The political pressures for those Senators who are up for reelection this year.


-------------------------------------------------------

Part III: finally, we'll preview the blockbuster cases currently before the Court, including:

  •   Obamacare -- contraception coverage requirement.

  •   New abortion restrictions in Texas.

  •   Affirmative action in Texas -- whether if race can be one of the factors in admissions (Fisher II).

  •   The constitutionality of Executive Action on Climate Change initiatives.

  •  The constitutionality of Executive Action on unsettled immigration policies.

  •   Whether public sector union can impose  dues to all of its members.
results.name: Law & Politics: Justice Scalia's legacy and the future of the Supreme Court

=============================================

Though just twelve streets long and two avenues wide, West Chelsea is the premiere district for art galleries in New York City, with over 200. On this private tour we will visit 6-12 selected ones. Highlights will include exclusive talks by owners and staff that will give us greater insight into the exhibits.

The tour will be led by Savona Bailey-McClain, founder and executive director of the West Harlem Art Fund, an organization that promotes art and culture in parks and other open spaces across NYC, as well as galleries. She has been involved in numerous public art installations and was recently selected to join TINA, a new international network for contemporary art curators based in Italy. In addition, she hosts "State of the Arts NYC", a weekly radio program airing Fridays on WBAI, 99.5 FM.

IMPORTANT:

- Prepay here:

https://www.paypal.com/cgi-bin/webscr?cmd=_s-xclick&hosted_button_id=AHBVKF4WM7Y6S

- If you tried to use the above link but had trouble with Paypal, an alternate payment link on Brown Paper Tickets will be emailed upon request. This will require an extra $1 charge to help cover the higher fees with this processor.

- On February 26 (one day before), the price will go up to $25 if the event has not sold out. Purchasing your spot as early as possible is recommended.

- RSVP without payment does NOT reserve your spot or lock in the price.

- Online payment deadline is 10:30am on the day of the tour.

results.description:
PLEASE NOTE THIS IS A CASH ONLY ESTABLISHMENT!!

How signing up works: There are 5 spots besides myself for this meetup. 

Please sign up on the waitlist. After 48 hours, if there are less than or equal to 5 people (excluding myself) signed up I will move everyone to the going list and afterwards signing up will be like normal. If there are more than 5 people, I will give priority to those who have previously been on the waitlist and were not able to attend a prior meetup. 

The Place: 

Located a 5 minute walk from the Staten Island Ferry, this intimate wine bar and restaurant features the culinary creations of authentic nonnas (grandmas) directly from Italy. It was selected by the Food Network as 1 of the 5 best Italian restaurants in the country. So come join us in our first foray into Staten Island!

http://www.enotecamaria.com/wp/


RSVPs: 

Please do not RSVP No. You only need to RSVP if you want to come to the event.

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I notice the people who RSVP and then cancel, which is not fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better, but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come. 

Even if the meetup is full, please put your name on the waitlist. I will let you know if a spot becomes available. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist, it lets me know which kind of restaurants are popular so that I may schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Enoteca Maria - Regional Italian on Staten Island

results.description:
Once again, it's ON - at Buffalo Wild Wings, Harlem. This adult event will be open and free to everyone - members and their guests - just be sure to RSVP and add your 'pluses' so that you'll be on the list to receive a wristband for the food & drink specials listed below!

When you arrive at Buffalo Wild Wings, you'll be greeted by a BWW host member at the desk. Let them know you're on the list (with your RSVP) with the HarlemGo Meetup for the Games Day event. After checking your name(s) on the RSVP list, the BWW host will give you a wristband to wear, which will give you food & drink specials from 3pm - 6pm, exclusively for the group members and their 'pluses'.

When you arrive to the second floor, then ask for Daniel, who'll introduce you to other members of the group. From there, you can order some food/drink or you can simply get started on playing your favorite board & card games.


As for the room layout, there will be a table with board games, card games, and digital trivia games which allow for multiple players which can be played on the screens. All you will have to do is pick a game and wait for some more players, or simply join a game already in progress! 


Decks of cards for Spades, etc. • Uno • Taboo • Cards Against Humanity • Dominoes • Battle of the Sexes • Chess / Checkers • Connect Four • Scategories • Cranium • Guesstures • Jenga • Scrabble & more

There will also be some open tables for people who would like to bring their own games - feel free to bring your favorite.

The event starts at 3pm and is officially over at 8pm, but may run a little longer, depending on energy/turnout/interest.


If you have any questions, feel free to post them below in the comments section or call/text Daniel @ 774.275.3646.

Directions to Buffalo Wild Wings - Harlem

Take the A, B,C or D subway trains to 125th Street, walk 1 avenue east to Frederick Douglass Blvd. (8th Avenue) then down one block to 124th street. The venue is 2 doors away from Magic Johnson Theaters.

This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

   People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

   I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members:  This is the first you have heard from me. I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

PRENATAL WALKING & YOGA GROUP IN BROOKLYN, PROSPECT PARK

Join prenatal yoga instructor Sofia and birth doula Kyra for a weekly walk through Prospect Park with a thirty minutes prenatal yoga class at the end of the walk.

The walking moms at 9AM at the entrance of the Brooklyn Public Library. We will start our walk at 9:15AM, which will take around 45 minutes, followed by a 30 minute prenatal yoga session.

results.description:
Art on the Corner (AotC) is thrilled to bring the sounds of Arabic and Flamenco music (and dancing!) to our corner in Bay Ridge in celebration of the diversity that thrives in our corner of New York City.  

A "Wine and Sweets Reception" with opportunities to participate in raffles for prizes donated by local businesses, artists, and individuals, follows the concert in the adjacent Soul Café. (Wine is not included in the ticket fee.)

Seating for this performance is "reserved" only (open seating at Soul Cafe afterwards). When you purchase your tickets online, you'll choose a row and seat number (for performance only). Center seating is $30 per person; side seating is $20 per person. Tickets are available here, at Brown Paper Tickets:  http://aotcnewandalucia.bpt.me/  Use this code for $5 discount on ticket purchase page:  AOTC$5ThankYou.  Click on button 'see available seats' after entering discount.  NOTE this facility is wheelchair accessible.

I already bought mine, and they will go FAST.  So if you want to join us, don't hesitate to purchase yours!!

Proceeds from this event (their annual fundraiser) will benefit AotC's programming efforts, as well as the Karam Foundation, a non-profit organization that provides emergency aid to families under siege in Syria in the form of basic food supplies, infant formula, and winter relief -- wood-burning heaters, wood to burn, and heating fuel.

CONCERT BACKSTORY
In 711 A.D., Arabs crossed Gibraltar into Iberia and for the next eight centuries a tremendous exchange took place. Great minds, ideas and art crossed the strait of Gibraltar (Jabal Tariq) back and forth and created a rich mix that transcended the boundaries of religion, ethnicity and language. It is in this esthemus, this land in between, that giants such as Averroes, Maimonides, Alfonso El Sabio and Zyriab emerged. Thirteen centuries later, six musicians and dancers, who have been working together for a decade, strive to recreate this era through their music as immigrants in New York City. Both the time and the place of this encounter are significant as New York becomes the New Andalucia with an afternoon of convivencia.

THE PERFORMERS of NEW ANDALUSIA 
Alfonso Cid: Vocals, Flute and Cajón
Arturo Martínez: Guitar
Bárbara Martínez: Vocals and Dance
Taoufiq Ben Amor: Vocals, Oud and Percussion
Ramzi Eledlebi: Percussion and Dance

results.description:
Come on down to the Colorado Cafe, New Jersey's premiere country dance club and sports bar to celebrate HEART DAY!! This CUPIDPARTY usually sells out and is a night you won't want to miss!

When 8minuteDating gets started, you'll have four 8-minute one-on-one conversations with singles in your age group followed by a 20-minute intermission where you can mix and mingle with other singles (from all three age groups) that might have caught your eye. After the intermission, you'll have four more 8-minute dates. That's 8 great dates in one fun night!

You'll enjoy delicious complimentary appetizers, ice breaker games, a cash bar and lots of raffle prizes. Plus after you've met all of your dates, you will receive free admission (a $10 value) to the club for a great night of country dancing. There will be free dance lessons, a country dj, a live rock band and an amazing night for everyone!

It's sure to be a great night and we guarantee you'll meet someone you want to see again or your next event is on us! So sign up soon because space is limited and advance registration at 8minuteDating.com is required.

Click here to register: http://www.8minutedating.com

My meetup group members can receive a $5 discount by entering promo code 8mdnynj5 in the appropriate space when registering at 8minuteDating.com!

results.description:
Let's explore the Met together every other Saturday with as little pressure as possible.

Go in the 81st entrance (not up the big stairs), and head straight back to the Uris Center for Education. We'll be at the set of benches (#8) in the middle on the left inside the room. At 4:15pm we will split up.

We'll decide who will go see what with whom, wander galleries, and meet at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30pm for cocktails, mocktails, and small plates to chat. We'll get tables at 5:40pm.

Everyone is responsible for their own admission and tab. I recommend you bring cash for your tab to make settling the check easier.
results.how_to_find_us: We'll be at the set of benches (#8) in the middle on the left inside the Center For Education room, which is straight ahead when you get past coat check. At 4:15pm we will split up. Then meet up at the north entrance to the Balcony Bar at 5:30.

results.description:
PURCHASE YOUR TICKETS HERE:
http://www.artonthecorner.org/new-andalucia.html

If you've previously attended AOTC events, seating was general admission. Seating for this event is reserved seating

. When you purchase your tix, you will be assigned a seat that you may keep, or choose another. ​For more information about tickets or the event, contact the office at Good Shepherd,[masked], or email [masked].

Art on the Corner is thrilled to bring New Andalucia - the re-encounter of Flamenco and Arabic music (and dancing!) - to our corner in Bay Ridge, Brooklyn, in celebration of the diversity that thrives in our corner of New York City.


As this is Art on the Corner's annual fundraiser concert, proceeds from the event benefit Art on the Corner programming efforts. In addition, Art on the Corner will donate a portion of the concert proceeds to support the Karam Foundation, a non-profit organization that provides emergency aid to families under siege in Syria in the form of basic food supplies, infant formula, and winter relief -- wood-burning heaters, wood to burn, and heating fuel.

A "Wine and Sweets Reception" with opportunities to participate in raffles for prizes donated by local businesses, artists, and individuals, follows the concert in the adjacent Soul Café. (Please note: wine is not included in the ticket fee.)


IMPORTANT TICKET INFORMATION: If you've previously attended AOTC events, seating was general admission. Seating for this event is reserved seating. When you purchase your tix, you will be assigned a seat that you may keep, or choose another. ​Tickets are $30 pp for Center seating, $20 pp for Side seating. Tix are available through Brown Paper Tickets here. 

As a thank you to Art on the Corner Meetup Group Members and supporters, make sure to use the password code AOTC$5ThankYou and click "Show Available Tickets" for access to discounted ticket prices. Select how many tickets you are purchasing and click "Add to Cart." The next page will show you where the tickets are located on the seating chart and will ask you to click on "Go Back," "Assign New Seats," "Let Me Choose My Own Seats," or "Next."

​For more information about the event or tickets, contact the office at Good Shepherd,[masked], or email [masked].

CONCERT BACKSTORY
In 711 A.D., Arabs crossed Gibraltar into Iberia and for the next eight centuries a tremendous exchange took place. Great minds, ideas and art crossed the strait of Gibraltar (Jabal Tariq) back and forth and created a rich mix that transcended the boundaries of religion, ethnicity and language. It is in this esthemus, this land in between, that giants such as Averroes, Maimonides, Alfonso El Sabio and Zyriab emerged. Thirteen centuries later, six musicians and dancers, who have been working together for a decade, strive to recreate this era through their music as immigrants in New York City. Both the time and the place of this encounter are significant as New York becomes the New Andalucia with an afternoon of convivencia.


THE PERFORMERS of NEW ANDALUCIA 
Alfonso Cid: Vocals, Flute and Cajón
Arturo Martínez: Guitar
Bárbara Martínez: Vocals and Dance
Taoufiq Ben Amor: Vocals, Oud and Percussion
Ramzi Eledlebi: Percussion and Dance
Zafer Tawil: Oud and Violin


For bios, click here.

results.description:
Today we will be focused and immersive in a specific theme we will work on together as a group. Conceptual Challenges are pretty much the same as our Lets Draw Togethers but are more specific and maybe more challenging conceptually. 

In today's challenge we will be drawing from the word of Khans of Takir from MTG. A fantasy world influenced by the region made once Genghis Khan passed away, when his heirs split his territory into four khanates aka the Mongolian empire. This is where Khans of Tarkir starts to take shape! In this world are 5 ruling clans from different territories that we will each align with and draw concepts from in this challenge. Make sure to drop by our facebook page to see reference/info relating to the theme that will help you get a better understanding of this world.

So don't forget to bring your supplies and sketchbook as this meetup is going to be drawing focused! Also feel free to bring any reference material that will help out with the theme in addition to what will be provided.

You can find me at the tables on the second floor of the Cranberry Cafe.

I hope to see you there and having fun participating in this new style of meetup and exercising, challenging, or developing your drawing and conceptual skills with other imaginative artists throughout NYC. Any skill level and any style is welcomed! 

For beginners if you have questions or need help with either something technically or conceptually with your drawing on the day of the meetup feel free to ask me or our co-founder and we will be glad to help you however we can.

Follow and join our facebook page for updates on the group, art relating to the theme, and more at https://www.facebook.com/groups/ImaginativeIllustratorsNYC/
results.name: Conceptual Challenge! Theme: Khans Of Takir

results.description:
This is a class in technique although, when you've conquered a song technically, then I will coach musicality and performance. Class size is limited. Fee is $20/per. You may audit the class once (without participating) for $10. Let me know when you sign up if that's your intention.

    People at the front desk are helpful and friendly and the Cafe on the floor has great coffee and cookies, sandwiches, <a>pizza</a>, etc.

    I've been asked to post this:

Dear Members:  I am Mr. Harrington's agent/rep. Mr. Harrington teaches privately coaching established actors and singers. For years his private rate has been $120/hr for this service. He started teaching through Meetup earlier this year and has as his goal to bring professional level instruction to the public at a rate that leaves no one behind. This demands tight scheduling of both his time and the room rental with Ripley-Grier Studios.For these reasons, I will be insisting to him that "no shows" be dropped from the group. The policy is this: If you RSVP you better show up. If you cancel you better do this by 4:00 pm the previous day.A word to the wise...Michael T. Harvey

results.description:
Shelley Winters, who once played the spoofish "Ma Parker" on Batman, brings the same larger-than-life approach to her portrayal of real-life Ma Barker in Bloody Mama. Presiding over her outlaw gang, consisting mainly of her goonish sons, Ma goes on a Depression-era rampage of bank robbery, murder and kidnapping. Obviously filmed in a hurry-watch as the Barker mob drives past modern shopping centers-- Bloody Mama strives for an entertaingly sleazy aura, especially when dealing with the incestuous subtext of Ma's relationship with her boys. And look who plays the Barker brood: Clint Kimbrough, Robert Walden and Robert De Niro! Bloody Mama was scripted by Robert Thom, whose previous collaboration with producer Roger Corman was the cult classic Wild in the Streets (former 1950s ingenue Diane Varsi appears in both films).

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2jxYdeZl9Rc

The Catholic Fellowship of Northern NJ invites all Catholic professionals in their 20s, 30s and 40s both single and married, to join us for Mass at 4:30PM at St. Anthony of Padua Church (NJ's oldest Polish parish) in Jersey City, NJ.

After the Mass, meet the group in the back of the church to head to Zeppelin Hall Biergarten for our social. Please contact Nina Talao at [masked] for event inquiries and volunteer and leadership opportunities within CFNNJ.

***Venue for Mass:***
St. Anthony of Padua Church
457 Monmouth Street (Cross Street is 6th Street)
Jersey City, NJ 07302
http://www.stanthonyjc.com/
There is a parking lot for the church on 6th street.

The Church is accessible via the PATH train, and is walking distance from the Grove PATH station.

From Manhattan, commuting time is about 20 minutes from 33rd Street Station to Grove Street Station in Jersey City.

***Social Venue***
Zeppelin Hall
88 Liberty View Dr.
Jersey City NJ 07305

results.description:
http://www.marcopolonj.com/

W2
Starting Life Anew
Join other widows and widowers for a casual cocktail hour*

Marco Polo Restaurant

February 27, 2016

5-7 PM

527 Morris Avenue

Summit, NJ
W2
is a new social group for widow and widowers of all ages in Chatham, Madison, Morristown, Summit and surrounding towns. It's an opportunity to get out, socialize and connect with others, going through the same experience.

*The location is donated but we will each need to pay for our own drinks and food.

So far I believe there are at least five rsvp's for this Saturday Night get together upstairs at 

**5pm for Drinks and if people are wanting to stay after drinks for dinner you can get seats at the restaurant together-
**Later in the evening there is a live band playing and a good sized group of widowed people will be attending, Pavinci's in Lake Hopatcong, at 8:30pm , so if people want to take a ride after gathering at Marco Polo and join that meetup - they would be happy to meet you and introduce you to everyone. The Band doesn'tstart until closer to 9-9:30pm. This is a non-stressful Saturday night out-Plenty of people to join dancing if your so moved and if not you will enjoy the company and a night out with live music. We get separate checks and they serve appetizers to full course meals. Terrific bread with oil and dried roasted peppers and lots of garlic.

This is Stacey Gregg- I posted the flyer information regarding W2. Gina, Julie and Mariana will be hosting this wonderful event and Ash is attending as well.  I look forward to being able to meet up with you all very soon. This Saturday I have a Sweet 16 Birthday Party to attend and will not be able to make Marco Polo or Pavinci's.  I will be attending Every Thursday at  Charlie Browns and perhaps we can meetup there! Have a good time and if anyone is able to take some photos please feel free to post them. It is really easy to do from your phone. Just go to photos at the top of the meetup page and if your not able to figure it out. Just send me a message and I can walk you through it.

It's been a while since we've tried an escape the room. So why not get back into it for the new year? We'll also pair this up with a trip to Dave and Buster's, what I hope is everyone's (or mostly everyone's) favorite adult arcade. 

I will try to pair up the teams for the Mystery Room if we have enough people for multiple rooms. Minimum of 6 people are needed in a room for the $18 dollar price. You will need to pay to RSVP and you will only get a refund if you change your RSVP a week before the event so I can make the reservation early enough. We'll look to have a 5ish start time, but that will really depend on what they offer and I will let you know once the reservation is made. 

Please answer the questions when you RSVP so I can be sure to get everyone assigned to a room they find challenging but fun! If you have any questions, feel free to ask!

results.description:
I am a Spanish native speaker and suggest we meet at think coffee to help you to improve your Spanish!

There is a maximum of 7 students per group and costs $10/person if there are more than 3 people or $15/person if they are 1-3 people.

My phone number is[masked] just in case you cannot find me.

Don´t sign up if you are not sure you can come.

The lesson lasts 1 hour.

Hasta pronto!

Beguinner level means: you are not able to speak without the help of the teacher, you just know really little common expresions. We will go thought the basics.

Intermediate level means: you can explain yourself with the help of the teacher, you can build up sentences but they are basic or you make mistakes on them. You have lacks of vocabulary and grammar.

Advanced level means: you are fluent in Spanish, you can explain yourself without a lot of problems. You know the vocabulary. Advanced students normally make gramatical mistakes when they talk and can forget some words, that is perfectly normal.
results.name: Spanish conversation beginner. $10/person if more 3people or $15/p if less

results.name: Indoor Basketball Full Court Pick Up!

results.description:
Welcome!

If you love to play basketball, but height is not your advantage, come out and play with people who aren't excessively tall! In the tradition of Spud Webb, anyone under 5'8", male or female, is welcome to join us on the court. We'll get some teams together and play some competitive, but relaxed bball-- and without any giant hands in our faces! :-p

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we must be out of the gym no later than 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

Don't forget: 

We rent out the gym from 5:00-8:00pm. 

Please arrive at least 5-10 minutes early as the sooner everyone arrives, the sooner we can begin playing. Note that all games stop at 7:45pm as we have to be out of the gym by 8:00pm. (If you get there late, please only ring the bell once. It is very loud! And it takes us a few minutes to get downstairs.) The gym is on the 10th fl. & has adjoining bathrooms, lockers, and water fountains.

We'll hit up McSwiggans (393 2nd Avenue @ 23rd St) later! 

Don't forget:

* You must be no more than 5'8" to play!

* You must RSVP on the site in order to attend!

* You will be asked to sign a waiver for 2014 as we're not a litigious group. 

If you have any problems with the prepay, just shoot one of the organizers an email.

Here are the basic rules we follow for games:

1. Play by ones and twos to 11 - win by one point.

2. Make it - take it.

3. Backcourt if the ball hits the rim or backboard. Air balls are fair game to put right back up.

4. Jump balls/disputed calls will be determined by a three pointer since the laws of basketball physics are very clear that "the ball never lies."

5. Walls, half-court line, and ceiling are out of bounds.  

6. Subs will enter the game no later than 6 points in (once one of the teams reaches 6 points). The sub will start the following game. Teams will regulate themselves but let's make sure everyone plays.

See you on the court! B-)

***NOTE***

In an effort for us to reduce overcrowding and to maintain a more accurate estimate of how many people to expect, please sign up online if you intend to play. There is a waiting list if all spots have been taken. We ask that you please just do not show up unannounced as you will kindly be asked to turned away. 

Also feel free to bring your own basketball for shoot-around. And don't forget to clip your nails prior to game day. We tried playing with Edward Scissorhands once - it didn't turn out so well.


*****NEW*****

Share your Spotify playlists and tracks with us and we'll play them during gametime!

Send an email to [masked]

And please submit good tunes otherwise we'll be Basketball for the Musically Challenged...
results.name: Indoor bball warm up & pickup games

These winning films (listed below) represent the artistic excellence of contemporary Latin American cinema, and the festival offers a platform for local audiences to discover the exciting world of film coming from the region."

Looking forward to seeing you there!

results.description:
The samba for beginners’ class starts with a 30-minute warm up that exercises basic isolation of the body, following by stretching and strengthening exercises. After the warm up, Danielle introduces the students samba no pé (basic samba step) and passo marcado (simple choreographies) typical of the Rio Carnival. The whole class happens in the sound of the upbeat and irresistible Brazilian music.

The class will be held on Saturday from 5-6:30pm and costs $18.

Come with comfortable clothes and be prepared to be barefoot.

About the instructor:

Danielle Lima was born in Rio de Janeiro and grew up performing with Beija-Flor de Nilópolis, one of Brazil’s most famous samba schools. Danielle Lima is also a Certified Teachers Artist of the program Dancing Classrooms from American Ballroom Theater, Certified YOGA Instructor at YOGA Effects in NYC and Karma Kids Yoga certified teacher.

For more information, contact Danielle Lima daniellelima13@ hotmail.com.
results.name: Samba for Beginners

results.description:
This Social Saturday will be split into 2 halves to help (newer) players prep for the B/C tournament on March 5/6. Come join us and have some fun learning a little more about the game!

5pm: Pool and gear set up - please come help so we can get in the pool before 5:30pm!

5:30pm-7pm: Training

================

Learn how to “screen” and how to create spaces for your team-mates to shoot on goal, learn how to capitalize on a corner throw, along with a few other helpful skills, team and game tactics for offence and defence ... to get you playing better both individually and as a team.

7pm-8:30pm: Friendly Games

======================

Let’s try to put the drills into practice in some friendly games. We will also use the games to explain the basic rules for safe and happy play.


This session is intended for everyone who has been to and played in any of our sessions, and specifically targeted at our newer players. (If you are completely new to kayak polo and don't have experience kayaking with a skirt, rolling or doing a wet exit, please attend one of our Introduction Sessions first.)


Two free trial sessions are available for newcomers; membership and playing fees are due for everyone else ($175 for full year, all included; membership year begins May 15). See (2015) Club and Facility Fees info for seasonal and per-session options. ACA Membership is required and due separately from club and facility fees (one-time ACA event membership is included for those in free trial sessions). Regulars: please confirm that your ACA membership is up to date or renew now. NYKP Members receive a discount! Newcomers can join ACA for 6 months at $15 for or for full year $30 (use PAC Individuals & Families options and select New York Kayak Polo).
results.name: Saturday Training & Friendly Games Session

results.description:
This may sound

  dumb because I am

a poet so of course

poetry would make me

happy but last night

  on a whim

I took the 6 Train

  downtown

and got off at

  Spring Street

then walked up

  Lafayette Avenue

then had to turn right

  onto Prince Street

Just to get to McNally Jackson

and browse for an hour

until finally I found

an anthology that looks

like this on the cover:

BEAT POETS –– so

I’ve been reading the

poems in BEAT POETS

aloud to myself

  like this morning

a poem by Gregory Corso

  and I quote:

  I stopped stealing!

    But I still lie at times,

  and still am shameless yet ashamed when it comes

  to asking for money.

  32 years old and four hard real funny sad bad

  wonderful books of poetry

    ––– the world owes me a million dollars.

And I laughed because it’s funny

  and because

I was reading it aloud

  are you reading this

aloud? It helps if you do

  or mumble it

to yourself at least

all I’m saying is

  please

come to Tea

  and Poetry

on Saturday

  February

Twenty-Seventh

at 68 Jay Street

  in Brooklyn

at 5pm or whenever

you can make it

  and bring a poem

on flashiness

  these days

and everything the air

  has ever

whispered to

  you

and your listless

  and wandering

soul

results.description:
A Conversation About Happiness

Alternating Hosts: George & Michael Y

</a> CitiCorp Atrium Lower Level
153 E 53rd street (Between Lexington and 3rd ave)

2/27: 5:15-7:45pm (it's okay to arrive late or leave early.). Look for our red Meetup Sign.

Note: this isn't a support group for those sad or depressed as there are other domains set up for that purpose. Please do not attend if you feel others somehow have the responsibility of "making you happy."

The theory behind these events comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll depart from them however much we may wish, like by talking about gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group. It's important that our events be fun! So with that in mind, let's get serious about ramping up our enjoyment of life!

At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps (see photo) leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

<a href="http://internal.psychology.illinois.edu/%7Eediener/Documents/Kesebir-Diener_2008.pdf">In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages
results.how_to_find_us: At the NE corner of 53rd and Lex., walk down wide steps leading to lower outdoor patio. Pass entrance to the subway station on the right, and walk through the revolving door. Walk straight about 30 yards, down a few steps; the Atrium is on the left.
results.name: Exploring the Nature of Our Happiness! Citicorp at 53rd & Lex. Host: Michael Y.

results.description:
satsearch: moving towards a transparent space industry

With the rapid growth of NewSpace applications, there is pressing need for a transparent view of the evolving, global landscape of the space industry. Our mission at satsearch is to build an independent, curated search tool for satellite parts that helps level out the playing field and resolves inefficiencies in the market. Developed by Kartik Kumar and Alberto Vaccarella, satsearch came out of Startup Weekend Space held in Bremen in April, 2015. The original idea for satsearch came from Kartik's frustration of not being able to easily find and compare satellite parts for preliminary mission design. Why can't we search, sort, filter and compare satellite parts like we can for laptops, cars and TVs? Kartik and Alberto realized quickly that this is a problem that can be solved. During Startup Weekend Space in Bremen, they discovered that the problem of spending hours "Googling" for parts resonates with engineers across the board.


Currently, satsearch (https://satsearch.co) is in beta and Kartik and Alberto are looking for feedback. This presentation will focus on reviewing some of the problems in the space industry related to systems engineering, procurement and market analysis. Additionally, the talk will present some of the ideas being explored using satsearch to try to make it easier to design, build and operate satellites. Join us in our quest to open up the space industry!
results.how_to_find_us: At the NYIT Incubator: Room 403, fourth floor, straight down the hallway.
results.name: satsearch: moving towards a transparent space industry

results.description:
During weekly meetings on Saturday evenings in the East Village of New York City, Atmanivedana das (Atma) and Subhangada devi dasi (Subhie) teach how to hear and chant sanskrit names for God in kirtan and teach a systematic study the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Kirtan meditation consists of hearing and chanting sanksrit names for God to the accompaniment of melodious and rhythmic music in order to invoke God's divine mercy and presence.  Bhagavad-gita As It Is is studied according to the ancient, yet unbroken, chain of teachers, as taught originally by Krishna and eventually Sri Caitanya Mahaprabhu, Rupa Goswami, and more recently A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, the Founder-Acarya of the International Society for Krishna Consciousness.   

Our focus is a systematic and thematic, but not difficult to understand, study of the Bhagavad-gita As It Is.  Everyone will read verses together from the Bhagavad-gita, copies of which will be provided for attendees to reference during the meetup.  Atma and Subhie will together explain the Bhagavad-gita verses according to the ancient tradition that they have studied and lived by for almost fifty years, combined.  We will learn about various fascinating topics, such as karma, reincarnation, the soul, the material energy, the Supreme Soul, time, and the relationship between the soul, the material energy, and the Supreme Soul.

Hard cover copies of the beautiful Bhagavad-gita As It Is with the original 700 sanskrit verses, translations, and elaborate purports by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada, will be available for any member who might choose to take one home for a suggested donation of $10.

This meetup is intended for everyone who is interested without discrimination and regardless of one's familiarity with the subject matter.  Please come and relish this most wonderful discussion and kirtan, celebrating the glories of bhakti yoga, i.e., devotional service to God, who is known according to the Bhagavad-gita by the name Krishna.

Here is the general schedule of our meetups: we begin the evening with a kirtan that lasts about half an hour -- until about 6:00 p.m.  Then, we have a class on Bhagavad-gita As It Is, which lasts for about an hour and a half.  In the class, we will go through verses of the Gita in order, continuing from where the last class left off, with questions pertaining to those verses being encouraged throughout the class.  By about 7:30, the last kirtan begins; it lasts for about 30 minutes.  A sumptuous and nutritious vegetarian dinner is served after that.

Admission to each meetup is free.  Donations for the meetup's expenses are welcome, but not at all required!

Atma is an initiated priest who since 1990 has been studying, teaching, and living according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita as taught and followed by A.C. Bhaktivedanta Swami Prabhupada. After living in a monastic setting for eight years, Atma resumed his undergraduate education at Brown University, where he hosted weekly programs that focused on kirtan and Bhagavad-gita.  He then enrolled at the University of Chicago Law School from which he graduated in 2004 and from which he received a merit scholarship.  Atma practices law in Long Island and New York City, with his concentration in securities law.  His primary goal is to imbibe in his own life the devotional teachings of the Bhagavad-gita and to share the same with others as a humble offering to God.

Subhie has been living her life according to the teachings of the Bhagavad-gita since 1991 and is also an initiated priest.  Subhie lived in a monastic setting until 2005.   From 1991 to 2005, Subhie taught Bhagavad-gita in Croatia, Serbia, Greece, Germany, and United Kingdom.  Subhie spent several years studying Vedic knowledge in India, primarily in the holy town, Vrindavana.  After 2005, Subhie resumed her undergraduate education in religion at the University of London -- and then locally at Queens College, after she moved to New York and married Atma.  Subhie completed her Master's degree in teaching at Queens College and is a school teacher.

results.description:
Hello Cuddle Folk,

Adam will be hosting a Cuddle Party at Big Buddha Yoga Studio on Sat evening, Feb 27th  from 6:30 to 10:00 PM.

There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website (www.cuddleparty.com), so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too.Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004. 

If you are coming to the Cuddle Party, PLEASE arrive on on-time to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 6:30 PM.

Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

As a reminder, these are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get your Cuddle Lifeguard On Duty or Cuddle Caddy if you have a question or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

Cost: $25.00

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving as an announcement and an easy way to communicate, but RSVPs here don't count at all. Here’s the link:

http://cuddlepartynyc1.eventbrite.com 

WHAT TO WEAR: Think more comfy than sexy. (More drawstrings, less lace! No shorts.) If you don't have PJs, tee shirts and sweat pants or yoga clothes should be OK. 

WHAT TO BRING: A pillow or stuffed animal if you like. Otherwise, just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host (that's me) will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Adam

www.cuddlist.com is a proud sponsor of Cuddle PartyNYC 

Notes:

Please reach out to me if you have any specific questions etc...
results.name: Cuddle Party™ for all Genders

results.description:
Join other single professionals for an early evening happy hour that includes an ice breaker and prizes, light appetizers, and is topped off with about* 7-10 rounds of "mini-dates."

HOW IT WILL WORK:

6-6:45pm - Happy Hour complete with light appetizers, a fun ice breaker, and Amex Gift Card prizes awarded to the two people who get the most matches.

7:00pm - You'll be seated for your first speeddating round.

7:00-7:45 - You'll have approximately* 7-10  three to four minute "mini-dates"

8:00 - Turn in your dating cards to the host and mingle. Matches will be emailed to you within 48 hours.


On average, 80% of those who attend end up with at least one or two mutual matches.

Get the full details below.

* We run 3-5 Meetup Groups, plus maintain our own outside Dating Advice & Events Website. We advertise on Facebook, Twitter, Blogs, etc. Most registrations come through our outside events website, not Meetup. Therefore the number of RSVPs reflected here are NOT the total number of men or women registered.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

PAYMENT POLICY:
$32  - PAY IN ADVANCE ONLY - WE DO NOT ACCEPT PAYMENT AT DOOR

*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

REGISTER AND PAY HERE: https://2016atwysnycspeeddating.eventbrite.com

(SEE MORE FAQ's BELOW)

ABSOLUTELY NO REFUNDS FOR LAST MINUTE/DAY OF CANCELLATIONS

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

FAST FACTS - PLEASE READ:

*We can not accept payment at the door for these events. All registrations must be done online via the Eventbrite link below before the event. No exceptions.

*RSVPing through meetup does not guarantee admission. You must pre-pay to secure your spot in the event.

*Business casual attire requested. No sneakers, t-shirts or active wear, no ripped jeans.

*We limit our events to 12 couples/24 people. (See reason below)

*Matches are tabulated and emailed to attendees 48 hours after the event.

*Event lasts about 90 minutes give or take 10 minutes between check-in and all speeddating rounds.


*You must register with a valid, correct email address.

*There are no refunds for cancellations, late arrivals or no-shows.

*You must arrive and check in within 20 minutes of the advertised start time.

OUR METHOD:

Online dating is great. But how many times have you chatted with someone just to have them fade or never make plans to meet? How many dates have you had that you thought went well and then ended up confused because you never heard from that person again?

The upside of online dating is that it provides us with so many options. The downside is that people start to believe that their options are endless, which leads them to move on quickly seeking that "perfect" match.

This is where speeddating comes in. To try and combat the "shopping cart" mentality of online dating, we limit the number of attendees to 10-12 per gender.  Fewer choices to distract us means that people are more likely to make a connection. Face to face conversations result in fewer flakes. That means fewer people get put on the back burner.


FAQ'S

The Organizer RSVPD with X amount of people. What does that mean?

That number represents the RSVPS (not registrations) that have come in through our other pages listed below. It is NOT the total number of people pre-paid. The typical number of people per event is 16-20.

What should I wear?

Business casual attire is perfect. No sneakers or athletic wear, please.

What if I want to give someone my contact info at the event?

Go for it! That's the whole point. Do whatever you are comfortable doing.

Can I see photos of other attendees?

Most people do not RSVP on meetup for privacy reasons. They only pre-pay and therefore do not share their photo.

Where are all the RSVPs?

About 50% of the registrations come through Eventbrite and our main events website. They are not Meetup members. Many people prefer not to post their Meetup profile or photo for privacy reasons. We often remove the event from the calendar once it has started so that people can't contact attendees without the attendee's expressed permission.

What's The Refund Policy?

Since we need to try and ensure a gender ratio as close to even as possible, our policy is that all registrations are final. We can not offer refunds or transfers to last minute cancellations. However, if you notify us at least 3 days in advance, we can give you a credit to another event.

Can I bring a friend for moral support?

You'd be surprised how many people arrive alone. We actually prefer that guests do not bring friends or "spectators." It makes the other attendees uncomfortable. Fun fact: The people who sign up and arrive alone tend to get more matches than those who attend with friends.

Will there be equal numbers of men or women?

That's the goal. We constantly monitor registrations and amp up promotion to try and ensure and equal gender ration. Sometimes there's  more men or women. Sometimes it's even numbers. This is heavily dependent on the age range and weather. 

*This is not a guaranteed number of dates.

See other RSVPS posted on our other groups. Please note that many people opt NOT to RSVP through Meetup for privacy reasons.

results.description:
Discover the Benefits of Buddhist Meditation with a Real Buddhist Monk 

Have you ever wanted to meditate but don’t know where to start? Do you have an interest in Buddhist teachings but wanted to learn from a live human being rather than Wikipedia? Buddhist monk and teacher Bhante Saddhasara is excited to be able to offer bi-weekly meditation and discussion sessions that will help you reduce your level of stress and bring you a peace of mind which is sadly lacking for most of us living in the urban jungle. 

Whether you have absolutely zero experience with meditation or Buddhism or are a seasoned pro, come and join us every Saturday at 06:00pm for a short meditation and discussion session. This Meetup is offered free of charge as a gift of the Dhamma (the Teaching of the Buddha) so please come and invite your friends. Wishing you every good blessing along your path and we hope to see you at our next get together! 

About Bhante Saddhasara 

Bhante Saddhasara joined the Mahamevnawa Meditation Monastery in Sri Lanka in 2005, became a novice in 2006 under Ven. Kiribatgoda Gnanananda Thero, and after two years of study and practice, attained High Ordination in 2009. After three more years of study, he had begun to develop a deep understanding of insight and tranquility techniques. In 2012 he was asked to begin and to organize a meditation center in Tampa, Florida to provide training to all those who wished to learn. The center was to be non-denominational; anyone of any religion could come and study the practices. Bhante Saddhasara also offered a Recovery Program for those suffering from addiction; an introductory mindfulness program for children; a prison program; and, throughout Florida and throughout the U.S.A, he also gave lectures and provided mindfulness and meditation teaching, as well as private counseling to adults and to youths of all ages. Bhante Saddhasara speaks fluent English and very much enjoys the back and forth of his conversations with Americans.
results.name: Join Us for Guided Meditation and Discussion with Bhante Saddhasara!

WHEN: Saturday February 27, 2:00 PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
Let's head to the Alamo Drafthouse to do dinner and a movie on Saturday February 27th.  Not sure yet which movies are showing but I have a birthday certificate for a free movie and this is the last day I can use it.. 

Here are the movies for Saturday Feb 27th.  Please note in comments what you want to see - and the time! 

Deadpool - 6pm and 8:45pm


DEADPOOL is a cheeky-but-faithful adaptation of the Marvel Comics anti-hero, keeping the off-color meta humor that fans expect while delivering the action and laughs to a wider audience. Seriously, this movie's going to make Wade Wilson (Ryan Reynolds) the next household name when it comes to superheroes—presuming that household doesn’t mind a smidge of bad words or a smattering of excessive violence by an masked lunatic mercenary. In DEADPOOL, Wade Wilson undergoes an experiment that leaves him with a warped appearance, wicked sense of humor and personal vendetta against the scientist who disfigured him. It’s going to take all three, along with the help of some X-Men, to exact his revenge... but it'll be a fun ride getting there.


Gods of Egypt - 2D  - 4:15 and 7:30 

The GODS OF EGYPT go head-to-head in this intense action film that pits Set (Gerard Butler), the God of Darkness, against the unlikely combination of Bek, a mortal, and the deity Horus (Nikolaj Coster-Waldau) in an epic battle for the throne to the land. Up against a powerful evil, our heroes must overcome their differences to stand up in the face of danger and survive the evil god’s wrath in their efforts to save Bek’s true love and the world itself from a dark fate. 


Hail Caesar!  4pm and 7pm

<a href="https://drafthouse.com/nyc/show/hail-caesar"></a>

The Coens have entertained audiences for years with their films, dense gifts to cinema that slyly wrap comedy in whichever genre they choose to inhabit at that time. HAIL, CAESAR! looks to bring the laughter back to the forefront, a film that tips its hat to the golden age of cinema while its clueless characters try to make sense of the caper they’ve unwittingly become involved in. Actors line up to work with the Coen Brothers and HAIL, CAESAR! is no different, boasting an A-list cast of current Hollywood’s heavy hitters. Their track record speaks for itself and this film hopes to reach the lofty expectations of any film attached to these auteurs. We can’t wait to see the results.

It happened One Night - 4pm

The comedies of the '30s and '40s are filled with runaway heiresses and the rambunctious cads that fall in love with them, but few manage to capture the sparkling chemistry achieved in this seminal Oscar-winning Claudette Colbert/Clark Gable production.

Colbert plays a spoiled, rich girl desperate to escape her father's overbearing clutches and return to the arms of the man she loves, aviator King Westley. On the run from Miami to New York, she meets up with Peter Warne (Gable), a down-on-his-luck reporter who's stumbled upon the story of the century.

Though his initial intentions are strictly geared toward his journalistic salvation, romance soon rears its head and the whole affair soon blooms into a semi-sweet adventure of legendary proportions.

The Witch - 6:30 and 9pm


An impressive and award-winning debut by writer/director Robert Eggers that has garnered him well-deserved praise for his vision AND one of the breakout films of Fantastic Fest 2015, THE WITCH is a return to form for the horror genre, serving up blood-curdling fright by building a dread-inducing ambiance that will leave fans of classic horror movies screaming—for more. Rather than easy scares, THE WITCH takes its time to paint a portrait of a colonial-era family being torn apart by evil forces and the disappearance of their son and the build up pays off: long after you’re done squirming in your theater seat, THE WITCH will have you looking over your shoulder.


Where to Invade Next - 7:45 and 9:45


Where to Invade Next is an expansive, rib-tickling, and subversive comedy in which Moore, playing the role of “invader,” visits a host of nations to learn how the U.S. could improve its own prospects. The creator of Fahrenheit 9/11 and Bowling for Columbine is back with this hilarious and eye-opening call to arms. Turns out the solutions to America’s most entrenched problems already exist in the world—they’re just waiting to be co-opted.


Zoolander 2 - 5pm,  7pm, and 10pm

ZOOLANDER 2 reunites Derek and Hansel (Ben Stiller and Owen Wilson) and, lucky for us, they’ve brought all the laughter of 2001’s original film back with them. The two vacant but beautiful models team up to solve a string of high profile murders while looking great doing so, avoiding the newly-paroled and vengeful Mugatu (Will Ferrell) in the process. Time to dust off you best “Blue Steel” and join us for this really, really ridiculously good-looking time.


So... let me know in the comments below or via email which movie you want to see.. and we may split up or go to the one with the most votes.. 

Thanks~

Welcome to Medicine Movie Night!! (Presented by: Oklevueha Native American Church of New York ~ onacny.org)


Thanks to all of you who came to the last Medicine Movie Night. ​We had​ a FULL HOUSE​ and ​a great time!!

We will be showing another beautiful documentary film in our screening studio with 8 ft. x 12 ft. huge movie screen and state-of-the-art sound system!

Come and sit with us as we learn about how sacred plant medicine (Psilocybin mushrooms) can help humanity heal and awaken. It will be a night of amazing movie experience, Q & A, stories sharing, and community bonding. Light food and refreshment will also be served

♥ ♥ Our selected film will be a surprise ♥ ♥ 

Doors open at 6:30pm, showtime starts at 7:00pm Suggested Donation: $10~$15 At the event, please kindly make an energy-exchange contribution to our host “Art Oasis” as they generously provide the space and food for the night. Your support will help ensure that we can continue to offer more enriching activities, meetings, and prayers for our community. AHO!!!

**We have limited seats. If you have RSVP'd here but are not able to make it to the event, please kindly remove yourself from the "Going" list so others can join. Much much appreciated!**

If you have any questions you can call Kevon at 347​-​560​-​0186
