results.description:
Do what thou wilt shall be the whole of the Law.


Hermetic Qabalah is a Western esoteric, occult and mystical tradition. It is the underlying framework for many magical orders based on the Golden Dawn.

We will go over the Hebrew alphabet and it's magical associations, gematria - a system of numerology, the Tree of Life, the Four Worlds, and Qabalistic Psychology

This is from the 'Qabalistic Basics' section on page 455 of "Pearls of Wisdom" by James Eshelman. Copies of this book will be on sale at our meeting for $30. Purchase of the book is not necessary, though we recommend it as a great resource.

A donation of $8, or what you can afford, is asked to help us pay for the room rental.

Notice we are in a new space this time - it is street level, no stairs to climb! Very close to the A train. (Canal Street stop)

Love is the law, love under will.
results.name: Introduction to Hermetic Qabalah

It will include a 2 hour free workshop with Bassist Matthew Garrison and Ableton Certified Trainer Dan Freeman (C0mIx) who will explore some of the new possibilities of integrating laptops into groups of musicians. Following the workshop there will be live performances by various artists who are melding digital tools with acoustic instruments.

results.description:
**If you missed it a few months ago at Nitehawk as part of The Deuce series, here's another chance to ogle the lovely Claudia Jennings.

Claudia Jennings stars as Karen Walker, a woman who sets her sights for roller derby success. Released a few months after Raquel Welch's Kansas City Bomber, Unholy Rollers gives the Welch film a run for its money, despite its exploitation budget, by adding nudity and lesbianism. After being sexually harassed by her loutish boss at the factory, Karen walks out of her job and tries out for the roller derby. She quickly wins a spot on the team and rises to the top, intent on ignoring the violence and grandstanding and concentrating on winning games. Although her teammates dislike her, Karen becomes a hit with the roller derby fans. But soon, her desire for victory becomes an obsession and she ends up losing not only her cool but also most of her clothes.

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_h9T-EmZfMA

Lee Mi Yeon, who currently appears as the older version of Duk Sun in "Reply 1988," leads the cast, which also features Kim Joo Hyun, who portrays Duk Sun's adult husband in "Reply 1988."  

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=yC1d45KL6Uw

We will meet at 6:45 p.m. for the 7:45 p.m. showtime, on Saturday, February 27 at the AMC Empire 25 theater, towards the left of the entrance, to catch up, purchase tickets and play trivia. 

Please purchase tickets ahead of the meetup either online or through the box office. 

Suggestions for after meetup restaurants or cafes can be posted through comments below. We will take weather, particularly the temperature into consideration, as to whether we will walk to Koreatown, after the film.

I look forward to seeing everyone on February 27! If you are interested in attending DramaFever's advanced screening on February 25, please purchase tickets directly through their event page, which is linked in the previous post.   

Please note that "Remember You," which is premiering for LA and Dallas audiences, is not scheduled to screen in the New York City area.

After both the dinner and the movie, for those who simply don't wish the evening to end, we'll head to a nearby bar to continue with our stimulating and intellectual discourse- or just keep talking and stuff.

results.description:
Forest Hills is a great little town and it's easily accessible via the E, F, M and R trains + the LIRR too.  Forest Hills is chock full of shops, restaurants and most importantly, in this case: bars. There's an easy 15 bars within a short walk of each other. I aim to crawl to every bar on the strip. Will you join me and a huge group of single dudes and dudettes for this epic alcohol-swilling event? 

While this event is geared towards singles in the 21 to 49 age range, anyone of any age is welcome to attend. 

When you come to a Date Walking event, you will take a casual stroll with anywhere from 10 to 25 wo/men over the course of around an hour or two. It's a really fun and relaxed way to meet someone special or multiple possibilities face-to-face. You can check out some photos from previous Date Walks here. 

We will meet at Buffalo Wild Wings at 7 PM and wait 20 minutes for everyone to arrive. 

Rain Date: If it rains this walk will be postponed. 

When you come to the event pay $10 and I will provide you with a ticket that’s good for 30-days. Hold onto the ticket and come to any/all Date Walking events for 30 days. Just show your ticket and you're good to go. 

Why am I paying you a fee for a place I can go to for free? See the answer here. 

If you have any questions prior to or on the day of the event, please do not hesitate to give me a call or text at [masked]

Thank you, 
Beau, your Date Walking Organizer 
  Call/Text:[masked] 
Email: [masked] 
Date Walking | Facebook | Twitter

At the end of the evening I will close with a Guided Meditation I have created: "Burning Old Contracts". The main focus being on the Manipura (Solar plexus) Chakra that is associated with transformation and growth. Looking forward to seeing ll of you there!

One Love,
Nick

results.description:
Yaar is not a pirate restaurant, sorry, but you're welcome to wear your eye-patch. This restaurant opened a few months ago by the owners of Seva, the popular Indian restaurant near 30th Avenue. But there are a few differences. It is an Indian restaurant, but the bigger kitchen allows the chefs to prepare a more diverse menu. Also, the restaurant is BYOB!!!


If you are bringing a beverage to share, please post in the comments. If you are having someone else's wine, it's always good form to offer a few bucks per glass... and if you're bringing wine, maybe don't splurge on the Chateau Lafite-Rotschild and expect to get back the $400 per glass cost... k, thanks.

Here's a look at their menu- https://www.grubhub.com/restaurant/yaar-indian-restaurant-2255-31st-st-astoria/316352

All positive reviews so far- http://www.yelp.com/biz/yaar-indian-restaurant-astoria


A few reminders: 

• If your plans change for the evening, please update your RSVP with enough lead time for me to change our reservation.

• If you can, please bring cash, because it makes it easier paying the bill. I will ask, but most restaurants won't give us individual checks.

• Please show up on time. We're going to order food at 7:15pm.
results.name: Dinner: Yaar Indian Restaurant
Tango Saturday night

venue.address_2: Use black double doors at south end of Jackson st.
venue.name: MakerBar

results.description:
As part of our outreach to T.O.O.O.L.(The Open Organization Of LockPickers}, we are sponsoring a monthly Lockpicking event to encourage like minded individuals to gather, greet, and pick the night away!!! No experience required, just a desire to learn is all that is needed. Anyone can learn to pick, if you don't believe us, come on down to MakerBar and try it for yourself!

At this time, we are also requesting donations of locks, ...old rusty pad locks(or shiny new ones), door locks (old or shiny[we love shiny locks]), combination locks, handcuffs (with or without keys), prison shackles(no questions asked...wink, wink), practice locks, bicycle locks, key safes, combination safes, etc... in general anything that has a lock may be donated. If you have any of the above mentioned locks, and would be happy to donate them, please bring them with you when you come to help increase the diversity of locks to pick.

Come have a beer (or two[we don't count]) with us, and have fun picking away with fellow pickers!! See you there!!

***As Always we remind newcomers to follow the two Golden Rules of Lock-Sport.....

1. Do Not Pick A Lock Without the Owners Consent (Your Neighbors Lock..No Good..)

2. Do Not Pick A Lock You Rely On.(Your house lock would fall into this category.)

Happy Picking!!!!***

**Open to the Public**

This event is free and open to the public. It is an ideal time to stop in and see what the MakerBar is all about. Doors open at 7PM

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive!

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.how_to_find_us: Give us a call at 1-855-MAKERBAR(625-3722) And we'll help you find the way!

results.description:
Back by popular demand it's Mad Laughs 2 @ Mamma V's.

Another fun Saturday night meetup in Nutley. Delicious Italian cuisine with a great professional comedy lineup for an awesome night of laughs! 7pm social/dinner, then 8pm show. Byob is allowed.

National Headliner: Tommy Koenig

A&E’s ‘Comedy on the Road’ from London, Jamaica, New York and LA; ‘Evening at The Improv’, MTV, and Showtime

Tommy Koenig was one of the first of the new breed of comics that colonized the nation and ushered in the modern day comedy club circuit. His frequent appearances on stand-up comedy shows (A&E’s ‘Comedy on the Road’ from London, Jamaica, New York and LA; as well as ‘Evening at The Improv’, MTV’s ‘Half-Hour Comedy Hour’, Showtime’s ‘Comedy Club All-Stars’, and other TV shows (from ‘Miami Vice’ to ‘Scooby Doo’), film (Mel Brook’s ‘Robin Hood’, ‘Dracula’, co-star of ‘Stitches’), and commercials along with consistent success in clubs and concerts all over the world have made him a mainstay in the entertainment business for over 30 years and still going strong.
Tommy just recently returned from headlining at The Tropicana in Las Vegas and guest starred on one of the final episodes of ABC’s ‘Boston Legal’.
His one-man MusiComedy show, ‘Baby Boom Baby’, is being performed internationally, just finishing a month in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico and his new DVD of ‘The Tommy Koenig Show’ (voted ‘Best Comedy of 2002’ by Theatremania) and his new CD, ‘History of Rock and Roll – Volume One’ are on sale now. Tommy Koenig is the ‘whole package’!


"HILARIOUS. HYSTERICAL. A STEADY STREAM OF FUN.”
--LA Weekly

“A MASTER OF CARICATURE. HE’S A MAJOR TALENT.”
--The New York Times

VOTED "BEST NEW COMIC"
--The New York Daily News, 1980

“A MAN OF 1000 FACES, 1000 VOICES AND
1000 LAUGHS.”--Chicago Tribune


Feature: Joanne Filan

Govenor's Comedy Club, Opened for Jessica Kirson

Growing up in New Jersey, Joanne was repeatedly assured of one thing; “you’re so funny, you should do comedy.” Armed with that knowledge, she headed off in the most obvious of comedic directions, college in Florida. Her major, you guessed it, Marine Biology. A couple little twists and turns on the road since graduating and she is now a steady fixture on the comedy scene.

Several years into the business and Joanne has never been more on top of her game. She consistently delivers a unique “stream of consciousness” style of humor that keeps audiences either rolling in the aisles or on the edges of their seats, anxious to hear what she has to say next. With an amazing gift for improv, razor-sharp wit, and a subtle delivery, Joanne is an unexpected gem. A comedian so able to tap into the moment that no two shows are ever alike.

A regular at Gotham Comedy Club, New York Comedy Club, Broadway Comedy Club and more, not to mention a fixture in the traveling show, “The Broads of Broadway”, she makes her way around the club scene and around the country. Her TV credits include “Here TV’s Hot Gay Comics” and festivals consist of The New York Underground Comedy Festivals and more. She’s also involved behind the scenes as a co-producer of a weekly show at the New York Comedy Club, as well as co-producing and co-hosting “The MoJo Variety Show” and has ventured out into the college circuit, hosting and starring in events at Bryn Mawr College and Monmouth, Lehigh, and Shippensburg Universities. Joanne has proven she can do it all. In the process, she has developed a stellar reputation with fans, fellow comedians, managers, producers, club owners- you name it.


Feature: Matt Jenkins

Major NYC Clubs

Matt Jenkins is known for his clean, quick-witted brand of comedy. Fastly becoming known as one of NY/NJ’s strongest clean comics, Matt uses his diverse background, in combination with solid joke writing and charisma, to give audiences a relatable as well as memorable experience.

Host: Mike Sicoli- AC Taj Mahal


Dinner Choices:

-Sausage & Peppers

-Chicken Francese

-Salmon Livornese

-Penne Vodka

Including: Mixed Salads, Seasonal Vegetables & Roasted Potatoes


Tickets available online. Dinner and Comedy show for one price of $35 by clicking link below:

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mamma-vittorias-comedy-night-2-tickets-21458919205
results.name: Comedy Night 2 @ Mamma V's

results.description:
When I decided to call this show Fat B*tch!, a lot of people were offended," says comedian Erica Watson, "especially other fat b*tches." But for Watson it's a term she can't escape.

If she doesn't return a man's attention on the street, she hears those two words. If she bumps into a skinny woman in a club, it happens again. Watson explores society's obsession with weight in her one-woman show and looks at how black women's bodies in particular have always been objects of admiration and ridicule. .

The show is a mix of personal anecdotes and video clips, and Watson's message is provocative, yet hilarious. See Watson when she takes to the stage at The Laurie Beechman Theatre at West Bank Cafe.

$20
results.name: Hilarious One-Woman Show Explores America's Obsession With Size

results.description:
Майя Плисецкая — обладательница выразительной пластики, феноменального прыжка, гибкой спины, лёгкого шага и высокой музыкальности. Она первая ввела в балетную лексику такой прыжок, как «кольцо».
Балерина создала свой собственный стиль, отличающийся изяществом, графичностью, остротой и законченностью жеста, позы и как каждого отдельного , так и всего рисунка партии в целом. В её пластике танцевальное искусство достигло высокой гармонии. С самого начала своей сценической жизни балерина проявила редкий талант трагедийной актрисы. Обладая неиссякаемым интересом ко всему новому, она не боялась сценических экспериментов. Также известна своим феноменальным творческим долголетием.
4 мая 2015 года труппа мариинского театра посвятила спектакль «Шурале» Майе Плисецкой

Мариинский театр и Brooklyn Academy of Music представляют Вашему вниманию отрывки из балетов в которых блистала легендарная балерина.

Билеты здесь:

http://www.bam.org/dance/2016/a-tribute-to-maya-plisetskaya-program-c

---------------------------------------------------------------
Mariinsky Theatre, St. Petersburg
Musical direction by Valery Gergiev

Featuring Diana Vishneva and members of the Mariinsky Ballet Diana Vishneva dances Carolyn Carlson’s intimate solo Woman in a Room, and then performs Alberto Alonso’s Carmen Suite with members of the Mariinsky Ballet.

For decades, the legendary Maya Plisetskaya (1925–2015)—muse to choreographers Yuri Grigorovich, Alberto Alonso, and Maurice Béjart—was synonymous with Russian ballet. A star in the truest sense of the word, she is remembered for the ravenous intensity of her hyperphysical dancing and the spitfire personality that captivated audiences around the world, onstage and off. Following her passing in May 2015, the Mariinsky presents an extended tribute to this iconic performer, comprising four distinct mixed programs featuring the incomparable Diana Vishneva and longstanding principal Uliana Lopatkina, performing with live accompaniment by the Mariinsky Orchestra.
Program C opens with Vishneva performing Carolyn Carlson’s Woman in a Room, an intimate solo commissioned specifically for her and inspired by the films of Andrei Tarkovsky. In the second half of the program, she is joined by members of the Mariinsky Ballet for Alberto Alonso’s Carmen Suite, a sensuous, electrifying work originally choreographed for Plisetskaya.
results.name: The Mariinsky at BAM /A Tribute to Maya Plisetskaya:

results.description:
Hi All, 

I'm getting folks together for a comedy show and hang at the Grisly Pear in the West Village and we're giving everyone free pizza! If you came out to the last Saturday night show, you know you're in for a great time. We've got a great lineup of comics, who've been featured on late night shows, MTV and Comedy Central, including the hysterical Petey D'Abreu (BET), LeClerc Andre (Fox TV's Laughs) and more!

Tickets are $15.00, with a 2 drink minimum (normally $20, but $5 off when you mention "meetup" & drinks are cheap) and they always take good care of us with choice tables in the performance space. Be sure to mention "meetup" to the host and they'll bring you back to the right place. 

7:15: Pizza, Drinks and music from DJ Brunchy Brunch in the back area 

8:00 pm: Showtime

AGE 21+

Khalid
results.name: West Village: Free Pizza & Headlining Comedians at BIG Saturday

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 20 members will be attending! 

Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor.  

Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available) - https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Feb-27-2016_at_0730PM

Professional 1 hour lesson from Monika Matys (Get Dance), that will teach you how to dance at a club/party (Top 40, Hip Hop, etc). We'll work on dancing with rhythm, musicality, coordination, and groove... to the best dance music!

This lesson also includes admission to our after party immediately following, where you will be able to practice the moves you just learned! 

Prepay Here - https://getdance.ticketleap.com/club-dance-night-with-monika/dates/Feb-27-2016_at_0730PM

This is a Multi-Meetup event. Expect 20-30 members to attend. It is not meant to be age/ethnic specific or gender balanced.  

See more info about the after party here - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Feb-27-2016_at_0730PM
results.how_to_find_us: lower level of venue

results.description:
This event is being co-organized by several other groups. The # of RSVP's here are not reflective of actual attendance. Based on presales, at least 20 members will be attending! 

Dancing is a great way to meet people! This lesson also works as a great ice-breaker. It doesn't matter if you've never danced before or if you're a pro. This is just a fun way to learn some new moves and make new friends.  

Gain confidence in social dance situations and learn the skills necessary to either blend in or stand out on the dance floor.  

Must prepay here to confirm spot (limited space available) - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/getdance/dates/Feb-27-2016_at_0730PM

results.description:
Open topic group run by a trained facilitator for individuals and their partners who identify as transgender, transsexual, cross-dresser, gender variant, or intersex. Takes place the 2nd and 4th Saturdays of each month, starts at 7:30 pm.

The 2nd Saturday is a discussion group and the 4th Saturday is an activity group.

No charge to attend, but a $5.00 donation is welcome.

Please note: Meet-up.com is used to help promote this group and the RSVPs on Meet-up do not accurately reflect the actual attendance of the group.

Join us for a night of inspiring music that spans genres and a contagiously high energy vibe to keep your body moving in a friendly, exciting, judgement-free zone. We hope you'll join us!


New York Insight Meditation Center
28 West 27th St., 10th Floor (Buzzer #27)
NYC

7:30-8:00 Setup
8:00-10:00 Freestyle dancing
10:00-10:15 Community announcement circle
10:15-11:30 Freestyle dancing continues


***WE NEED VOLUNTEERS***
Pitch in to run the dance! Help with set-up, do a door shift, or help with take-down, and get $5 off admission - do two of the above and get in free. 

Suggested donation for entry - $10-15.

Nearby trains: 1, 6, F, M, R, N

There's on-street parking for those coming in from out of town. Just a short ride in from the Lincoln Tunnel. 

Spread the word!

results.description:
ALL AGES
$10 @ The Door = 4 hours of jamming & practice time! 

The Open Jams at Funkadelic Studios are great for musicians who are interested in networking with other like-minded artists, from beginners to professionals in all genres. Attending our open jams allows you to collaborate with musicians, and it's a great way to find potential band members, or to test out and get feedback on new songs that you’re working on!

Since first opening up in 1993, we have become a resource for artists of varying styles and personalities. The atmosphere at Funk, is influenced by our friendly staff and the cool vibe of our city.

Our Open Jams are held every Saturday and its only $10 to attend which gets you four hours of jamming and practice time! So come get something started, network, create and collaborate!
results.how_to_find_us: 5th Floor, on W40th between 7th & 8th ave.

results.description:
The New Tantra ('TNT') is the fastest growing sexual movement in Europe. We have been a part of TNT for a few years and are very excited for it to come to the Americas for the very first time.

As the organizers, we have decided to host a simple social at our flat to welcome those curious in knowing more about The New Tantra.

We thought this would be a good thing as TNT is very bisexual/pansexual. Many devoutly straight men and women open themselves up and discover their bisexuality in tantra.

This Saturday, 2/27, 8 - 10:30pm, in Brooklyn. No admittance after 8:45pm. We'll have a sharing about TNT around 9pm and just enjoy good company. We will have some wine, but welcome you to bring a bottle for the house. There is no charge for attending this event.

Just so no one gets the wrong idea... This is a friendly, social event; NOT a sex party. Although, in talking about tantra there is a lot of beautiful, horny energy, this is a conversational event only. Sexual activity is not permitted during the party.

You must arrive in a timely manner as people will not be allowed in after 8:45pm.

Address will be given to confirmed RSVPs. As space is very limited, if you are not able to attend, be sure to cancel so anyone on the waitlist can attend.

The New Tantra

http://www.thenewtantra.com/

When attending please make a point to tell us that you heard of this event from Pleasure Without Borders Meetup.
results.name: Old Wine and New Tantra-this Sat!

results.description:
Hi Everyone,

Join us for fun and competition... RSVP NOW! Limited spots available.

We are going INDOORS in Brooklyn for SATURDAY NIGHTS (TWO SESSIONS)

8:00 PM- 10:00 PM (SESSION ONE - 1 hour Group Drill for BEGINNER/LOW INTERMEDIATE) COST $25 p.p.; 8:00 PM - 9:00 PM (followed by 1 hour match play) $15:  Total Cost $40

9:00 PM - 11:00 PM (SESSION TWO - HIGH INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED) Cost:  $30 p.p. includes two hours of indoor tennis with same level players.

(BEGinner, INTermediate, ADVanced players are grouped in their designated categories)

Please note there is very limited space available from 8:00 PM - 9:00 PM (BEGINNER/LOW INTERMEDIATE) Group Drill followed by 1 hour match play from 9:00 PM - 10:00 PM.

9:00 PM - 11:00 PM (INTERMEDIATE/ADVANCED).   

MUST RSVP NOW and specify SESSION ONE OR SESSION TWO.

PLEASE ARRIVE AT LEAST 10 MINUTES EARLIER TO YOUR SCHEDULED TIME.

What to Expect... Session 1 (Warm-up, hitting & drill before placement into levels to play); Session 2 (unless specified of preference, placement of levels to play)

Please note that NY Social Tennis is here to provide fun & competition, please feel free to contact us with your thoughts, concerns, or preference.  We will do our best to accommodate!

Look forward to meeting and playing tennis

Thanks,

Lily :)

RSVP...

http://www.meetup.com/nystennismb/events/229000455/
results.name: SATURDAY NIGHT INDOOR TENNIS in BROOKLYN, TWO SESSIONS FOR ALL LEVEL PLAYERS...

results.description:
Our regular Saturday night game is set to go, RSVP via SMS text. Email me to get on our text list and get daily updates about when the game is happening. I dont use the Meetup RSVP system, so just call or text me if you want to play. 

Our nights are changing! Sometimes I have a Sunday game instead now with the NFL in season and we are trying to start a bit earlier. If you havent been by recently, the games have been great, often a full table with a waitlist by 10pm. 

Thanks!


-Chris
results.name: Play some $1-2 No Limit Holdem!

results.description:
We’ve been having a good time at The Copa, a lot of Fun and good Dancing!



The Copa is located in the heart of the fast-growing village of Port Chester.

We had a great time at The Copacabana.  If you would like to see the pictures from our First event there, CLICK HERE...http://www.meetup.com/New-Beginnings-Life-After-Divorce/photos/26664033/

The House DJ will be playing a wide variety of Dance music for us.

This will be a Multi-Group Meetup Event

So expect a lively mix of members from

Westchester, Putnam and Western CT including  Greenwich and Stamford.

There is Free Parking behind the Copa at the Abendroth Ave municipal parking lot. And you can enter the Copa from the Abendroth Ave entrance.


ALL ARE WELCOME, FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS!

And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.

Looking forward to seeing everyone
results.how_to_find_us: When you come in from the Abendroth Ave entrance, we'll be on your right
results.name: *GOODBYE to FEBRUARY DANCE at THE COPACABANA in PORT CHESTER*

results.description:
We’ve been having a good time at The Copa, a lot of Fun and good Dancing!


The Copa is located in the heart of the fast-growing village of Port Chester.

We had a great time at The Copacabana.  If you would like to see the pictures from our First event there, CLICK HERE.....http://www.meetup.com/Westchester-Singles/photos/26663929/


          The House DJ will be playing a wide variety of Dance music for us.

This will be a Multi-Group Meetup Event

So expect a lively mix of members from

Westchester, Putnam and Western CT including  Greenwich and Stamford.

There is Free Parking behind the Copa at the Abendroth Ave municipal parking lot. And you can enter the Copa from the Abendroth Ave entrance.

FYI---- The meters must be feed up till 9:00 in Port Chester. Be sure to look at the sign wherever you park.

ALL ARE WELCOME, FEEL FREE TO INVITE FRIENDS!

And as always, please take care of the wait staff, thanks.

Looking forward to seeing everyone!

results.description:
Start practicing your scales, gents, and dig out those ear plugs! Japas 38 is a karaoke lounge in the city that's made with the shy singer in mind. It's Korean-style karaoke, so we will have a large private room for our group with couches, much like a large living room. There's no need to be embarrassed because you'll be safe with friends :) And if you're still embarrassed, you'll have a steady supply of all you can drink alcohol to help you out! The cost of this event is $35/person. That includes two hours in the room, all you can drink white wine, red wine and sake (maybe beer, but don't quote me on that), a group sushi platter and a group appetizer platter (From previous experience, they offer enough to nosh on but maybe not enough to fill a grown man's belly, so pre-gaming a sandwich for dinner might not be a horrible idea.) For anyone who wants to stay past the two hour mark, the cost is $15/person for one extra hour and $25/person for two extra hours. The base cost of $35 will cover you from 8p-10p! (If you show up late, your two hours still start at 8p, just a head's up!) If you stay after (even as a spectator) be prepared to pay up. Any one who's done the K-town karaoke knows that this is a great deal and ALWAYS an amazing time. We have lots of awful singers among us, so come serenade us with pride! (I'm sure we have wonderful singers as well, we'll make them go last ;)
If we aren't done partying it up after our karaoke event and we want to take advantage of being in the city, we can relocate to a club afterwards!
results.name: KARAOKE!

group.name: North Jersey Out and About: A Gay Social Club

results.description:
Join the group from The LOFT on Saturday, February 27th at the White Plains Performing Arts Center for the comedy show “Big Pants and Hot Flashes”.


The group will meet in the theatre lobby at 7:30pm.  Show starts at 8pm.  Use code: LOFT5 when purchasing tickets to receive $5.00 off. Tickets will be $25 with the discount.  Normally advance tickets are $30. The discount can also be used the day of the show for $30 tickets, normally $35.


If you would like to sit with The LOFT group we are starting in Row F Seat 107, however you also can sit where ever is comfortable for you (you still get the discount)  Click here to purchase tickets: http://wppac.com/shows/big-pants-hot-flashes/


If you will be joining The LOFT group you can RSVP to[masked] x14 or [masked] or here on meetup.com.  We encourage folks to purchase their own tickets in advance.  The theatre is located at 11 City Place, 3rd Floor, White Plains, NY 10601


ABOUT THE SHOW

What happens when two successful comedians make life altering decisions to come out as gay and transgender?


KEVIN MEANEY and JULIA SCOTTI invite you to join them for a hilarious once in a nighttime experience wayyyyyyyyy over the rainbow!


It’s a show like no other. Few comedians can skip back and forth across the sexual and gender lines like these two veteran professionals. It is that comic experience and Swiss watch timing that promises a night of endless truth, fearlessness and most of all, non-stop laughter.


As an extra added touch, a no holds barred Q&A will follow the show.

Kevin Meaney will be familiar to audiences from his appearances on The Tonight Show with Jay Leno, The Tonight Show with Johnny Carson, 30 Rock, Night Out and Gotham Comedy Live. He was on Broadway in Hairspray for over five years.


Julia Scotti is a nationally headlining comedian who performs in comedy clubs, theaters and colleges. She was one of the winners of the Laughlin Comedy Festival, was a Finalist Ladies of Laughter and was named Advocate Magazine’s “Top 5 Hottest Transgender Comedians of 2013.”


Running Time: approximately 2.5 hours (including intermission and Q&A)
results.how_to_find_us: The LOFT group will meet in the lobby at 7:30pm
results.name: OUT at the Theatre: Big Pants and Hot Flashes Comedy Night

group.name: The LOFT: LGBT Community Services Center

results.description:
Full-Field Soccer - 11 v 11 - Large Goals - Beautiful Turf Field - Friendly but competitive game. 

RSVP's open 6 Days before the Meetup at 8:00pm - Trying something new.


Main goal is the have fun, play hard, and have a good time. 

Game Time Officially Starts at 8:15. If you are not on the field ready to play, or are literally changing to play, your spot MAY BE GIVEN AWAY to a member on the wait list if they show up.

(1) we are keeping an 11 v 11 game, with 1 substitute per side; rotating new players in every 10 minutes.

(2) Please only RSVP if you will come. No shows ruin the game for everyone on the field, as well as those who would have come and played in your spot.

(3) Games will be 40-45 minute halves; switching sides at the break. 

5/11/15 - NEW RULES

• If you are on the wait list and come to the field, and a no show occurs, by 8:15 you will be given their spot.

Fee is $4.00 for the night - Payment will be taken at Half-Time. Please have cash available to pay. If you do not have cash, please go to the ATM prior the game. All players will receive a 1-time exception.

Join Us For A Winter Shindig @ The Shannon Rose!

Starting @ 8pm we'll meet at the big bar as soon as you walk in. Drink, eat, mingle & socialize.

Their musicianship, energetic stage show, diverse song catalog, and ability to engage crowds of all ages is what sets them apart. Come get Shipwrecked!

Free Parking & Free Admission.

If The Shannon Rose lot is full you can park in the huge Target parking lot.


See You There!

results.description:
ALL LEVELS ARE WELCOME

(If you are a beginner and wish to join the party, please come for a brief rating session before joining the party.  This is a social tennis group, rather than an instructional session.)

Also check out my website:  www.tennis-buffs.com

If you sign up via Meet Up site, you must call me to find out your start time. I would like to stagger players. You may or may not be able to start at 8pm, as it depends on how many spots there are left. Thank you for your understanding.

Saturdays, starts 8pm

Cost $40

Includes tennis, balls and food

9 Indoor air-conditioned hard courts

What better way to spend an evening than to be with people with common interests, playing tennis and meeting old and new friends! Binghamton Racquet Club is centrally located for tennis players in the Tri-State area, only 5 minutes from the GWB, a good location for players from Rockland County, NYC, Westchester, Hoboken, Jersey City and other areas in NJ.

It's a melting pot of wonderful cultures. You will play friendly and yet competitive matches. Off the courts, you will meet people and be engaged in conversations in a relaxed and congenial atmosphere.

If you are new to Tennis Buffs, please be sure to answer the survey so I know how to match you up with other players in a doubles game.

Look forward to meeting old and new friends!

Penny Jung
Event Coordinator
www.tennis-buffs.com

results.description:
This Meetup is great opportunity to make a new friend, network, or meet that special someone! Since it's always easier to meet people when you're with someone, we're asking that you try to bring at least one person with you (friend, roommate, colleague etc). 

And the best part, they get in for FREE (each ticket is good for up to 2 people)!! 

P.S. It's not mandatory that you bring someone but highly encouraged! 

First 20 tix just $10 w/ discount code FRIEND at checkout - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/plusone/


What to expect:

• 2 For 1 Drinks (8:30-9:30pm)

• DJ & Dancing 

• Icebreakers & Snacks 

• Prizes & Giveaways  

• FREE shot if it's your birthday month (show ID at door)

Tickets:

First 20 tix just $10 w/ discount code FRIEND at checkout - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/plusone/

$15 after that online, $20 at the door w/ RSVP, $25 w/o

Can I come alone? Yes. The ice breakers will help you meet other members. So come alone or bring a friend or two - either way you will feel comfortable and have a great time.


Is this event private? The entire venue will be 100% private for our party. Group members can invite guests to join them.  

What's dress code? No sweats, hats, etc Jeans ok. Dress stylish. 

Is this age/ethnic specific? This event is not age or ethnic specific. We will have a wide mix of ages (21-50s). 

Why does your RSVP say +99? This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees.  We will have 200+ members attending.

group.name: New to NYC Nightlife and Friends!

results.description:
If you are like me and love to dance after hours join me once a month starting Saturday February 27th for my first Z Club NY Dance Party. We will bring you the hottest most energetic dance step with some of your favorite instructors. 


Come dance and sweat with us for 90 minutes with the Z Club NY Team. This will be your Saturday pre party in the most happening area of Manhattan, the Lower East side! 


Bring your friend and let's make this a fun social dance workout party! 


To introduce our new location, our first dance party will be FREE. 


RSVP is require however online at www.zclubny.com

see you there!!
results.how_to_find_us: www.zclubny.com

results.description:
Hey Guys! I thought it would be fun to all meet up at the comedy show I produce at QED. If you haven't been to QED it is a great space for all different kind of events. During the day they have cool classes like swing dancing and knitting. In the evening QED is a performance venue. QED serves beer, wine and snacks. They also have THE BEST hot apple cider you will ever taste.

This is a great chance to make new friends and to hang out with some old friends. A bunch of my friends (all different ages) come to this show as well as locals and comedy lovers. We also have an Instagram photo contest. Whoever takes the coolest photos of the event and posts them on Instagram with #hashtagcomedy will win TWO free tickets to an upcoming show! We will chose 2 winners the Monday after the show!

I hope to see you there!!

Hashtag Comedy invites some of the best comics to comment on today's hottest issues. We choose the funniest up and coming stand ups to dissect the trending topics of today's world. The show is a great opportunity to laugh and learn. So come out and buckle up its going to be a wild ride!

This months features:

Tracey Carnazzo (Race & Sex)
Sal Capizzi (MTV)
Will Miles (truTV, Bravo)
Gary Vider (America's Got Talent)
Kenny Warren (E! Network)
Chris Gersbeck (Everythign Is Dumbn)
Abigoliah Schamaun (The Edinburgh Fringe Festival)

Tickets here!

http://qedastoria.com/collections/shows/products/hashtag-comedy-8

results.description:
Best dang comedy show in the city, baby. 

Come to Chelsea in Manhattan, hang out, have some brews, and enjoy a hilarious show (with pizza after, hey-o!)

There's no door charge and you don't have to buy a drink. Meet new people, or bring your own pals, it's a great time from start to finish. 

Here's what people are saying about standup.NYC:

"I was blown away at the talent." 

"Great time and solid pizza, but be sure to ask for it at the end of the show, Dan and Danny will hook you up." 

"Laid back vibe, perfect for seeing some funny people, hanging out with friends, and only spending as much money as you want to drink"
results.name: Hang out, Watch Comedy, Eat Pizza (All Free)

Desi Saturdays is one high society DesiParty. Wow factor everywhere. Beautiful people, beautiful venue, beautiful ambiance, and did we mention beautiful people? High energy, amazing music and a packed house are just some of the traits of what you would expect at this weekly desiparty. 

This event is the talk of the town amongst young socialites. It's so exclusive it only takes place on Saturday Nights, and don't even try to dress down, because it is almost impossible to get in, but more importantly you would feel so out of place. So don your best, and you may just be lucky enough to party out on Saturdays Nights at Lexicon!!

** TICKETS: Only $10 with code CHORDOMA - http://tickets.thecuttingroomnyc.com/event/1082399-fire-ice-variety-show-new-york/

On this Sat., Feb. 27 at 9:45 PM - join us at NYC's The Cutting Room (a famed music venue and frequent SNL after-party spot) for a pro NYC variety show featuring comedy, a mind reader, a dance company, and a celebrity impressionist!

All proceeds to benefit the Chordoma Foundation, a charity fighting chordoma (a rare bone cancer).

After the show, it's the after-party -- starting at approximately midnight and running until 4 AM. The after-party features a DJ, a photographer, and an ice luge!

** TICKETS: Only $10 with code CHORDOMA - http://tickets.thecuttingroomnyc.com/event/1082399-fire-ice-variety-show-new-york/

results.description:
BUY TICKETS HERE

We’ve got another big night going down at the Covered VIP Rooftop at Stage 48! Rain or shine, this amazing venue, will give you an incredible scenic view of the city. Our Stage 48 party series is known to get wild, with people dancing harder than anything we’ve ever seen, so we’re really excited to see what this wonderful night on the rooftop will bring.

There Will Be 3 Dj’s Spinning Live!
Green DJ: Top 40 Dance Hits
Red DJ: 80’s/90’s/EDM Mashups
Blue DJ: Hip Hop/R&B/Reggae

What the night includes:
Quiet Events Headphones
Glow in the Dark Gear
Covered and heated VIP Rooftop
Rooftop View Of The City
3 Live DJs battling for your attention

Special Notes:
Tickets are limited, so act fast!
This party is going on rain or shine.
Age Restriction: 21+

HOW IT WORKS
***Bring a credit or debit card for the check-in process*** When you arrive you’ll receive a pair of special wireless headphones. You can adjust the volume and choose between up to three DJ with a flip of a switch. Each headset has a color LED that shows what you are listening to, so you can dance along with those listening to the same DJ as you. It’s super social; just lower the volume or take the headphones off and talk to that girl or guy. There’s no loud music that you have to talk over. Plus, there’s no ringing in your ears when you leave. At the end of the night, be sure to return your headphones as there will be a $100 charge to your credit or debit card if headphones don’t come back.
results.name: VIP Covered Rooftop @ Stage 48!

results.description:
Join us this weekend for our fun Saturday evening @ Hudson Terrace. This is a very popular party with an amazing crowd.

We will be on the first floor of the venue near the coat check area. 

Feel free to invite your family, friends and colleagues to join us at Hudson Terrace.

Gents reduced all night long- $20. Ladies free (Mention Rory's List to the door person.

There will be a 1 hour open bar from 10- 11pm.

Feel free to come solo. You are guaranteed to meet a fun and diverse group of people.

This event normally attracts people in their 20's, 30's and 40's.

Contact us if you have further questions.

Cheers,

Events Organizer,

Rory

results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
THE GAME

Informal Meet Up. 8 vs 8. 2 subs per team. No Permit. Be warned - there may or may not be a permitted event at the location which could cancel our game.

Bring a white and black t-shirt, and good attitude.

This game is ideally for intermediate to advanced players, not for beginners.

RSVP GUIDELINES. IMPORTANT:

- If you RSVP and don't show, you'll be benched from this group for the next two weeks. - If you can't make it, Un RSVP, to give others a chance to play.

- If you didn't RSVP or are on the Waitlist, you're at the bottom of the line.

PLAY GUIDELINES

- No slide tackles.

- Respect your teammates and opponents.

- If you fight, you will be banned from the group, permanently.

- If you dribble more than you pass - you annoy everybody and will be banned from the group.

POSITIONS:

Being a pick up game, there are no permanent positions. If you've been playing forward for half the game and someone who's been playing the back line wants to play up front, give up your position and play some defense. When your team lose the ball, don't just stand and watch. Please support your teammates by get back on your side and play some defense.

Thanks.

**INJURIES & DISCLAIMER**:

Group Organizer(s) and Group Organization Assumes NO Risk Or individual Liability For Personal Injuries Incurred By Members/Players On The Field Or During Any Of Our Activities: Pick Up Games, Or Other Events. By Agreeing To Play, You Are In Receipt Of This Information, And Thereby Warrant That You Are In Good Health And Assume Personal Responsibility For ALL Physical And Accidental Risks Involved With Playing In Our Group, Including But Not Limited to Falls, Injuries, Contact With Other Players, and Field Conditions.

results.description:
NEW CLASS STARTS TODAY

This is pool session one for new students starting their diving course.

Your Journey to Adventure starts today. After a brief presentation we will gear up and get started in the pool.

If you have not yet enrolled, please contact the Dive Center to get started [masked]

RSVP required

New Students, If this is your first pool session, you must: 
1. Complete the required academics before the pool session;

Online Students must complete Chapters 1 -6

CD Rom students must complete Sections 1-5

2. Bring a bathing suit and a towel. There are lockers in the changing room so bring a lock if you like.

3. Drink plenty of water before class

4. Don't forget to print out and bring your skills checklist.

5. Print out a copy of the Hand Signals to review and bring with you.

6. If you have not yet completed a "Student Folder" at the store.  Please print out, complete and bring the following three forms to the pool;

1. SDI General Liability Waiver Fill in ALL the blanks:

"Instructors": Kelley Scharf, Andre R.

"Facility": 1-877-SCUBA-USA",

"Agency" : SDI" 

Others": Pablo M. Jay K.

Sign and date at bottom

2. SDI Medical Info Waiver "Instructor": F. Ventura,  "Facility: 1-877-SCUBA-USA ,"City of" Paramus "state of" N.J.

3. Student Information Form</a>

If you have answered YES to any of the medical question; Please print out and have your MD complete the following <a href="http://www.1877scubausa.com/forms/SDI_Physician_Sign_Off_2013.pdf">Physician Sign-Off Form

What equipment is required?

A mask, snorkel, fins and a weight belt suitable for SCUBA* and dive boots. A wetsuit is optional and recommended. We have special pricing for our students. Let us know when you would like to come in to be fitted for your student equipment package. Most important is that you will get the "Right Gear, the Right Fit at the Right Price" *Note: Snorkeling equipment is not always suitable for SCUBA activities.

Please arrive on time, late arrivals are subject to rescheduling and fees.

If you have any questions please email or call the shop

Using Dive Computers; To help familiarize you with how they work go to: Why it's a good idea for Divers to own their own SCUBA gear?

RSVP Now

Please RSVP for all pool sessions. RSVPs are required so that we have sufficient staffing for each session. Students who do not RSVP may not get on the roster.No shows are subject to a $29 rescheduling fee.

results.description:
Recall and Refresh your SCUBA Skills

RSVP required


Has it been a while since you have been diving? Have 12 months gone by and you are planning a big trip? Do you want the reassurance that you are doing everything properly? Lets try to retrieve the data necessary data. The "Total Recall"/Inactive Diver Program will get you back up to speed. During the course, your Instructor will review equipment assembly and maintenance, dive planning, hand signals, proper ascents and descents, emergency procedures, and buoyancy. By the end of this course you will be able to enjoy your next big dive with confidence and ease.

results.description:
Thanks to the amazing turn out last week. Couldn't have been better! Awesome weather, no drama games, and the majority of the games were very close. There was one blow out game so I had to shuffle it to make it more competitive.

Mike P. and Ricky Lu play some incredible defense (or was it bad QB'ing on the other team) in picking off 3 passes for TD's. There were some good QB'ing by Mike D. and "I want the best players on my team or I'll cry" Yury. 

This Sunday's weather appears to be pretty nice, climbing close to the 50's. Please remember to RSVP (Richie, Mike P, Mike M). Those that can't RSVP may be forced to sit out the first game!

Yours truly,

Miketator

***************

 
Attendance will be strictly enforced. No-shows will be marked and posted on the subsequent meetup. First time offenders will be given the benefit of doubt, second time offenders will be warned (consider your name in this email and the number of times you no-showed as warning) and those who miss a third time will be banned,permanently! Those that show up without RSVP to circumvent this will be warned as well. We need to know how many people will show up in order to decide if we have enough people for a game that week.

All new members are allowed to play for free the first three games. If you decide to continue with us then please remit the membership fee. Our season starts on 9/1 and the $10 is good for all games for the year.

By attending our games you agree to assume any and all risks involved in these games.

results.description:
So it's technically still winter, despite the fact that our single-digit weather days are being mixed with 60° days. Let's get out to Ebersole ice rink and do some skating if it hasn't all melted. We did this last year and it was a lot of fun!

I know 8:30 AM is terribly early for a Sunday morning, but it's the only time Ebersole offers adults-only skating, and we have the added bonus of being the first ones on the ice. That means smooth ice and no kids tripping all over you! Instead, I'll be tripping all over you and roughing up the ice in the process.

Skating will set you back $10, and if you need to rent skates, that's $5. Parking at Ebersole is plentiful and free.

We'll have a brunch event after skating ends. Click here to sign up for that event too!
results.name: Ice skating (and brunch)!

results.description:
We will be gathering at the entrance to the Wildlife Sanctuary where there is a gate.   We begin with opening words and people introducing themselves. Then we will walk around this park that has woods, marsh, open water, and plenty of paths.  As we go, we will pause for reflection, nature spiritual practices, and to learn about and identify birds.  

Please do RSVP so I can let you know of any changes due to weather.   Led by Rev. LoraKim Joyner.  


Bring binoculars (I will have spares) and comfortable walking shoes, and dress warmly.

If you get lost, you can contact me on my mobile:  [masked]-9574.

results.description:
e

Arrive by 8:45 ....meet everyone ..... Guided walk by experienced Audubon naturalist .....  Be on time we will start walk at 9:00 AM sharp

POINT LOOKOUT PARK & LIDO BEACH PASSIVE NATURE PRESERVE

Dress Warm for the day ...comfortable shoes , gloves .....bring field glasses ..camera ..

From the Southern State Parkway, exit onto the Meadowbrook State Parkway south. Exit from the Meadowbrook at Loop Parkway (just before the Jones Beach toll booths) toward Point Lookout. The Loop Parkway ends west of Point Lookout at Lido Boulevard. Continue straight across Lido Boulevard into Point Lookout Park. Travel past the ticket booths and curve left into the very large parking lot on the south side of the park. Park in the southeast corner, closest to the private homes of the village of Point Lookout and the beach. We will walk east along the beach toward Jones Inlet. Afterwards ......Lunch at Local Diner .....optional ....

results.description:
Flag Football Game at Cunningham Park (196th St and Union Turnpike) in Queens. Come out and join us!

We have cones and flags so all you need is cleats if that is what you prefer. GAMES WILL ALWAYS BE PLAYED REGARDLESS OF THE WEATHER CONDITIONS i.e. rain, snow, cold, mud, ice, storm, hurricane, etc...we never cancel games due to weather...games are fun and competitive, all skill levels are welcome, please contact me if you have any questions.

NOTE: PLEASE RSVP "YES" ONLY IF YOU ARE GOING TO SHOW UP TO THE GAME.  YOU CAN CHANGE YOUR RSVP IF SOMETHING COMES UP (OR IF YOU DON'T WANT TO PLAY IF IT'S TOO COLD/IT'S RAINING/IT'S SNOWING) AND YOU CAN'T MAKE IT.  NO-SHOWS WILL BE REMOVE FROM THE GROUP.  IT IS IMPORTANT TO HAVE AN ACCURATE HEAD COUNT SO WE KNOW HOW MANY PEOPLE ARE REALLY COMING.

ere are some of the new changes we have made and a reminder of some of the guidelines we already have:

1) You can not add  guests to your RSVP.  Anyone is free to come and play IF AND ONLY IF you have a profile in meetup and have joined our group.  It's 100% FREE to join and it only takes about 2 minutes to sign up and RSVP.  There are also FREE mobile apps for iPhones and Android phones so you can RSVP easily on the go.  If any of your friends has been playing and wants to continue to play, ask them to go to http://www.meetup.com/Cunningham-Park-Football/ and sign up and RSVP individually.  YOU CAN NOT PLAY if you're not signed up and RSVPd.

2) The first 20 people that RSVP for the game, will play a 9-on-9 game with 1 sub.  Everyone on the waiting list will pick players and play against the winner of the game.  Games will be to 2 scores.  If a team gets 2 scores, with the score 2-1, the other team gets one (1) more possession to try to score and tie the game.  If the game is tied again, the game is now to 3 points and the same rule applies, once one of the teams gets score #3, the other team gets just one (1) more possession to try to tie the game.  If 20 or less players show up to the game, game can be played to whatever score everyone agrees to.

3) If you're one of the first 20 to RSVP, but you're late, the next person on the waiting list that's present on the field will take your place and play in the first game.

4) On a safety, ball stays at the goal line and the next down will be played.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and a safety occurs, the ball stays at the goal line and the 3rd down will be played.

5) On an OBVIOUS "Defensive Pass interference", the ball will stay at the line of scrimmage but you reset your plays and start at 1st down again.  For example: If a 3rd down play is ran and a DPI occurs, the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and a 1st down will be played, then 2nd, then 3rd...etc.

6) On an OBVIOUS "Offensive Pass interference", the ball stays at the line of scrimmage and the offensive time will lose a down.  For example: If a 2nd down play is ran and an OPI occurs, the offensive team will now be on a 4th down situation from the line of scrimmage.

7) As you might have noticed we have had very few injuries (knock on wood) throughout the years.  This is why we wanted to remind you of the following:

-Stiff arming, flag guarding and hand slapping are NOT ALLOWED.

-Blocks from the back are NOT allowed ad they're obviously dangerous and can cause injuries.

-VERY IMPORTANT: If you are the offensive player and have the ball in your hands, you MUST avoid contact and CAN NOT under any circumstances lower your shoulders and try to initiate contact with an defensive player.  This is flag football, if you're looking for a different type of game there are plenty of other places and leagues to play flag or full-contact football.

8) Donations:  I pay the monthly fee for hosting these meetups and never charge anyone.  All we asked for you is to drop at least $1 in the container we have set up for this, all the money is used for equipment, flags, cones, etc.  You can click on "Group Tools > Money" and see where all the money is going.  If we buy anything with that money we record the transaction and upload a picture of the receipt of whatever equipment we bought.  Next thing we want to get are end zone weighted pylons and we want to buy orange rope so we can mark the field faster and more accurately to avoid any arguments about where the first down is or what not.

IMPORTANT: WE ARE ALL ADULTS AND OBVIOUSLY CAN'T FORCE ANYONE TO DO ANYTHING.  WE NEED EVERYONE'S COOPERATION TO FOLLOW THESE SIMPLE GUIDELINES TO KEEP THE GAME FUN AND COMPETITIVE.  IF FOR ANY REASON YOU DISAGREE OR BELIEVE THAT THESE GUIDELINES DO NOT FIT YOUR STYLE OF PLAY OR WHAT YOU'RE LOOKING FOR ON A PICK-UP GAME, YOU'RE WELCOME TO PLAY WITH A DIFFERENT MEETUP GROUP OR IN ANY OTHER PICK-UP GAME...NO HARD FEELINGS.

If you have any suggestions, questions or concerns, please feel free to reach me at[masked] or [masked]

Regards,

Carlos

results.description:
I am the trip leader for this event and there are 43 already signed up with 4 more available spots.  Please call me at[masked] if interested.

Dave

Jackson Hole, WYOMING February 28 - March 6, 2016

HOW TO REGISTER FOR THIS TRIP

Jackson Hole Mountain Resort is notorious for steep terrain and gorgeous scenery, the perfect stomping grounds to many of the world’s best freeskiers. Located in Teton Village, Wyoming, just south of the Grand Teton National Park, Jackson Hole is home to some of the most hair-raising slopes in America where steep fiends go to play. The ski area receives an average of 450 inches of snowfall each year and boasts a vertical of more than 4,000 feet. The resort may be known for having extreme terrain, but there are plenty of options for beginners and intermediates. Jackson Hole also has spectacular views of the Tetons and the surrounding valley and is consistently ranked as one of the best ski resorts in North America.

(via OnTheSnow.com)

Trip Details

FLIGHT Roundtrip non-stop Newark to JAC/Jackson Hole (United Airlines)DATES Sunday to SundayAIRPORT TRANSFER and DAILY private transportation to/from Teton Village (ski area)LODGE 7 nights at the Forty-Niner InnFOOD Deluxe daily cold continental breakfastTICKETS 5-of-6 day lift ticket at JHMR, or 4-of-6 at JHMR with 1 day at Grand Targhee Mountain Resort (add $45, transportation provided)WELCOME RECEPTIONGROUP DINNERPRICE $1440/pp double occupancy (other options available)TRIP LEADER David Kimmelman (Dk10522 @ gmail.com)

Trip Description

Fabled terrain nestled in mountains of legendary beauty, an authentic cowboy town that everyone else tries to emulate, a direct flight from the New York region, and voted among America's best ski areas for a million years running...Jackson Hole has got to be near the top of your bucket list!

The Jackson Hole Mountain Resort is divided into 2 interlinked mountains; Rendezvous Mountain and Apres Vous Mountain. Rendezvous Mountain is home to some of the most extreme terrain in North America. It has a continuous vertical rise of 4,139 feet with endless steeps, powder filled open bowls, chutes, gullies, cliffs, ridges and trees – an expert snow rider's dream! The best powder runs at Jackson Hole are from the summit down Rendezvous Bowl to the bottom of the Hoback chutes.

Apres Vous Mountain is the tamer of the two mountains, home to the majority of Jackson Hole's groomed intermediate trails, Casper and Saratoga Bowls. The trails under the Apres Vous Chairlift are wide, not too steep and are often groomed. In windy conditions the Saratoga Bowl remains sheltered and is suitable for competent intermediates. This is the place to tackle some fun powder tree skiing and snowboarding. The lower slopes on Apres Vous Mountain house gentle sheltered beginner trails excellent for learning. The Mountain Sports School at Jackson Hole have professional instructors for all ages and ability levels. The 2006/2007 winter season saw the introduction of the Sweetwater Chairlift which links gentle beginner terrain to intermediate terrain at mid-mountain level creating a gradual transition from green slopes to blues.

(via PowderTravel.com)

Lodging

Located in downtown Jackson, Wyoming and set amid Jackson’s wonderful restaurants, shops, art galleries, and nightspots, the newly-renovated 49er Inn features 30 beautiful fireplace suites, and has a great location and many amenities.

With 140 rooms and suites, extended continental breakfast, 35 person indoor hot tub, 12 person outdoor hot tub, fitness room, sauna, and 2 conference rooms, the 49'er Inn and Suites easily accommodate your lodging needs.

The Inn is three blocks west of Jackson's Town Square - within “crawling” distance of the World Famous Million Dollar Cowboy Bar!

New guests and returning visitors will appreciate all of the Inn's brand new updates and renovations to one of Jackson Hole Wyoming's favorite properties. All of the 60 suites and 80 deluxe rooms were renovated as part of the project. Drawing inspiration from the mining-centered old West, the refashioned hotel boasts a new ambiance with remodeled hallways, accent walls, historical art as well as updated window treatments, bathroom fixtures, and decorative tile.

The exterior of the familiar property has an entirely different feel with a grand porte-cochere entrance, expansive lobby, and stylish interior swimming and spa pool overlooking Snow King Mountain.

Lodge Amenities:

Newly renovated indoor swimming pool and spa pool overlooking Snow King MountainCompletely renovated guest rooms featuring old-West inspired decor and new bathroom fixturesComplimentary Deluxe Continental BreakfastIndoor and Outdoor Hot TubsAAA and 3 Diamond RatingLCD Flat Screen TelevisionsBeautiful two room luxury suites with jacuzzi, fireplace, kitchen and steam showerFireplace rooms availableBusiness CenterADA rooms available with roll in showersWinter Car Plug-InsNon-Smoking roomsFitness roomPet FriendlySaunaComplimentary winter ski shuttles

OPTIONAL DAY (transportation provided)

Grand Targhee Resort located in nearby Alta, Wyoming within the Caribou-Targhee National forest is known for deep powder combined with excellent terrain options. Located near the border of Idaho and Wyoming, Grand Targhee is situated on the west side of the grand Tetons and is consistently hit by Pacific-born storms that stack up against the Tetons.

The ski area is home to an excellent trail system that has terrain options for all abilities. The resort provides guests with spectacular scenery combined with great snow and a laid back atmosphere. The ski area is a paradise for powder lovers and is full of great diverse and fun terrain.

(via OnTheSnow.com)

results.description:
This run starts at the "Wild Duck Pond" area of the Saddle River County Park in Ridgewood. We will start at the beginning of the mile markers which is near the exit, not near the entrance. There's parking close to the beginning of the path. If you cannot park in the lot nearest the beginning of the path, you'll need to reenter the park and park in the next closest lot. The driving area of the park is U-shaped so to get to the parking lot closest to the start of the run, you essentially drive around the "U" and approach the exit to the last lot on the right (by the dog park).


We will start at the "Wild Duck Pond Area" and will turn around at the 2 mile marker. If you'd like to run more or less, you are certainly welcome to do so as the mile markers make it simple to track your distance. If you wish to run at a slower pace, I am more than happy to run with you at your preferred pace. Nobody gets left in the dust. This is a fun run, not a competition.

If you RSVP "Yes", please do your best to be on time. With the cold weather, we will get rolling on time so that our runners don't get too cold waiting for others to show. 

If you have questions, comments, or doubts, feel free to email me.

Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Hartshorne Woods County Park- Rocky Point entrance

Easy to moderate hike due to terrain.  Approximately 5 miles over rolling hills with views of the Navesink River, Shrewsbury River, and Ocean. We’ll also go past Battery Lewis which was active during World War II.  Option of an early out at approximately mile 3. Bring water and snack. Hiking shoes required; traction devices if needed.  Hiking poles recommended. Inclement weather cancels. Any updates due to weather or trail conditions will be posted by 7am morning of the hike.

Use GPS address: 200 Portland Road, Highlands, NJ (continue on the main road about ½ mile to the entrance of the park)

Directions: Take Garden State Parkway to Exit 117. Keep left after toll booth
towards Route 36 East (Keyport, Keansburg, Sandy Hook).  Continue on Route 36 East approximately 12-14 miles. Make right onto Portland Road before bridge to Sandy Hook (gray building on corner).  Follow Portland Road to park entrance.

Risk disclaimer:  Please remember this is a social event and not a professionally guided hike. By participating in this event, you are agreeing not to hold anyone responsible for injuries or accidents, and you acknowledge hiking is a dangerous activity that could lead to serious injury or death. Always come prepared and equipped as if you are hiking on your own.  In the event of an emergency, your fellow hikers will do their best for you, but there is no
guarantee any of the participants will have medical or rescue training.  By participating in this event you also acknowledge that you understand the level of difficulty and are physically capable, properly attired and have the necessary gear and supplies required for participation in this activity.

venue.name: Sam's Point Ice Caves, Dwarf Pines and Verkeerderkill Falls

results.description:
Contact:   Mike Clancy  [masked]


The Sam't Point Preserve is at the south end of the Shawangunk Ridge off State Route 52 in Cragsmoor, NY.  It is now part of Minnewaska State Park. The Visitor's Center opens and 9AM.  Parking fee is $10/car.  There is some great information/videos at the park web site:  http://www.nysparks.com/parks/193/details.aspx


The hike: This is a loop hike. We will start from the Visitor's Center and follow the easy Shawangunk Ridge Trail (SRT) to the cliffs for some spectacular views. From there we'll continue along the ridge and through forest to the 150+ foot high Verkeerder Kill Falls. We'll then continue along ridges and through forets to High Point where we will break for lunch/snacks.   We'll then take the carriage road back.

Start time:  10:00 AM sharp                   Duration: Approx 5 hrs

Distance:  Approx. 8 miles         Difficulty:  Moderate

Elev. Gain: Approx 1000'

Gear:  proper footwear, clothing for changing temps,  water,               snacks/lunch

                                                         ***********

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

results.description:
Meeting Your Dark Attraction And Awakening To Your Divine Nature 


AN EXPLORATION OF FANTASIES, SEX AND LOVE

with Dr. Kristina Kincaid

Scuba Divers do an in depth exploration, Rock Climbers do it against the wall, Rockstars do it loud and Politicians do it to everyone. What exactly is this thing we do called sex and why are we so obsessed with it? What makes it so pleasurable, titillating, frightening and shameful? This day long journey is for participants who are willing to venture and play where angels fear to tread. We will be working in the deep unconscious, uncovering where we turn away from some of our greatest gifts by delving into what has been deemed unspeakable and taboo.


Through exploration of sexual fantasies, sexual constellation work, untamed passions, conscious play, body work, breath work, movement, intimacy, connection and respectful service to each other, we can come home to ourselves through a deep honoring of our gorgeous, unique and individual ways of loving.


IN THIS WORKSHOP YOU WILL LEARN:

- to deeply understand the powerful relationship between sexual fantasies and your deepest heart desires,

- how the dynamics of your sexual fantasies play out in your daily life,- how to move through the abuse of the sexual to sexual integrity,

- to access the full power of sexual fantasy as your tool for liberation and empowerment,

- to radically submit and accept the sexual as your wisdom teacher,

- to navigate the razor's edge between domination and submission and mutuality,

- how “being a lover” is a commitment to the act of generosity and transcending the self,

- why most sexual failure is not a crisis of technique but of imagination,


Admission: $150 before Feb 14th $175 after


Tickets:https://www.eventbrite.com/e/sexual-fantasies-meeting-your-dark-attraction-tickets-21001084810

When you register or attend, please make a point to tell the facilitator that you heard about this event from the Pleasure Without Borders Meetup


Dr. Kincaid is the Director of The Institute of Integral Evolutionary Tantra, New York City. Kristina is on faculty at The Institute of Core Energetics and holds an M.A. in Energy Medicine and a Doctorate in Theology from Holos University. She is also a graduate of the Institute of Core Energetics and Barbara Brennan School of Healing. Her journey has taken her into deep explorations and healing around sexuality. She has a healing practice in NYC.

Keep in touch:

http://integralevolutionarytantra.com/

http://www.meetup.com/integral-evolutionary-tantra/
results.name: Sexual Fantasies: Meeting Your Dark Attraction

WRAM Show, the largest RC model exhibition on the east coast for almost 50 years, will be held at the Meadowlands Exposition Center at Harmon Meadow, Secaucus, NJ, Feb. 26, 27 and 28. 

This 2016 Show spotlights the drone revolution with new exhibitors and a special multicopter flying area. 


Safety Third Racing is proud to have an exhibition booth  right along side our good friends and world class racing team, FPV Addiction.  

Both teams will be the only quadcopter pilots in the newly expanded  FPV flying area and have already been preselected.  Historically, the netted area has been off to the side against a wall in the back , but this year, the flying area will be in the center of the exhibition.


In addition to exhibits by some 150 or more manufacturers and organizations, the show is a magnet for modelers who compete for prizes in a static competition that is staggering for its size and the beauty of the models on display.

You can RSVP here to let others know you plan on attending, but you MUST go here to arrange tickets to the event:

http://www.wram.org/wram-show

Meadowlands Exposition Center at Harmon Meadow

results.description:
Living from Open-Hearted Awareness

Awakening is not something only a few spiritually evolved humans can achieve: it is part of everyone's natural potential. Rather than meditating to calm and focus your mind, we will learn to intentionally shift into open-hearted awareness, which is already calm, stable, and able to effortlessly focus. It is possible to know and live from your True Self with a deep sense of well-being, creativity and unconditional love.

Loch will draw from the ancient wisdom of Sutra Mahamudra and other nondual traditions, as well as current neuroscientific research to point us beyond our ego-centered identity in order to live from an open-hearted awareness.

We will learn how to know your true nature and live from open-hearted awareness through contemporary versions of ancient wisdom practices such as effortless mindfulness, nondual awareness, embodied presence and small glimpses many times. We will discover that ignorance and confusion will begin to liberate and all experiences, parts of ourself, and emotions are welcomed.

• Pre-Registration online HERE is $60.

• Registration at the door is $70


About Loch Kelly, MDiv., LCSW:


Loch is the author of, Shift into Freedom: The Science and Practice of Open-Hearted Awareness. He is an educator, consultant, and recognized leader in the field of nondual meditation and psychotherapy who was asked to teach Sutra Mahamudra by Mingyur Rinpoche and nondual realization by Adyashanti. The founder of the Open-Hearted Awareness Institute, he is an emerging voice in modernizing meditation, social engagement, and collaborating with neuroscientists at Yale, UPenn and NYU to study how awareness training can enhance compassion and wellbeing. For more, visit lochkelly.org.

Please visit www.lochkelly.org for more information about his book, Audio CD, and upcoming events.

results.description:
Please join us for today’s service led by UUCP member Al Stawsky. “Jazz” originated uniquely from the African American experience in the United States.  Today it is a powerful worldwide cultural presence.  It is expressed and reflected in many musical forms.  But, what is Jazz?  How and why did it come to be?  What does it “mean”?  What makes Jazz spiritual and how can Jazz change your life?  How does Jazz connect with Unitarian Universalism? These questions will be explored and discussed in this Sunday Service.  Excerpts and examples will be given.

Bring a friend and stay for coffee and light refreshments. We look forward to seeing you!
results.name: Jazz – Let The Spirit Move You
