results.description:
Hi everyone,

Please be there on time so you can get set up, and bring a white and a red t-shirt.

If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Thank you,

Paul

Details Below:

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List:

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
Hey Outdoor Afros!


We hope you and your families will join us for a special tour of Black Harlem for Black History Month!!! 

We will spend the morning learning and discussing African and African American history in connection to the wonderful home and place to many of us--Harlem. This event is perfect for Outdoor Afros of all ages.

About the Tour

We will meet this Sunday, Feburary 28th at 10:45am at the Northwest corner of 135th Street and Lenox (Malcolm X) Avenue--In front of the Schomburg Center. This tour will but provided via Big Onion Tour, so you must go to their website and pay for your tour directly and in advance. The cost for th tour is $20 for Adults and $15 for Students, Seniors and BHS members. To register and pay, please do so here: 

http://www.bigonion.com/tour/black-history/

The walking tour will last for about 2 hours so please be sure to dress comfortabilty and wear supportive walking shoes. The tour will emphasize the founding of Harlem, the great Harlem Renaissance and explore the history of Harlem for Black History Month. 

About Outdoor Afro’s #HealthyHolidays Campaign

Throughout the country, Outdoor Afro is hosting events aimed at being intentional about Black family health. Whether you’re headed out of town for the holidays or hosting family, we have ideas and events for you and your family to enjoy. For more information visit: 

http://www.outdoorafro.com/2015/10/healthy-holidays-incorporating-the-outdoors-in-our-seasonal-celebrations/


What to Bring on the Tour:

Your Friends and Family

Water

Comfortable shoes

Warm jacket, scarf, hat (Weather permitting, we will visit some historical locations outside)

Transportation 

The Schomburg Center is easily accessed from the following train stops:

2 or 3 at 135th Street

Outdoor Afro Waiver/ Release: 


Please be sure to bring a SIGNED copy of our release.

http://files.meetup.com/2045381/REQUIRED%20Outdoor%20Afro%20Trip%20Waiver.pdf


Hope to see you there!
results.name: Outdoor Afro Black History: Harlem Walking Tour

Careful where you park - BE EARLY
Leave no Trace


Please have a map and compass for this hike.  For bushwacks, I also recommend long pants and eye protection. 

Please check and make sure the pin marked on this site is correct on your GPS, sometimes they do not work correctly.  There is no cell service usually at the starting sites, so I will not know if you are lost or late.

Intermediate pace, we will hit Vly's canister first, then head over to Bearpen.

View on Bearpen

---

The DEC limits group size in this area to 20.

---

WARNING REGARDING BUSHWHACKS: "Bushwhacks" are hikes that go off of maintained trails and through pure wilderness.  Please make sure you are very confident in your ability to navigate through the woods without trails since it is very easy to get lost in these forests, especially in the summer.  Map & Compass REQUIRED. GPS is also recommended, but it is not a substitute for a map & compass and the skills to use them effectively.

---

NOTE: You are responsible for bringing appropriate gear, supplies, clothing, first aid, and lights. You should review topographic maps and trail features carefully; understanding topography of any hike is key to your knowing where you are, where you're going, and how to get back. See suggestions for GEAR on the "About" page for additional gear ideas.

You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below. 

If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.

Your attendance on a hike signifies that you have read and accept the terms of this liability waiver.  Full waiver can be found on the ABOUT page.

results.description:
Philip Roth rarely fails to entertain, and his darkly comic Sabbath's Theater should live up to our expectations. It is also the first longer read of the year, weighing in at over 400 pages. 

The central character of the novel, Mickey Sabbath, is a 64-year-old forced into retirement because of arthritis. The theater of the novel's title refers to Mickey's puppet act from the 1960s that was performed by his middle finger while his other fingers deftly set about disrobing female members of the audience.

Lechery, it seems, is Mickey's vocation in life and Roth is blithely indifferent to political correctness. Most of the novel is a gleeful recounting of Mickey's many infidelities. Even his grief at the death of his latest mistress is a motivated more by anxieties about this failing powers of seduction than by any romantic longing. Mickey plunders the underwear drawer of his best friend's daughter in search of an aid to masturbation, he sneers at his wife's attempts to combat alcoholism, and he urinates on the grave of a former mistress. 

Like Alexander Portnoy, the famously self-abusing character in Roth's 1969 novel Portnoy's Complaint, Sabbath has an appetite for acts of exhibitionism, voyeurism, fetishism, and auto-eroticism. But while Portnoy's antics were usually comical and liberating, Sabbath often feels imprisoned by his own acts of self-indulgence. Though his frantic pursuit of sex is a desperate attempt to abate his anxieties about death, it only serves to obliterate any semblance of real life he could have had.
results.name: Philip Roth's Sabbath's Theater--Winner of the National Book Award

results.description:
Register Here

Event Description 


Experience the beauty of the night sky with Stan Honda, who will show us why we need to preserve this diminishing resource. Stan will walk you through various techniques and camera settings necessary to get amazing DSLR photographs of the Milky Way, the moon, the stars, and other objects that populate the night sky. He’ll discuss how to plan shots using software and apps even from New York City. A brief tutorial will be presented on how best to process these images on a computer so that your images will fill your viewers with the same sense of wonder that the starry sky does.

ABOUT STAN
Stan Honda is a photojournalist with 34 years of experience in New York City and southern California. Over the past few years he has also been working on wide-angle night sky landscapes and other astronomical images taken in locations around the world and even in New York City. He has been a National Park Service artist-in-residence in four national parks. Stan’s recent photos have appeared in NASA’s Astronomy Picture of the Day website, Sky and Telescope magazine and a Yahoo News slideshow on his night sky photos. He recently had a solo exhibit of his photographs in Flagstaff, AZ and was part of a group show in Albuquerque, NM.

Learn more about Stan at www.stanhonda.com
results.name: Night Sky Photography with Stan Honda

results.description:
Topic: Heritage of Nonviolent Action

Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis, Leader, RYSEC

Details: We all actively or passively support systems and actions that encourage the enjoyment of violence. How can we do something active, positive, to break the cycle of violence, even if we can’t do everything? Why don’t we know more about the history of nonviolent action? Has nonviolent action been effective?  How is nonviolent action different from pacifism? From being passive? 

About the Speaker: Jone Johnson Lewis is the clergy Leader of the Riverdale-Yonkers Society for Ethical Culture. Jone has been an Ethical Culture Leader since 1991, serving Ethical Societies in Chicago, Northern Virginia and Brooklyn. She's currently the President of the National Council of Leaders and a member of the American Ethical Union's Membership Committee. 

More information: http://www.rysec.org/event/heritage-nonviolent-action

NON-COMPETITIVE CO-ED SOCCER GAMES IN EAST RIVER

                                      Check our Facebook page:

                   facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer 

                             NO CLEATS OR PLASTIC STUDS ALLOWED

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/ManhattanInternationalCoedSoccer"></a>

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=nzhrn3ldY4U

GAME DESCRIPTION:

Our games are for all levels and people that prefer to play a non-competitive game of soccer, break a sweat while exercising running up and down the field with the ball and all this happening in a very laid-back and non-judgmental environment. Please, arrive 10 minutes before the game so we can get the teams set up.

Game Format:

We'll play three simultaneous games of 8 on 8, with small goals. There will be 6 teams on the field and we will play three games, 30 minutes/game. Every 30 minutes we will have a short break and teams will switch to play against different team. Please check our meetup message board on Saturday night or before 11.00 am on Sunday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

RULES OF THE GAME:

1-First and most important rule of the game is to have fun and enjoy the time on the field!

2-Rough play and offensive language will absolutely not be tolerated!!! In plain words, no slide tackling, no pushing and no telling off.

3-No power shots allowed.

4-If you don't sign up for the game, do not show up.

5-If you are late for the game, you must wait until the game in progress is over to join your team.


6-Those that don't comply with these rules, will kindly be asked to leave the field so others can enjoy the game.

Any other questions regarding the rules of the game or anything else, should be directed to the organizer directly or to the assistant organizer/s!!!

Please check our meetup message board on Friday night or before 12:00 PM on Saturday to see what team you are on. This will save us a lot of time on the field.

Location:

East River Park FIELD B (1/2 Track Field), 6th Street & FDR Take the F or V train to 2nd Avenue Lower East Side Station and walk for about 7 - 10 minutes to the East River Park, the L train to 14th Street, but the walk distance is longer from 14th Street or 4 5 6 train to Union Square then catch the 14B bust and get off on 6th street and just cross the path. If you live in the area, you can just walk or ride the bike. Call me if you can’t find the field [masked] Milton

What to bring with you:

A pair of sneakers, indoor or turf shoes(No CLEATS), shin guards (recommended) and lots of water. There is a water fountain next to the park if you need extra water.

Fee:

You will be asked to pay $9.50 when you RSVP. This $9.50 is used to pay for, facilities permits, meetup fees, Amazon fees, goals, cones, soccer balls etc.

Refunds & Weather Policy:

Refunds will be issued if the RSVP is changed by Wednesday before 12.00PM or if the game is cancelled. The game can be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe like heavy rain, snow or thunder.

After the game we'll head to Royale for brunch and a Pint or Two:

If you would like to attend the workshop, we are asking you to RSVP at: https://thequantopianworkshopnyc.splashthat.com/.

Introduction to Algorithmic Trading

This introductory level workshop will give you a strong foundation to craft better trading algorithms. 

It will:

• Give you the ability to create and backtest your own basic trading strategies.

• Show you how to use algorithmic trading tools that will help you craft your strategies.

• Teach you how to correct for some of the statistical biases that can disrupt analysis.

The curriculum has been vetted and used to teach lectures by professors at top-tier universities, including: Harvard, Cornell, and Stanford.

Prerequisites to Attend

Attendees should have beginner knowledge of Python and college level math experience. And you will need to bring your laptop. 

Reserve your Spot

Tickets for The Workshop are: $675.00. Meals and snacks will be provided. Space is limited and spots will be on a first come, first serve basis. We are keeping The Quantopian Workshop intentionally small in order to give attendees the best hand-on learning experience. 

For more information and to RSVP, please RSVP here.

The Lecturer

The workshop has been developed by Delaney Granizo-Mackenzie, engineer and academic lead at Quantopian, whose focus is on the intersection of computer science, statistics, and finance. His background includes seven years of bioinformatics research and delivering lectures at schools including Harvard and MIT. Have a question or a comment?

Reach out to Delaney at [masked]. He would love to hear from you! 

You can also visit us at: https://www.quantopian.com/workshops.

results.description:
A small, supportive group for artists of all types to come together and talk about and share their creative projects in a fun, non-judgmental environment. New members welcome. (Each person pays $1 cash at the meetings, just to help offset the costs of having the group hosted here on MeetUp.com.)

Every week, we meet from 12:00 pm to 2:00 pm. Usually, we work through Julia Cameron's creativity building techniques (for example those in The Artist's Way and The Prosperous Heart). We start each session discussing the current week's activity (morning pages, artist's dates, synchronicities, creative endeavors, etc) and then participate in an agreed upon exercise/task (bring paper and pen please).


Normally, on the third Sunday of the month, we share our artistic projects in a kind of "Show & Tell" so that we can get to know each other's work and support it. Not mandatory - only for those who wish to share or present their work.


This is a very creative and supportive small group. Please join us.
results.name: The Artist's Way

results.description:
FUTSAL ON SUNDAY AFTERNOONS

MUST RSVP ONLINE

Full refunds will be issued only when reservations are cancelled 24 hours before start time (Saturday 12pm) AT LATEST

You can RSVP for multiple players until slots are filled. 

Start time is 12pm and will run until 2:30pm. 


Gym floor, so wear flats. 1 flight upstairs from entrance door.

No goalies, so NO GOALKEEPING. Defenders with 2 feet inside own forbidden zone equals a penalty shot without a goalie from either opposing corner. Attackers inside opponent's forbidden zone equals loss of pocession. 


We will play 8-minute round-robin matches (winners stay on). There will be 3 teams of 5 players (4 and a sub). First team to score 3 goals wins the match. Winners must continue to win to stay on. Consecutive tied matches will be decided by coin flip. 

 Absolutely no Slide tackling is allowed. 


Please understand that in order to keep this meet-up active, we must enforce a No Fighting policy. Anyone fighting will be removed from the group.

So, let's do this! For any questions please contact me via Meet-up.

                       ~~~~@🔸☢🎱⚽️⚖⚽️🎱☢🔸@~~~~

                                  🔹🔶🔷🔵📛🔵🔷🔶🔹

FUTSAL DOMINGOS POR LA TARDE

HAY QUE RESERVAR EN LINEA

Re-enbolso de su pago se permitirá solo si se cancela 24 horas antes del evento (Sabado 12pm) AL MAS TARDAR.

Podras reservar para jugadores multiples hasta que se llenen los cupos.

Comenzamos a las 12pm y jugamos hasta las 2:30pm


Se juega sobre piso de gimnasio asi que usen zapatos de "indoor"

No hay porteros, asi que NO SE PUEDE PORTEREAR.  Defensa con 2 pies en Zona proibida propia equivale a penal sin portero desde cualquier esquina opuesta. Atacante ingresando a zona proibida rival equivale a perdida de posesion.

Se jugaran partidos de 8 minutos (ganadores siguen vivos). Habran 3 equipos de 5 jugadores (4 mas 1 cambio). El primero en anotar 3 goles gana el partido. Ganadores deberan seguir ganando para continuar vivos. Empates consecutivos se definirán por moneda.

Barridas estan Absolutamente Prohibidas

Por favor entiendan que para mantener este grupo acivo deberemos prohibir cualquier tipo de pelea o altercado. Todo aquel o aquella que pelee sera excluido (a) del grupo permanentemente. 

Asi que Vamos a Jugar!   Para cualquier consulta, por favor contacteme atravez de meetup.com.

results.description:
Mark Gerrard Presents:

"Mark G. Farewell Shoot w/Stephanie Dec, Neesy Rizzo & Cat Lopez - Feb. 28th"

Our fellow member and good friend, Mark Gerrard, will be moving to the west coast next month. He wanted to put together a shoot with some of his favorite models he has had the pleasure of shooting here in New Jersey and share this lineup with all of us. We are happy to host this amazing shoot and after finalizing details tonight we can finally give details and sign up info. Mark has put together a great lineup with the likes of members favorite Stephanie Dec, Neesy Rizzo and newcomer, model/actress Cat Lopez.

About the Shoot: 

This shoot will follow a free form style much like the group's usual Model Spotlight format. 3 looks from each model. (4th look pending time) Every shooter will have a certain amount of time with the model for each look so they can direct and have a mini one on one type of shooting experience. 

What to bring:

With this shoot, feel free to bring your speed lights with your preferred modifiers, if you wish. There will be lighting setup at certain stations for the three models but if you are opting to shoot, lets say outdoors or a location that doesn't have lighting during your time to shoot then your speed light will be more convenient for portability.

RSVP:

Deposit is required to secure a spot and also to have the financials in order for the models. So, only sign up if you know you will attend. Deposits are due at the time of signup.

Total Cost: $100

Deposit: $30 (Paypal)

(Don't mark the checkbox on the PayPal page as that adds the surcharge automatically. If we have to return a deposit for any reason, it will be less than originally deposited.)

Balance due at time of shoot: $70, Cash preferred, Credit Cards/Paypal ok with $5 added for surcharge.

Non-Commercial Release PDF will be emailed to you at the email address given on the sign in sheet.

Models: 

Neesy Rizzo: Instagram and Facebook

(PhotoCredits: NandoPro)

Stephanie Dec: MM#[masked]

(Photos provided by model for promotional purposes. All rights their respective owners.)

Cat Lopez: Facebook

(Photos from model's public social media page for promotional purposes. All rights their respective owners.)

About the Studio:

The studios is a beautiful 3,000 sq. ft., climate controlled,  fully functional studio. (Professional in-house lights, props, various seamless backdrops, actual commercial photography sets, kitchen, waiting room, meeting/presentation room, the works!) It's conveniently located to major highways and a 20-30 minute public transportation ride to and from NY.

Check-in Procedure and Disclaimers:

Check-in - When you arrive, there will be a quick check-in. This will mostly be so you can read and adhere to the studio/group shoot guidelines and make payment for the shoot before we start. This will also let us send you the release forms in PDF format if we don't have physical copies available.

Releases - We will have one non-commercial release signed by the model through the studio only. (No additional releases will be signed.) If you need a commercial release signed, you can make arrangements with the model directly. Additional compensation for this is between the model and photographer.

Right to Refuse - We have the right to refuse a member's RSVP to the Meetup. It's a small community and models keep detailed info on photographers also. If we feel there is justifiable reason to refuse a RSVP, we will exercise that right.

Signups - Please signup when you know you will attend. If the signup passes the point to book another model and then we get no shows it's not fair to your fellow photographers who would be on a waiting list. It also puts the organizers in a tough spot, financially after booking an additional model to compensate for a bigger group. In case of no show, we will have to remove you from the group. When emergencies come up, followup with an email and we can make exceptions on a case by case basis. 

Deposit - We have implemented a deposit system to insure that the minimum RSVP is met to hold the shoot. (Which varies from shoot to shoot.) This will ensure that the financials are or will be in place for the model/s beforehand. This deposit will be non-refundable, so make sure you sign up and pay the deposit when you are sure you will be able to attend. Signing up to the Meetup page does not ensure your spot until the deposit is made at the Paypal link provided on each event page. As the shoot date comes closer, if you have not paid the deposit, we will fill the unconfirmed spot immediately. You will receive a confirmation message or a confirmation comment on the Meetup page you are signing up for. Two days before the shoot, if the minimum RSVP has not been met then we will opt to cancel the shoot and refund any deposits already sent. This will give the model some time to book another gig if possible. But as usual, always check the Meetup page up to the date of the shoot for any updates.

Model Cancellation - If a model cancels/no show or a last minute model change occurs, you will have the option to cancel beforehand or not attend the Meetup on the day of, if it happens upon arrival to the Meetup. (Any refunds will be given or credit toward a future Meetup as per your request.)

Waitlist - When you are on a waitlist, please be mindful as this is also considered a RSVP of availability. So, if we add another model or someone cancels, your wait list status may upgrade to a "Yes" automatically. Please be on the lookout for updates on the Meetup page as Meetup sometimes takes longer to notify of a status change.

Updates - Updates will be made on this page up to the date of the Meetup or the night before. Emails will also be sent but Meetup emails are not always reliable to be sent to a receiver right away. (I've heard of emails arriving 3 hours later if at all.)

Postponements - Weather considerations will be made the night before a shoot or on the day of and the Meetup page will be updated as well as emails sent if a postponement occurs due to inclement weather or some other emergency. Lack of minimum RSVP to hold the event will also cause postponement of the shoot. The night before we would make the call wether to postpone so be on the look out for our email and Meetup page updates.

Any questions please Meetup message me or email me at [masked]
results.name: Mark G. Farewell Shoot w/Steph Dec, Neesy Rizzo & Cat Lopez - Feb. 28th

results.description:
Updated February 28th, 2016

WINTER (Dec-Feb)

As the city remains cold we play two times a week. We use Riverside Park with Morningside Park as a backup.

- Saturdays at 10am, Riverside Park (103rd & West End) 
- Sundays at 12pm, Riverside Park (103rd & West End)

This is one of three sites/listserves that promotes weekly games that have been going on for many many years. Stall counts are used on occasion, cleats are optional, boundaries are flexible, and all skill levels are welcome!

There are two ways to stay in touch outside of Meetup.com:

- Follow us on Twitter: http://www.twitter.com/nycultimate
- Like us on Facebook: http://www.facebook.com/nycultimate

Damien 

[masked]

RIVERSIDE DETAILS

The Riverside location is all the way West just off the water between 102nd and 108th Streets. You can only enter the park at 103rd and 108th. The best way to get there is to take the 1 local to 103rd Street. Walk West until you see an entrance that takes you down to the fields through the park. After walking down the steps from the street, you will see a path that goes left and another that goes right. Walk down the left path until you see a stone wall and stairs that go down to the fields. From South to North there will be one small soccer field surrounded by a track (red 'A' on map), another field with two softball fields (closer to 103rd/104th st) and another that is a giant soccer field (closer to 106th st). After walking down the steps, you will see the small Soccer field on your left. Start from this Southern-most field and walk North on the path to find our game. If you see no one, the meeting spot is the South side of the large soccer field. This spot is identified on the map below, a small square with little dots around it. On days when we can't find space at Riverside, we will move the game to Morningside Park (West 110th St and Manhattan Ave).

MORNINGSIDE DETAILS

The Morningside location is at the corner of 110th Street and Manhattan Avenue. The best way to get there is to take the C local (B on weekdays) to 110th Street. You can also take the 1 train to 110th street at Broadway and then walk East. We will play at the South end of the baseball field parallel to 110th street so that we're not in the way of the baseball/softball games. Riverside will be our backup if for some reason we need to change locations.

results.description:
We invite you to join us at the premier of AFROJAM BRUNCH.
Featuring Anthony Morgan & The Harlem Spirit of Gospel
on Sunday February 28 2016. This is a ticketed event and you can get yours HERE.


https://afrojamdotcom.files.wordpress.com/2016/02/1511488_675709849116938_1225324438_n.jpg?w=360&h=203

ANTHONY MORGAN  was born and raised in Harlem a multi-talented artist in his own right; he started singing at a late age of 21 in college at his musical theater company. In 1991 He formed his first band called Truth and Honesty and toured with The House of Blues Night clubs and Harlem owns Copeland’s soul food restaurant. Anthony was well known for being the heart and soul of the World’s Famous Harlem Choir at The BB King Blues Club and Grill Gospel Brunch for 8 years in Time Square. In 2008, Anthony patiently and carefully selected some of the most unique voices in New York and founded The Anthony Morgan’s Inspirational Choir of Harlem (AMICOH)The Harlem Spirit of Gospel and is Creative director of the Boys and Girls Choir of Harlem. Known for their versatile sound, they ministers through the gift of song, ranging from Gospel, to Pop and R&B. AMICOH brings their love of God and music to the stage. They come with impressive credits with their name. AMICOH has circled the globe to visit many diverse places, sharing the gifts God has given them. This includes: The Rachael Ray Show with Mary Tyler Moore, The Dr OZ show, The Auditorium of Rome, Teatro Smeraldo ,Theatre Academy of Conegliano Vento , the telecast SCALO 76, transmitted by Rai 2 and 8 years till Present of unforgettable sold-out tours in Europe where the enthusiastic audiences sang, danced and were completely captivated! They have recorded and toured with numerous prominent gospel and secular artists and in many other countries. They have been featured in various productions  venues, workshops master classes and seminars. Having been greatly rewarded by all of these accomplishments, they now look forward to their new journey with Anthony Morgan’s Inspirational Choir of Harlem the Harlem Spirit of Gospel!

results.description:
Are you looking for a complementary training to ENHANCE your overall well being on and off the track, to be more FLEXIBLE and RELEASE physical, mental and emotional tensions?


Are you looking for RELIEF from joint wear, tightness, pain, and/or discomfort?

$5 FOR FIRST CLASS TO CROSS TRAIN...

_________________________________________________

About Yin Yang Yoga...A typical Yoga class is ‘Yang’ in style and focuses on active heating and muscular contraction - by starting with ‘Yin’, a more passive, nourishing, and cooling practice, this uniquely designed class WILL enhance your alignment, performance, and overall sense of balance!


Why For Runners/Athletes? - Lengthening and releasing effect from repetitive movements on sheets of connective tissue can overtime shorten and tighten it in ingrained patterns around the muscles. This fascia restriction can make one more prone to having injuries, abnormal posture, and inefficiency, as well as asymmetrical weakening. By targeting rotated key areas in weekly Yin Yang Yoga For Runners class, one can experience tension release, fluid movement, and benefit from improved posture, circulation, injury prevention, as well as increased respiratory control and mental focus...

Each Yin Yang Yoga for Runners class begins with a series of held Yin/floor postures. While surrendering into the edge of each pose (for 2-5 minutes), students are guided to experience the discomforting stagnant energy and its release around the hips, thighs, and lower back, and be connected to the present moment. The Yang flow sequence designed to follow will allow students to integrate the newly released energy, joint spaces for greater circulation and achieve new level of flexibility and energy.  Guided Relaxation provided at the end will promise to be YUMMY!

__________________________________________________

Testimonies x3: "Jennifer is an awesome instructor. Her sessions are informative and her teaching style is patient, clear and inspires me to attain increased fitness. I look forward to attending her class. The very next day I was able to push through my usual 3-4 miles to complete a 6 mile run." Sandra

"I ran my best time running a 18 mile course the day after..." Lori

“ I started taking Jennifer's Yin/Yang Yoga for Runner's Class over the summer, and it was fantastic. I had never practiced yoga regularly before, and was pleasantly surprised at how it helped to improve my flexibility, running, and overall fitness. Jennifer is a great, hands-on teacher, and really knows how the body works. I highly recommend this class! ” Theresa

results.description:
The Beauty of Ballet (1:00pm)
Free Event - Call the Queens Theatre Box Office for reservations at[masked] The 45-minute, family-friendly presentation will illustrate how students develop into accomplished classical ballet dancers, alternating examples of advanced classroom training exercises with the performance of excerpts from notable ballets. School of American Ballet faculty member Katrina Killian (a former New York City Ballet soloist) and advanced students from the School of American Ballet will be featured in the enchanting and informative introduction to the art of classical ballet.

How do ballerinas dance on their toes? How do dancers spin and turn without getting dizzy? How do male dancers jump so high? Those questions and more will be answered during the demonstration, and favorite moments from ballets such as The Sleeping Beauty, George Balanchine’s The Nutcracker™, and Swan Lake will be performed to live music. The Beauty of Ballet is recommended for ages 4 through adult.

http://queenstheatre.org/content/beauty-ballet

GETTING THERE
http://queenstheatre.org/content/about-us

Queens Museum (2 - 5pm) (Suggested Admission)
Join us for an intimate exhibition walkthrough and interactive conversation with artist Zhang Hongtu, whose first major retrospective is on view at the Queens Museum until February 28, and invited guest Robert Lee, followed by a QA with Luchia Meihua Lee, Guest Curator.
http://www.queensmuseum.org/events/conversation-with-zhang-hongtu-and-robert-lee

results.description:
This is a weekly introductory improv class taught Sundays from 12:30-2:30pm.

-- Are you a bit shy and looking to get more comfortable with your public speaking? 

-- Are you a working professional hoping to be a bit more spontaneous during your meetings and interactions with co-workers? 

-- Or are you an actor or improv comedian looking to take your craft to the next level or get more reps?

Then this is the class for you! In this class, you will learn the fundamentals of scene work (role playing). You'll be on your feet quite a bit as I'm believer that you learn (and have more fun) through doing rather than hearing an instructor talk. Brief individual notes will be given, if that's what you're looking for, and tailored to your level of experience. At the end of each class, I'm confident you'll feel a sense of accomplishment that will leave you more energized and excited to tackle the challenges of everyday life, whether at your work place or in your personal life. 

This class is $10.  If money is an issue for you, let me know and we can work something out.  The cost goes to pay for the cost of the room rental, Meetup fees, and website.  

Hope to see you there!


Steve

www.improvnow.com

www.facebook.com/improvnow

Steve Ling is an alumnus of the improv programs of the Upright Citizens Brigade, Peoples Improv Theater, Magnet Theater, & Annoyance Theater. He regularly produces and performs improv, musical improv, & hip hop improv across NYC.

Show me your inspiration and I will share with you the techniques to create a painting of your dreams! 

Any style, any medium: acrylics, oils, watercolors or gouache. Your two hour art lesson will be personalized to meet your needs. Perfect for friends, families, couples, or your next organization or business outing. 

Laura Baran is a New York City artist with a BFA in Illustration from the Fashion Institute of Technology. Her work has won numerous awards, including Excellence in Painting from the New York City Society of Illustrators and the ranking of #1 Movie Poster of 2014 by TimeOut New York. 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/fyYExh
results.name: Private Art Lesson with Award-Winning Artist, Laura Baran

results.description:
L'Poopoo, Au' Jupau, Mei wiiwii.. All of the aforementioned "terms" are FAKE as F*&% to demonstrate DeRM's lack of knowledge of the French language and yet describe his wannabe love and desire for the cuisine. Since, and before visiting France I have had a love and admiration for French cuisine. It's is truly the upper echelon of richness, technique and beauty in the culinary world and this event is just a little peek into that realm.

Enter Le Relais De Venise, a restaurant that primarily only sells and specializes in one dish; Steak Frites. (Basically Steak and Fries) Steak Frites is one of those basic meals served in France and is practically the equivalent of a basic "fast food" dish we get here like a burger and fries; only magically better. The treatment on this basic meat and potatoes dish is dressed up in a sexy velvety butter peppercorn sauce (or veloute) with the meat cooked to your desired temperature. The fries; super crisp seemingly fried in duck fat are made extra rich and decadent to make your palate do the running man while being served by beautiful (sometimes French) women in maid (Not the Frederick's type) outfits.


My pal Frank has no idea what he is in for and while holding secret disdain for a restaurant that only serves one dish; cheeses, wines and an assortment of desserts will quickly flip his wig after biting into this decadent basic yet complex meal of fantasy and lore.

Join us on this journey to get a very small glimpse into the magic of French prepared food. It's delicious, smart and most of all, it will be fun!


As always there will be pictures, audio/video recordings of the deliciousness to supplement the Culinary Foolinary Site and Podcast.

In advance, Enchanté!


<a href="http://culinaryfoolinary.com/"></a>
results.how_to_find_us: Meet us inside where we will try to hold down a table for 8. There are no reservations so please be on time.
results.name: Let's Do French - Featuring Steak Frites - A Parisian Classic...

results.description:
Curious about consulting, but have no idea what it is? Have an interview with a consulting firm, but don’t know how to prepare? Dream of becoming a management consultant at McKinsey, but need some guidance getting there? That’s why we’re here.

SPEAKER: 

Kai Chen (McKinsey Consultant)

LinkedIn: https://www.linkedin.com/in/kai-chen-37975a43

To help you realize your consultant dream, we’ve put together a comprehensive three-hour training program that will teach you how to break into consulting. We believe that the best way to learn is through practical experience, and therefore our unique interactive workshop model will focus on active participation, hands-on problem solving, and cooperative teamwork. Through this workshop, you will learn all you need to realize your consultant dream.

The workshop will include two areas:
(1) Case study framework
(2) Case interview (The workshop will focus more on case interview)

COURSE CONTENT 

The case interview is a mystery to many. We’ve all heard about it, but yet do not really quite understand what it is, much less how to answer one. Lucky for you, we are here to demystify the case interview and give you the skill sets to ace a case interview. The idea of a case interview is to test your problem solving skills. It emphasizes both structure and creativity. A case interview will be divided into multiple sections that test different sets of skills, namely your ability to understand data, conduct quantitative and qualitative analysis, and effectively synthesis. We will be working through all of those areas.

Some of you might be under the impression that there are an infinite number of possible cases, and therefore do not know where to start or have resorted to Case in Point for their frameworks. Neither of those are good ideas. If you want to get into management consulting and you are using Case in Point, you’ve already failed. While there theoretically can be infinite types of cases, the majority fall under two categories, the business case interview and the profitability interview. The cases that we will be going over are real cases that were used in first and final rounds at McKinsey, Bain, and BCG to give you a real feel of what to expect on interview day. We will work through the cases from beginning to end, from initial problem structuring to synthesizing a recommendation to the CEO. For this portion of the workshop, you will be organized into teams of 4-5 to work on the case together. This is a very important test of your team-working abilities. After working through the cases, you will have both the confidence and the skill set to dominate the case interview.

AGENDA
13:00-14:00 How to Crack a Case
14:00-16:00 One-on-One Case Interview

WHEN
Sunday, February 28, 2016 from 1:00 PM to 4:00 PM (EST)

WHERE
1270 Broadway, Suite 505 New York, NY 10001

RSVP: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/consulting-case-interview-training-class-tickets-21535950608

Let’s work together to get you one giant leap closer to your goal, to your dream!
results.name: Consulting Case Interview Training Class

results.description:
Note: Only RSVP if you are planning to show up.

First Timers, READ details before you RSVP. 

Where: The Cliffs at LIC, [masked]th Drive, Long Island City, NY

When: We usually climb between 1:00pm and 4:00 pm. There is no strict start time and the organizer(s) tries their best to be there around 1:00pm. We will pair off around 1.15ish and start climbing. 

Transportation: Subway: E, M trains to 23rd St-Ely Ave (1/2 block from gym) 7, G train to Court Square (2 blocks from gym)* N, Q train to Queens Borough Plaza (10min walk) *Walk to the E & M track for those bad weather days 

Metro North & LIRR: From Grand Central take 7 train 3 stops From Penn Station take Uptown E train to Court Square

Cost/Discount: Monthly membership of $105 (the $99 Initiation Fee is waived if you sign up during the meet up). Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount. Gear rental is free for first-timers ONLY  (first time visit to the facility). Regular gear  pricing info can be found here: http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/climbing/pricing/
For Beginners, Climbing 101 class is offered 50% Off if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them.</a>

How to meet us:  After you checked-in, to the right of the front desk there's a sitting area.If you see a group of people in there that's probably us come and say hi. If you are running late or can't find the group leave a message in the Comments section.  Food/drinks apres-climb at John Brown Smokehouse next door (or whichever resto the group decides). Even if you only want to have a beer with us, that is also acceptable :)

Notice to Beginners: If you have never climbed before, we encourage you to take the Climbing 101 class there before attending the meetup. We get a discounted price of $25 for the class (that's 50% Off original price if you do it the same day as the meet up and has to be scheduled in advance with them). This will also cover your day pass + gear for the day. Unfortunately we can't teach you how to belay or let you try to belay at the gym if you are not belay certified yet. We leave the teaching to the experts.  Check out Cliff's website for more details.  What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. Here is the link to The Cliffs LIC <a href="http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/">http://thecliffsclimbing.com/lic/

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.  Also if you find this group invaluable, please donate and pay your voluntary membership due ;) the Organizers will love you more ;)
results.name: Weekend Climbing at the Cliffs LIC

results.description:
Join 40 other Meetup members already prepaid to see the hit Tony Award nominated Best Musical - An American In Paris!

Based on the Academy Award winning film, An American In Paris is the romantic story of a young American soldier, a beautiful French girl and an indomitable European city, each yearning for a new beginning in the aftermath of war. 

You will also meet up to 50 other Meetup members at our Pre-Mingle and then sit together at the show. 

GET TICKETS HERE (Prepay Only Event) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/american/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (1pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets.  The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, week of show date.  

We'll leave the pre-mingle at 2:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 3pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

Package for the tickets & pre-mingle - $87.50 to $97.50 (depending upon how early you purchase your ticket) 

*Get your tickets ASAP at this link - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/american/

*Prepay Only Event. Must purchase ticket in advance to attend.

This event is FREE and no sales or solicitations will be made beyond asking for support for the Meetup. No pressure to participate. Have fun and get answers!

We will be sitting in the REAR MEZZ. Our package for the tickets and pre-mingle is $87.50-$97.50 depending on how early you register.

This event is not meant to be age specific or gender balanced. We will meet for a pre-mingle at a local bar/pub (location announced after you register) and then go to see this AMAZING Broadway show. Price includes the ticket to the show (3:00PM) and the pre-mingle (1 PM).


About the Show

THE MOST AWARD-WINNING MUSICAL OF THE SEASON!

The romantic story of a young American soldier, a beautiful French girl and an indomitable European city are at the heart of Broadway’s breathtakingly beautiful new musical, An American in Paris, the four-time Tony Award®-winning production that also earned the awards for Best Musical of the Year from both the Outer Critics Circle and the Drama League.

Tony Award® winner Christopher Wheeldon directs and choreographs a remarkable company of 25 international and Broadway virtuosos as they bring the magic and romance of Paris into perfect harmony with Tony Award®-winning orchestrations of unforgettable works by George and Ira Gershwin, including such classics as “I’ll Build A Stairway to Paradise,” “I Got Rhythm” and “The Man I Love.”

PREPAYMENT @ http://www.weekenddating.com/upcoming.shtml?eventid=5950 REQUIRED

The class is appropriate for all levels including new beginners. The goal of the class is an "easeful body, peaceful mind, useful life." No prior experience necessary. Class by donation.

results.description:
It's supposed to be 56 degrees on Sunday and it's my birthday so I plan to ride and you all are invited. We'll meet up in front of the CitiBikes at the foot of the Williamsburg Bridge (Brooklyn side), ride around North/Central Brooklyn, then head back to East Williamsburg to eat at M Noodle Shop, which offers lots of soup, rice, noodles, dumplings, and more. They also have good vegetarian and vegan options.

Meet up:
1pm - Brooklyn side of Williamsburg Bridge
1:15pm - Wheels down - we ride!

Food:
M Noodle Shop
549 Metropolitan Ave
Brooklyn, NY 11211
b/t Union Ave & Lorimer St This will not be a super fast race but it is also not specifically a family-friendly ride. Bring a lock, a spare tube, and money for food.

http://www.mnoodleshop.com

ALWAYS CHECK THE MTA SUBWAY SERVICE CHANGES!!! http://www.mta.info/weekender.html

Map to playing location 

https://www.google.com/maps/ms?msid=208122075208142682754.0004c75076c4d93b877d5&msa=0

This is an opportunity for you to get your jam on!

This meetup focuses on giving members opportunities to solo, play off each other, experiment with different percussion sounds, and rhythm games.

I bring a few drums and percussion instruments, but I advise you to bring your own if have. 'Veteran' members, please bring a small instrument for someone to play.

I also suggest you bring:

-Water and/or food to share
-Small folding stool or blanket to sit on
-A song and/or rhythm to share

Every meetup is also an opportunity for YOU to faciliate!!! Please let me know before we start if you are interested in facilitating.

Let's play well TOGETHER!!!

results.description:
We did so real at this location a month ago (12 volunteers attended). There's lots more to do, so we'll continue to hit this location a few more times. As always, we'll have gloves and tools to lend as well as a short training session for those who are new to this activity. Lots of Porcelain Berry has grown back here and we'll monitor an area where we successfully pulled some Mile-a-Minute vine over the summer.

And welcome to all those who have joined our group or visited our website (www.vinecutter.com) since our last outing. Looking forward to seeing you all.


Bob DelTorto[masked] [masked]

The aim of this weekly event is to offer a place where fellow Python developers and learners can come and asks questions and/or code with some company! This event is free. 


Resources:

Here are some learning resources and free text editor / IDE suggestions.

https://github.com/logston/NYCPythonSOH/blob/master/resources.rst 

Detailed Directions to us:

As you enter the building located at 568 Broadway, New York, NY 10012 you will need to provide ID and your destination (Fueled Collective, 11th Floor) to the front desk. They will provide you with a sticker badge. Take one of the elevators (located to the right of the front desk) to the 11th floor. We will be in the Deerbrook conference room.

results.description:
Join us in seeing the hit Tony Award nominated Best Musical - An American In Paris!

Based on the Academy Award winning film, An American In Paris is the romantic story of a young American soldier, a beautiful French girl and an indomitable European city, each yearning for a new beginning in the aftermath of war. 

You will also meet up to 50 other Meetup members at our Pre-Mingle and then sit together at the show. 

GET TICKETS HERE (Prepay Only Event) - http://dljparty.ticketleap.com/american/

We will meet for the pre-mingle (1pm) at a local bar/pub near the theater, where we will hand out the show tickets.  The pre-mingle location will be sent to the email address used to purchase ticket, week of show date.  

We'll leave the pre-mingle at 2:30 so we have enough time to settle into our seats for the 3pm show. The group will be sitting together in the rear Mezz.

Food and drink will be available for purchase at pre-mingle. This event is not meant to be a gender balanced or age/ethnic specific. All are welcome.

results.description:
In a discussion geared towards intermediate and experienced filmmakers, attendees will be introduced to the VR landscape as it exists right now - headsets, prominent content creators and content distributors. In a second portion of the talk, filmmakers will be taken through the VR workflow and cover the skill sets that need to be developed to create immersive live-action VR experiences. The final portion of the talk will focus on what works in virtual reality and what doesn't, and what narrative possibilities are worth further exploration with the aim of bridging the gap between emotion and technology through storytelling. The session will be bookended by opportunities for filmmakers to try virtual reality experiences in Google Cardboard and in Samsung Gear VR.      

Presentations by: Filmshop, REVRIE Immersive Works and NY Cinematic VR


Hosted by: William Cusick, Filmmaker, Dept. Head BFA & MFA Creative Technologies, School of Drama


Event Length: 3 hours (1pm-4pm)
results.name: Virtual Reality for Filmmakers, Defining a New Medium

results.description:
SOMETHING DIFFERENT! Sunday, Feb. 28, 2016 - D&D Brunch @ Lovecraft NYC, the Cthulhuesque bar on the Lower East Side.

"There is much to worry about in the mutated world of the future, but Baron Jemmas, Warder of Horn, has more on his mind than most. In recent weeks several of the outlying towns of his Barony have been wiped out by a band of mysterious golden marauders. These creatures struck from nowhere and vanished without a trace when their deeds were done. The Warder has decided that they must be stopped before the entire Barony of Horn falls beneath their onslaught, and so he is offering a great reward to anyone who can defeat the LEGION OF GOLD."

This event is NOT part of the D&D Adventurers League, it's just for fun adapting the original GAMMA WORLD post-apocalyptic role-playing game to SRD5e rules used for Dungeon & Dragons 5th edition. Instant character creation done on-site, newcomers welcome.

(As usual, this event is free but attendees are expected to purchase food and/or drink from the venue.)
results.name: D&D Brunch: Gamma World SRD5e

group.name: The NYC Dungeons & Dragons Meetup Group

venue.name: Parking lot east of Helen Newman gym, Cradit Farm Road

results.description:
Beebe Lake on the Cornell University campus has fascinating ice formations in winter, and the trails are usually accessible for walking. We’ll walk along a rim trail looking down at the lake, then across a bridge with good views of the gorge and waterfall, then around the lake. This trail has  stairs and some muddy spots, but no ice. If we want, we can continue into the Cornell Plantations to view their winter garden.


Directions: From Route 366 near the Cornell vet hospital, turn downhill at the traffic light on Caldwell Drive. Go straight through the first stop sign, across a one-lane bridge (the road’s name changes to Forest Home Drive), and keep going straight onto Pleasant Grove Road. At the top of the hill take the first left onto Cradit Farm Road. Take the first right into the parking lot, which is free on weekends. Let’s meet at the end closest to the road. Look for a blue Women Outdoors bandanna attached to hiking poles.


Optional brunch at 11:30: Collegetown Bagels, East Hill Plaza, 329 Pine Tree Road. Ithaca's hilly streets can be tricky so if you'd rather not find two places, meet me at the hiking spot at 11:00 and we'll car pool to lunch. My car can fit 4 passengers.
results.name: Winter Walk, Beebe Lake and Cornell Plantations, Ithaca

results.description:
Show me your inspiration and I will share with you the techniques to create a painting of your dreams! 

Any style, any medium: acrylics, oils, watercolors or gouache. Your two hour art lesson will be personalized to meet your needs. Perfect for friends, families, couples, or your next organization or business outing. 

Laura Baran is a New York City artist with a BFA in Illustration from the Fashion Institute of Technology. Her work has won numerous awards, including Excellence in Painting from the New York City Society of Illustrators and the ranking of #1 Movie Poster of 2014 by TimeOut New York. 

For more info & tickets: https://goo.gl/fyYExh
results.name: Private Art Lesson with Award-Winning Artist, Laura Baran

results.description:
Make social media work for your business. Join us on Sunday, February 28th at Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, NJ for an interactive 2 hour workshop as we take the mystery out of the online world. 

BUY YOUR TICKETS HERE

When 74% of consumers rely on social media to influence their purchasing decisions, you know it's a big deal. Integrating social media into your business plan is necessary - but can be scary. Never fear! 

We'll teach you the in's and out's, and even let you try out some social media magic yourself during this afternoon of learning led by Sam Popp, branding and business development consultant and founder of Teach and Learn Networking and Tracy Robin, business and life coach and founder of Shine Yoga Center.

BUY YOUR TICKETS HERE


Leave with a better understanding of the differences between Facebook, Twitter, and LinkedIn, as well as how to leverage them for business marketing basic purpose of each platform & how to use them. We'll cover the basics of social media post creation and marketing and guide you through a content creation exercise to get you more followers and online contacts!

Perfect for newcomers to social media marketing! Bring your laptops or iPads, as well as a notebook and pen.

BUY YOUR TICKETS HERE

Our Guest Presenter: Sam Popp 

Sam Popp is an event and business development consultant and founder of Teach and Learn Networking in New York City. Since 2008, Sam has facilitated training and educational events at various university, social services, and business organizations, finally forming Teach and Learn Networking in late 2014 to produce a year-long monthly workshop series on business soft skills. She currently provides on-going support to small businesses owners and entrepreneurs that use events to enhance their branding and marketing strategy. 

Your Host: Tracy Robin

Tracy Robin (@TracyRobinWR) is a Certified Life Coach & Business Mentor for entrepreneurs, an ERYT500, a Certified Kripalu Yoga Teacher, the co-owner & founder of Shine Yoga Center in Cliffside Park, New Jersey and the director of Shine Yoga Center’s Yoga Teacher Certification Program. She is also the founder of The YogaLifeStyle with Tracy & Holistic Women Entrepreneurs Meetup. She is passionate about supporting women in their personal & professional development and creates sacred space & programming that builds community, provides education & support for success in all areas of your life. An entrepreneur & business owner since 2000, she coaches clients globally and travels nationally & internationally leading classes, workshops & retreats. Be sure to connect with Tracy on Facebook.

Who can attend?

This event is being held in partnership with Teach and Learn Networking, AND this is an event for both men and women.

What should I bring?

Bring Your LAPTOP, iPad & SMART PHONE, A Notebook, Pen, Business cards, a friend if you'd like, & an open mind.

How much does it cost?

$5 online (plus service fees) or $10 at the door. 

Want to be the first to know about our upcoming events & gatherings? Interested in doing a giveaway or sponsoring our next event? Contact Tracy for more information.  


SPACE PARTNER 

Shine Yoga Center (@shineyogacenter) is a modern yoga studio and event space in Cliffside Park, NJ, only 10 mins from NYC via the GWB. Interested in our classes or hosting your next event at Shine? Learn more at http://shineyogacenter.com/main
results.name: Social Media 101: What to Post - Where, When & How!

results.description:
This is a moderate 6 mile hike in Hartshorne State Park in Highlands, NJ. It should last 2 hours and will NOT be leisurely. Come appropriate, with hiking shoes/ decent sneakers, layered clothing, hat, hydration, and a positive attitude for a great time. Please be ready to keep pace. I leave no one behind, and there is absolutely no criticism on my hikes. We all start and end together. :) 

We'll be meeting at the Rocky Point trailhead, located at 200 Portland Ave, Highlands, for an 1p step off. I'll be arriving to the parking lot in a black Ford Escape with army stickers on the back window approx. 15 mins ahead to do a little bit of stretching (recommended).

We have a really nice time getting our heart pumping and always great conversations throughout. Please, however, leave your four-legged friends home for this one. In the event of unfavorable weather, look for an update the morning of. A little snow is ok, but nobody enjoys monsoons. Looking forward to seeing you all there! Please post any questions in the thread. NOTE: If you arrive at 1:01p, you should be able to catch up to us. ;)

After the hike, for those who are interested, we'll be heading to Applebee's, 1183 New Jersey 35, Middletown, NJ 07748, for food and beverages.  

DISCLAIMER: If you join us for this event, please understand that you are responsible for your own (and your guest's) preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. Your attendance to this event signifies that you have read and accepted the terms of this liability waiver.
results.how_to_find_us: The park entrance is up the road from 200 Portland. Just continue up the road another 1/4 mile. If you need additional help, call Rob @ 908-420-3421
results.name: HIKE - HARTSHORNE PARK - "Quick Paced"

This is a co-ed adult pick-up game for all levels. 6v6 or 7 v7 depending on attendance. 90 minutes with two 45 minute halves. No slide tackling or rough play. We play with Pugg goals. Pinnies provided.  Shin guards are recommended.


This pick up game is hosted by Coach Moe, Please bring  $4 in cash to the game. 

RSVP closes at 11:15AM (2 hours before the game)

PLEASE UPDATE YOUR RSVP BY MIDNIGHT THE DAY BEFORE THE GAME!

No shows and those who didn't update their RSVP by midnight the day before the game will be red carded after the second offense which means that we have the right to edit your RSVP.

Directions by subway or bus:

2 and 3 trains to Clark St.

A and C trains to High St.


F train to York St.


N and R trains to Court St.


Weather policy:

In case of inclement weather we will send out an email to notify you at least two hours before meeting time.

What to bring:

Please note that Cadman Plaza park is a turf field. Turf shoes are preferred. Please bring water or sports drink. Please bring a ball if you have one.

results.description:
Admission: free


 Led by Leader Curt Collier

This is a gathering for those seeking to live more in harmony with the natural world. Each month we gather to discuss the impact of our lifestyle choices on our planet and ways to adapt that make a meaningful difference. We will have serious, pragmatic, and practical discussion about culinary choices, commuting alternatives, how our purchases aid or hamper the natural world, and other such topics. Participants will be asked to keep a log of their choices and to share openly with others in a supportive atmosphere.


This course is for those wanting to make a real commitment to eco-living.

Entry to our 100-year-old building and meeting rooms is available for most wheelchair users with prior arrangements. Please call ahead  [masked] x 107) for setup of our portable system and plan to arrive one hour before start time.
results.how_to_find_us: Adler Study

results.description:
Join us as the Museum of Moving Images continues its India's New Wave series, with the screening of Dhanak (Rainbow).

This enchanting modern fable from director Nagesh Kukunoor tells the story of two orphans, ten-year-old Pari (Hetal) and her eight-year-old blind brother Chotu (Krrish Chhabbria), who live in a desert village in Rajasthan. Chotu wants nothing more than to have his vision back and Pari—inspired by a message she sees on a Shah Rukh Khan poster—promises him he’ll get it before his birthday arrives. Determined to restore her brother’s sight before his ninth birthday, Pari leads Chotu on a journey across the desert to where the legendary actor is shooting his next movie. Along the way they encounter a host of colorful characters who both help and hinder their passage, leading to an exciting and magical finale. 

Tickets are $12 and must be purchased from the link below.


Heart and Hand for the Handicapped (HHH) is offering a deal for the first 10 people - buy one ticket, get one free. Please purchase your first ticket at http://www.movingimage.us/visit/calendar/2016/02/28/detail/dhanak-rainbow . Then, email [masked] your details to reserve your second free ticket.


Hope to see you all!
results.how_to_find_us: Near Admissions.
results.name: Dhanak (Rainbow) Movie Meetup!

Paul

------------------------------------------------------

Game style and Rules:

1. HAVE FUN!!! It's SOCCER :)

2. We'll play (2) 30-minute games.

3. We will divide into teams based on everyone's experience and skills.

4. No ball hogging.

5. Please use turf shoes or sneakers. You will not be allowed to play with cleats.

6. The games are very laid back; rough play, tackles or sliding are not allowed and will not be tolerated.

7. We'll play with corner kicks and ground kick-ins and pop-up goals.

8. If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Field Location:The field is located on the corner of West 102nd street and Amsterdam Ave. The entrance gate is located on west101st and Amsterdam ave. 

Directions: 1 train to 103rd St. Also, B or D trains to 103rd St stop

Check the MTA's website for any service changes: www.mta.info

Time: Please be there 15 minutes earlier so we can get set up.

Late arrivals:

If you arrive late to the game, you would have to wait until the game in progress is finished to join your team. Inserting people in the middle of the game disrupts the flow of the game, and it's not fair to players that arrived on time.

Fee:

Please pay the fee through paypal. Part of the proceeds go to NYC SOCCER KIDS (we already donated new soccer balls). It also goes to pay for the site admistration, meet-up fees, cones, soccer balls, and the new goals.

Please bring:

A white t-shirt and a red t-shirt to differentiate players of each team. The filed is turf so please bring turf shoes, sneakers or all terrain shoes; cleats are not allowed!

Cancellations/Refunds:

If you won't be able to make it to the game, please change your RSVP to "NO" 48 hours before kickoff time to receive a full refund. This is done to give other members a chance to take your spot. Thank you!

Waiting List: 

If all the spots are taken, please get on the waiting list. If a spot opens up and you are on the waiting list, you will be sent an automated e-mail letting you know that a spot has just openned :). If this game is full click here for our calendar and see other game slots!

Weather Policy: Games will be cancelled if the weather conditions are severe such as snow, sleet or thunderstorms. If the game is cancelled I will send out an e-mail the morning of the game. Please check your e-mail. If you are unsure, or can't get to your e-mail, you can also text me or call me at[masked]-5725.

See you on the pitch!

Paul

results.description:
‘INDIA’S NEW WAVE’ CONTINUES WITH "DHANAK"


Sunday, February 28 @ 2:00PM, please join us for "Dhanak," a modern fable from director Nagesh Kukunoor.

"Dhanak (Rainbow)" February 28 @ 2:00PM

In Hindi with English subtitles.

This enchanting modern fable from director Nagesh Kukunoor tells the story of two orphans, ten-year-old Pari (Hetal) and her eight-year-old blind brother Chotu (Krrish Chhabbria), who live in a desert village in Rajasthan. Chotu wants nothing more than to have his vision back and Pari—inspired by a message she sees on a Shah Rukh Khan poster—promises him he’ll get it before his birthday arrives. Determined to restore her brother’s sight before his ninth birthday, Pari leads Chotu on a journey across the desert to where the legendary actor is shooting his next movie. Along the way they encounter a host of colorful characters who both help and hinder their passage, leading to an exciting and magical finale. Dhanak won The Grand Prix of the Generation Kplus International Jury for the best feature-length film at the 65th Berlin International Film Festival.


Tickets: $12 ($9 for senior citizens and students)

Reserve your ticket in advance TODAY and please help spread the word!

More info + Tickets: DHANAK (RAINBOW)

See you there!


Geoffrey

results.description:
CMNYC, in partnership with group member and Cuddlist CEO Adam Lippin, is hosting its second cuddle party of 2016! Come join us for an easygoing, safe and spirit-lifting introduction to the power of positive physical touch!

Steps to attend:


1) Read and understand the code of conduct, to which there are no exceptions.

2) RSVP here on Meetup

3) Pay the required attendance fee by credit card via EventBrite at: https://www.eventbrite.com/e/mens-only-cuddle-party-tickets-21240659384

Please pay in advance. Walk-ins are not permitted.

This event is for Men that want to Cuddle Other Men.  All who identify as Male are welcome.

All other rules of Cuddle Party APPLY. 

Tom and Adam will be hosting a Men's only Cuddle Party at Big Buddha Studio on Sunday afternoon, Feb 28th 31st from 2:00 to 5:30 PM.

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving *only* as an announcement and an easy way to communicate.

There is lots of information about Cuddle Parties on the official Cuddle Party website (www.cuddleparty.com), so if you are curious, be sure to check out the FAQ section and some of the articles too.Cuddle Party has been around since February 2004. If you are coming to the Cuddle Party, PLEASE arrive at 2:00 PM to check-in and change into your Cuddle Clothes so we can start the Welcome Circle by 2:30PM.

Sorry - but after the Welcome Circle begins, no late arrivals can enter

As a reminder, these are the Cuddle Party rules.

1) Pajamas (or cuddle-clothes) stay on the whole time.

2) You don't have to cuddle anyone at a Cuddle Party, ever.

3) You must ask permission and receive a verbal YES before you touch anyone. (Be as specific in your request as you can.)

4) If you're a yes, say YES. If you're a no, say NO.

5) If you're a maybe, say NO.

6) You are encouraged to change your mind anytime you want.

7) Respect your relationship agreements and communicate with your partner.

8) Get your Cuddle Lifeguard On Duty or Cuddle Caddy if you have a question or concern or need assistance with anything during the Cuddle Party.

9) Tears and laughter are both welcome.

10) Respect people's privacy when sharing about Cuddle Parties and do not gossip.

11) Arrive on time.

12) Be hygienically savvy.

You MUST purchase a ticket at EventBrite to be sure you are registered to attend this Meetup. The Meetup announcement is serving as an announcement and an easy way to communicate, but RSVPs here don't count.

The cost is $25

EventBrite requires credit card payments. Sorry no exceptions or walk-ins.

WHAT TO WEAR: Athletic Wear/Yoga Clothes/Pajamas. 

WHAT TO BRING: Just bring your smiling self.

Your Cuddle Host (that's me) will provide light snacks and beverages.

Looking forward to Cuddling with you soon,

Adam & Tom

www.cuddlist.com is a proud sponsor of Cuddle PartyNYC

Please leave a message or message me if you have further questions etc

Let's meet at Manhattan's Upper East Side Whole Foods at[masked]rd Ave (at 88th street). There's an eat in area on the mezzanine floor. Please purchase fruit or salad (at least part of your meal) from Whole Foods so we will be welcome there in the future. Since raw fruit and salad is the basis of the 80/10/10 diet, let's support each other by having food together that falls within 80/10/10 guidelines. 80/10/10 beverages include water, coconut water and some occasionally have juices.

This Whole Foods has a weird layout. Most of the produce is on level 2 which you can get to by escalator. There are only two check out lines at street level (level 1) yet many cashiers so the sometimes long lines usually move quickly. Once done with your purchase you can get to the eat in area on the mezzanine level by walking up the stairs near the 87th street exit. The store doesn't allow you to enter on 87th street.

If you want to check in with us first, it's not as obvious how to get to the mezzanine level. You can enter on 88th street and take the elevator to the mezzanine level once in the store. The escalators don't even go to this in between mezzanine level, only to levels 1 and 2. There is also a small opening to pass near the check out lines but that can be hard to find.

Please avoid wearing fragrances as several people in our group are sensitive to them including myself.

I will post my cell phone number in the comments the day before the event so you can contact me if you have trouble finding us or want to know if we are still there. :)

Please note this is different than a common past location on the east side.  It is NOT the East 57th street one, it's at 88th Street and 3rd Avenue.

Click the link below to purchase tickets to this event:


http://www.eventbrite.com/e/ny-adventure-club-inside-the-church-of-the-transfiguration-tickets-21674566211?aff=meetup

Join New York Adventure Club for a behind-the-scenes tour of the Church of the Transfiguration, one of the oldest and most famous churches in New York City.

Our experience of this 167 year old Episocopal church will include a look the oldest stained glass pieces in the country along with works by John LaFarge and his student Jessie Van Brunt; a visit to the memorial tablets and windows of famous actors like Rex Harrison, Cornelia Otis Skinner, and John Drew due to the church's strong ties with the theater; a peek inside the private Episcopal Actors Guild headquarters on the second floor; and a discussion around the church's Underground Railroad network during the Civil War Draft Riots.

Afterwards, we'll grab food and drinks in the neighborhood!
results.name: NY Adventure Club: Inside the Church of the Transfiguration

results.description:
This was suggested at our last group, and I thought it looked pretty interesting:


"In America after the Second Civil War, the Pro-Choice and Pro-Life armies came to an agreement: The Bill of Life states that human life may not be touched from the moment of conception until a child reaches the age of thirteen. Between the ages of thirteen and eighteen, however, a parent may choose to retroactively get rid of a child through a process called "unwinding." Unwinding ensures that the child's life doesn’t “technically” end by transplanting all the organs in the child's body to various recipients. Now a common and accepted practice in society, troublesome or unwanted teens are able to easily be unwound.

With breathtaking suspense, this book follows three teens who all become runaway Unwinds: Connor, a rebel whose parents have ordered his unwinding; Risa, a ward of the state who is to be unwound due to cost-cutting; and Lev, his parents’ tenth child whose unwinding has been planned since birth as a religious tithing. As their paths intersect and lives hang in the balance, Shusterman examines complex moral issues that will keep readers turning the pages until the very end."

Sorry about this being the first in a series again!


LOCATION
We will be meeting at the Citigroup Atrium.

There is an entrance at 53rd and Lexington Avenue off of the 53rd and Lex subway stop. You have to go down the steps; the subway station will be on your right and the Atrium will be straight in front of you. The doors are labelled.   

There is a Barnes and Noble (with a Starbucks inside) located on the next level up at 54th and 3rd. If you enter through the B&N, you will need to go through B&N (up a few steps from the entrance), past the NOOK display to the glass doors and down the escalator to the Atrium.

There is free wi-fi in the Citigroup Atrium. There are also free public restrooms. Please let me know if you have any questions about the location.

It's probably more fun if you read/finish the book.  But if you don’t, you are still welcome to come. But there will be spoilers!

WHERE TO BUY
The book is available in hardcover and digital, including Kindle</a><a href="http://www.amazon.com/Three-Body-Problem-Cixin-Liu/dp/0765377063/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1448032970&sr=8-1&keywords=three+body+problem"> at Amazon</a> and a <a href="http://www.barnesandnoble.com/w/unwind-neal-shusterman/1100329384?ean=9781416994961">Nook at Barnes & Noble.


IMPORTANT RSVP POLICY
If you RSVP and find you cannot make it, please change your RSVP so that we are not waiting for you. Please change it no less than two hours before the scheduled meeting time. If you RSVP and do not show, you will have to pay $10 when you attend your next event. This is to prevent those on the waiting list from missing out on an event.   

The RSVP policy is the same as for the general meetup. Please see the entire policy here:  http://www.meetup.com/NYSciFi-Fantasy/pages/Membership_Policy/
results.name: SciFi Book Club: Unwind by Neal Shusterman

****READ THIS FIRST || Parade Grounds Game Standards ****

Meet on field 8!!!

The game is scheduled to start at 2:00. We typically start 20-30 minutes after 2:00. Your RSVP is good if you come on time. If you come after teams are divided then you run the risk of not playing. Those who have RSVP’ed get first preference to play (This does not apply to anyone on the waiting list). Also, please  Un-RSVP if you will not be attending. That gives other people a chance to play.

Rules and guidelines:

These games are geared towards advanced to intermediate players.

Teams are divided by two team captains (captains pick players in turns in an attempt to keep teams balanced and competitive)

Physical play is allowed as long as it isn't overly aggressive or dirty.

Slide tackles are allowed only to block a shot on goal or to intercept a pass  NO slide tackling on a player with the ball.

Ball hogging is absolutely not tolerated 

Keep in mind as we don't have permit, we need to be flexible.
