results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Sunday February 28, 2:00PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
Eric Asimov, wine critic for The New York Times, has been running a monthly wine "school" column for the newspaper's readers. He selects a region, does a little write-up, and identifies three wines to try. After drinking the wines, people go to the newspaper's on-line comments section to have a conversation about what they've learned and liked. I've had fun doing this for several months, but thought it might be even better with some of you. Let's meet together from time to time, to drink and talk!

The point of this group is to teach and learn from each other.  All levels are welcome, though we do want participation in tasting and discussing the wines from all.  We keep the group small so we can focus on the wines!  Good behavior is a must, as we will be meeting in a private residence.


What to bring: Each participant will be expected to read Asimov's monthly wine write-up and bring one bottle of wine recommended in the article. He generally identifies three specific bottles, and also lists alternates if the three are not available. I find snooth.com and wine-searcher.com helpful in figuring out which wine shops might have the bottle you are looking for.  But they're not foolproof: calling the shop to confirm is recommended.  I generally have had good luck at Astor Wines, Flatiron Wines, 67 Wines, Union Square Wines and Sherry-Lehmann Wines. Please make every effort to find the specific bottles listed by Asimov. Be sure to post a comment with which wine you will be bringing so that we can have a variety of bottles. Some bottle duplication is fine when our group is large, but we don't want all the same bottle. 

Because wine needs food, each participant should also bring something tasty to eat and share. 

RSVP and Waitlist:  If the Meetup is full, you will be offered the option of placing your name on a Waitlist.  Be aware that the Meetup platform will automatically change your RSVP from "Waitlist" and "Yes" if a spot opens. The expectation is that you will monitor your status on the Waitlist, and remove your name if you no longer want to attend.  

Cost:  The cost of the Asimov Wine School meetups will vary depending on the cost of that month's wine.  Generally it's been somewhere between $15-$70 for the bottle you bring plus the cost of whatever snack you select to share.

February's details:  We'll be drinking from Etna Rosso region of Sicily this month. Click here to read Asimov's Etna Rosso writeup and see which wines we will be drinking!

results.description:
This ride should combine some of the fun from the traffic rides and the climbing - get ready! Let's meet at Grand Army Plaza by the arch and do a lap around Prospect Park. We'll close the loop and exit to continue north on the Vanderbuilt Ave bike path to snake our way around the naval yard and on towards Greenpoint along the Kent Ave path. We'll push over the Pulaski and through Astoria to climb the Queensboro bridge to arrive at 1st Ave in Manhattan. From there we'll dart west on 60th st to arrive at Central Park at the southeast entrance and pick up the bike path within. We'll do an almost complete loop to exit at Columbus Circle and pick up the Broadway bike path, charging south back towards Brooklyn and finish back at the Grand Army Plaza arch.


We'll pace it to the group but this one should be a really fun mix of climbs, protected stretches, and charging through traffic. Hope to see you there!
results.name: Park Hopping: Prospect to Central and Back

results.description:
Join us at Watchung Booksellers for a book reading and signing to celebrate the release of Jasmin Singer's new memoir, ALWAYS TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH (Penguin Random House’s Berkley, Feb. 2, 2016). Jasmin will give a brief talk and offer a reading from the book. You will have the opportunity to purchase a copy of the book and have it signed.


***

“Jasmin’s story is an inspiration to create your best self and your best life.” — Neal Barnard, M.D. New York Times bestselling author of Power Foods for the Brain


“[Singer] rigorously examines attitudes toward people battling obesity with compassion, insight and understanding.” — Joe Cross, filmmaker of Fat, Sick and Nearly Dead


 About ALWAYS TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH:

Jasmin Singer’s struggle with weight defined her life. From the extra pounds and unrelenting bullies that left Jasmin Singer eating lunch alone in a bathroom stall at school, to the low self-esteem that left her both physically and emotionally vulnerable, Jasmin spent her younger years feeling completely lost.

Most people think there’s no such thing as a fat vegan. Most people don’t realize that deep-fried tofu tastes amazing and that Oreos are, in fact, vegan. So, even after Jasmin discovered her passion in advocating for the rights of animals, she defied any “skinny vegan” stereotypes by getting even heavier. More importantly, she realized that her compassion for others didn’t extend to her own body, and that her low self-esteem was affecting her health. She needed a change.

Told with humble humor and heartbreaking honesty, ALWAYS TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH: A Memoir is Jasmin’s story of how she went from a bullied kid who found solace in a box of cheese crackers to becoming an empowered activist and finding peace with herself, her body, and her sexuality.

By committing to monthly juice fasts and a diet of whole, unprocessed foods, Jasmin lost almost a hundred pounds, gained an understanding of her destructive relationship with food, and even learned some hard truths about how intensely our society values thinness.

In a relatable memoir about finding one’s true identity and what that really means, Jasmin Singer’s debut is a raw and powerful account of self-realization. Above all ALWAYS TOO MUCH AND NEVER ENOUGH is an inspiration to create one’s best self.


About Jasmin:

Jasmin Singer is the executive director of Our Hen House, a non-profit organization aiming to change the world for animals. She is the cohost of the Webby-recognized Our Hen House podcast, has written for numerous online publications including Huffington Post and MindBodyGreen, and has appeared on The Dr. Oz Show and HuffPo Live, and in the award-winning documentaries Vegucated and The Ghosts in Our Machine. Visit her online at http//www.jasminsinger.com and http://www.OurHenHouse.org.

<a href="https://www.facebook.com/events/453115961555224/#"></a> The Advocate magazine named Jasmin one of “40 Under 40 People to Teach Us About Each Other!” The article includes a sweet shout-out to her forthcoming memoir, “Always Too Much and Never Enough.” 

We look forward to seeing you at this event!
results.name: Jasmin Singer Reading and Book Signing

results.description:
Please join us for February 2016's discussion of "The Misadventures of Awkward Black Girl" by Issa Rae. Please come with a spirit of fellowship, an open mind, and a point of view.

I look forward to seeing you there!

Christina

***Book Synopsis***

Being an introvert in a world that glorifies cool isn’t easy. But when Issa Rae, the creator of the Shorty Award–winning hit series “The Misadventures of Awkward Black Girl,” is that introvert—whether she’s navigating love, work, friendships, or “rapping”—it sure is entertaining. Now, in this debut collection of essays written in her witty and self-deprecating voice, Rae covers everything from cybersexing in the early days of the Internet to deflecting unsolicited comments on weight gain, from navigating the perils of eating out alone and public displays of affection to learning to accept yourself—natural hair and all.

A reflection on her own unique experiences as a cyber pioneer yet universally appealing, The Misadventures of Awkward Black Girl is a book no one—awkward or cool, black, white, or other—will want to miss.

***Where to Find the Book***

Amazon

Barnes & Noble

Brooklyn Public Library

Hue-Man Bookstore

New York Public Library

Newark Public Library

Queens Public Library

Sisters Uptown Bookstore

"ECMAScript 6 is the newest version of the ECMAScript standard. This standard was ratified in June 2015. ES2015 is a significant update to the language, and the first major update to the language since ES5 was standardized in 2009." - Babel Site

If you haven't been using ES6 and want to know what's new in the language then this meetup is for you. We'll be looking at some of the largest changes in the ECMAScript spec and will briefly discuss some others. We'll be looking at examples of the features that are currently available in modern browsers, specifically Chrome.

Topics we will be covering:

• Let and Const


• Block Scoping


• Template Strings

• Iterators


• Fat Arrows


• Class Syntax


• Promises


• Generators

Speaker: Jamal O'Garro
I'm a former finance guy on the business side turned finance guy on the tech side that also loves entrepreneurship and NYC startup culture. I'm a huge fan of full-stack web development with JavaScript and enjoy building software with AngularJS and Node.js as well as building native iOS apps. In my spare time I like to write and backtest simple algo trading strategies in Python, attend hackathons, give tech talks and teach others how to code. In my spare spare time (whenever that is) I like to read, blog, write songs,shoot street photography and make documentary films. I love to create and my motto is simply, "THINK IT, BELIEVE IT, CREATE IT!"

Hello and welcome to Brooklyn Fashion Designers Meet and Greet

We will be having a Fashion Cycle Session.

What is a Fashion cycle? A fashion cycle is when all aspects of fashion are in the room from the designer to the customer and everyone in between. In this session you will be able to meet and greet everyone and network with one another.

We want all members to share their experiences with others so that we can learn form one another. This group will consist of fashion designers, tech designers, production mangers, graphic designers, boutique owners, customers, models and photographers. You are open to bring any projects that you are currently working on for input or just to test the market. 

For example

Designers- Please bring sketches and or garments.

Models- Please come photo ready and with comp cards

Photographers - Please come ready to shoot or pitch upcoming projects

Freelancers -Please bring resumes

Factories - Please be ready to price garments or pass out contact information

Fashionista - Please bring resumes or ready to network and take notes

Brooklyn fashion designers look forward to meeting with everyone please be sure to bring you contact information and a brief summary of your skills or skills you wish to learn.

Thank You

results.description:
[Cross-posted from NYC Stoics]

The Suicide of Seneca (Manuel Domínguez Sánchez, 1871)

Stoicism is a philosophy for living. But how well can it actually be lived with wealth, power, and danger afoot?

At our last meetup, we explored part of this question by looking at Seneca's early career as senator, tutor, and adviser to the emperor Nero as portrayed in James Romm's recent book entitled Dying Every Day. At this meetup, we will discuss the end of the book. And of Seneca's life.

To prepare for this meetup, please read from Chapter 5: Maritocide through to the end the book. Also, post at least one question, passage, or concept from the book that you would like to discuss at the meetup in the comments section below. Finally, if you would like to cover any specific writings by Seneca for the rest of the year, please share what you'd like to read in this thread.
results.name: Dying Every Day: Finale

No preparation needed for this meeting! Just bring up to 1,500 words of writing—a flash piece or an excerpt from a longer piece you are working on or the outline of an idea that you need help with. People are encouraged to bring work generated through Writing Room exercises.

The format works like this:

Each writer gets a total of up to 30 minutes, which begins when they read their piece aloud or give a pitch of their idea in five minutes or less. We will be able to do 4 or 5 pieces/ideas per meeting. Names will be drawn at random. (Anyone whose work is not chosen will get priority at the next meeting.) You don’t need to bring work to attend and no advance preparation is required.

Please feel free to bring drinks or snacks. Arielle has power strips to plug in and space to write at both a table and on couches and chairs. Also, there are two cats, in case anyone has allergies.

See you there!

Hi everyone,

Looking forward to our usual stimulating conversation this Sunday. I wanted to offer a blog post entitled, The Trumping of America. Perhaps we could converse about the present election and the role of religiosity and atheism. The blog post is here: http://www.patheos.com/blogs/secularspectrum/2016/02/the-trumping-of-america/

Join our Common Ground facebook page along with the American Humanist Association at  https://www.facebook.com/commonground2015/?fref=ts.

For those who like Twitter, we also have a Common Ground twitter feed we began with our humanist and religious friends in the United Kingdom in 2013. You are welcome to join the conversation, share and discover how others see this dialogue @secreldialogue. 

Carl

results.description:
This venue is what I call "making new friends on Steroids" because....... everybody gets to meet everybody, and "all" at the same time. We have done this twice before and the reviews have been most favorite able.

This is a "pot luck" affair.  Please bring a bottle of wine or some cheese and crackers (or other wine compliment).  I will have some fruit and make a great green salad.

Our format will consist of each person telling us about their culture and upbringing ; from the child hood years of 0 to 10 years old, OR ..... from the teen age years of 10 to 20 years old.  Each person will have 5 minutes to talk about the past,...  and then  1 minute to tell us about who they are today.  We will ask you to include the thing you liked the most,   and,  the  thing you liked the least about your life as a youngster. 

 We were so fascinating at our previous   "who are you"...but this one should be even better because I have bought A TIMER WITH A BELL, and a little voice enhancer. Plus... I am moving some furniture out of our way.  If you have some ideas....give me some feed back.  I will send my exact address and directions to my apartment to each attendee by private email a few days before the party....

Please join us on Sunday for meditation instruction and sitting practice. Recent scientific research suggests that meditation practice is an effective means to lessening stress and depression, boosting bodily immune and respiratory functions, increasing happiness and cultivating compassion and joy within one's life.

results.description:
Behavioralists! 


After a short hiatus, we are back stronger than ever.  We will kick off the year with a LIVE session with Columbia Business School Professor Dr. Adam Galinsky.  He will be discussing his recent book Friend & Foe.  

Dr. Galinsky is a leading researcher on negotiations, goal-setting, counter-factual thinking, and decision-making.   His book, Friend & Foe, which he co-authored with Wharton Professor Maurice Schweitzer, tries to answer the question of when we should collaborate and when we should compete. 

This is going to be an AMAZING session. Dr. Galinsky is one of my favorite researchers.  His paper "Goals Gone Wild" is still one of my favorite social science papers after many years.  Also, since Dr. Galinsky is joining us in person, you will have the chance to get your booked signed.


We expect this meet up to fill up fast, so RSVP early.

Thanks,


Wendy

*ALL - we had to push back the date by one week to Feb 28! Please note the date change and update your RSVP accordingly.  We are sorry for any inconvenience, Dr. Galinsky just had an unforeseen conflict. 

-----

AMAZON REVIEW

What does it take to succeed? This question has fueled a long-running debate. Some have argued that humans are fundamentally competitive, and that pursuing self-interest is the best way to get ahead. Others claim that humans are born to cooperate and that we are most successful when we collaborate with others.

In FRIEND AND FOE, researchers Galinsky and Schweitzer explain why this debate misses the mark. Rather than being hardwired to compete or cooperate, we have evolved to do both. In every relationship, from co-workers to friends to spouses to siblings we are both friends and foes. It is only by learning how to strike the right balance between these two forces that we can improve our long-term relationships and get more of what we want.

Here, Galinsky and Schweitzer draw on original, cutting edge research from their own labs and from across the social sciences as well as vivid real-world examples to show how to maximize success in work and in life by deftly navigating the tension between cooperation and competition. They offer insights and advice ranging from: how to gain power and keep it, how to build trust and repair trust once it’s broken, how to diffuse workplace conflict and bias, how to find the right comparisons to motivate us and make us happier, and how to succeed in negotiations – ensuring that we achieve our own goals and satisfy those of our counterparts.

Along the way, they pose and offer surprising answers to a number of perplexing puzzles: when does too much talent undermine success; why can acting lesscompetently gain you status and authority, where do many gender differences in the workplace really come from, how can you use deception to build trust, and why do you want to go last on American Idol and in many interview situations, but make the first offer when negotiating the sale of a new car.

We perform at our very best when we hold cooperation and competition in the right balance. This book is a guide for navigating our social and professional worlds by learning when to cooperate as a friend and when to compete as a foe—and how to be better at both.

results.description:
This is an example of an opportunity box, there is a lot of variety and it is subject to change. 

Spring Lake Farms is offering a Mixed box ~(The farmer will target 25 lbs but may vary depending on cuts. )

Spring Lake Farms is offering a sampler mix pack.  This pack will consist of BEEF & PORK and/or some mutton.

These animals were butchered at various times throughout the year and the date is labelled on each cut.   I do not know exactly how many of each cut , but I can assure you that Spring Lake Farms is always extremely generous in their sampler packs.  They aim to please their discerning meat eating customers.

THE FARMER'S WILL NOT BE PROVIDING AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX IN ADVANCE.  THEY HAVE AN INVENTORY OF EACH BOX POSTED TO EACH BOX ON DELIVERY DAY. 

The total cost for your beef/pork mix box will be $143.92. The box is $135 plus a $5 meetup fee plus a $3.92 paypal fee.  

THE FARMERS WILL NOT BE DELIVERING TO INDIVIDUAL ADDRESSES MIX BOXES ALONE.  PLEASE COME AND PICK UP YOUR MIX BOX.  EXCEPTION - 2 OR MORE PEOPLE GETTING TWO SHIPMENTS WOULD LIKE TO HAVE IT DELIVERED TO THE SAME PLACE - THEY WILL DELIVER FOR THAT. 

Spring Lake has a great website <a>www.springlakefarmny.com.</a> Ulla Kjarval, the farmer's daughter also writes a farming & food blog with several recipes to complement the meat her parent's raise. Our beef has been completely grass-fed. Ingi Kjarval, our farmer, has been cross-breeding his cattle to help build a smaller, sturdier steer that does well in upstate NY on grass. Our cows are part Simmental, Hereford, Angus & Highland.

results.description:
For members working on writing projects at home who are looking for some feedback - this is the meetup for you. Please post one piece you wish to have critiqued to the Files section of the meetup page by midnight of the Thursday immediately preceding this meetup (giving members enough time to read it!).


Requirement to attend this meeting: read through and critique all recent files (http://www.meetup.com/StatenIsland-Writers/files/) posted by members who have RSVPed "Yes" to this meetup and be prepared to DISCUSS your thoughts (remember we are looking for more than "it was good" - constructive criticism is our bread and butter!). Many members find it helpful to bring notes to share with the writer either written on a printed out copy of the work, or on a separate sheet of paper.

Note:
For all of our meetups at public establishments it is essential that we show our gratitude for the venue that has agreed to host our meetings by being patrons as we enjoy their space. While there is no fee to attend this meetup, please come prepared to purchase something (even if it is something as small as a bottle of water) from the cafe.

results.description:
I would love for you to join me in the second instillation as we begin to use meditation and improvisational movement as a means to encourage a conversation and cohesion between our rational and everyday thinking with our intuitive, spiritual, and woman selves. I am continually inspired by the connection between this kind of work and a deeper dialogue with our body-minds.

Any woman with a calling to work in this way is welcome to attend! By just showing up with a willingness to be present in the work, you have already opened your heart and you are already a dancer.

I reserved the beautiful space Eden's Expressway through Movement Research, and I am charging $10 a person (No one will be turned away for lack of funds. Feel free to contact me.)

I can only accept a maximum of 15 women, so please RSVP as soon as you can! If you can't make it this time, I will be offering 2 more sessions through March.

I so look forward to meeting and moving with each of you!! If you have any questions/concerns/excitements/anything, please message me. I would love to hear from you!

--caitlin

results.description:
The poll is now closed and we want to thank everyone who voted. For our February book discussion, we will be reading:

True Refuge: Finding Peace and Freedom in Your Own Awakened Heart by Tara Brach($15.98 list price)
http://www.randomhousebooks.com/books/16999/


<a href="https://www.goodreads.com/book/show/17607.All_About_Love"></a>

From the publisher:

How do you cope when facing life-threatening illness, family conflict, faltering relationships, old trauma, obsessive thinking, overwhelming emotion, or inevitable loss? If you’re like most people, chances are you react with fear and confusion, falling back on timeworn strategies: anger, self-judgment, and addictive behaviors. Though these old, conditioned attempts to control our life may offer fleeting relief, ultimately they leave us feeling isolated and mired in pain.

There is another way. Beneath the turbulence of our thoughts and emotions exists a profound stillness, a silent awareness capable of limitless love. Tara Brach, author of the award-winning Radical Acceptance, calls this awareness our true refuge, because it is available to every one of us, at any moment, no exceptions. In this book, Brach offers a practical guide to finding our inner sanctuary of peace and wisdom in the midst of difficulty.

Based on a fresh interpretation of the three classic Buddhist gateways to freedom—truth, love, and awareness—True Refuge shows us the way not just to heal our suffering, but also to cultivate our capacity for genuine happiness. Through spiritual teachings, guided meditations, and inspirational stories of people who discovered loving presence during times of great struggle, Brach invites us to connect more deeply with our own inner life, one another, and the world around us.

True Refuge is essential reading for anyone encountering hardship or crisis, anyone dedicated to a path of spiritual awakening. The book reminds us of our own innate intelligence and goodness, making possible an enduring trust in ourselves and our lives. We realize that what we seek is within us, and regardless of circumstances, “there is always a way to take refuge in a healing and liberating presence.”

All prices listed are publisher's prices. The Astoria Bookshop will be offering a 10% discount for anyone in our group who purchases the eventual selection through them. Please email Emily to let her know if you would like to have a copy ordered for you. It will take the bookshop about a week to get the books in. Our book discussion will be Sunday, January 10th at 5pm. Hope you will join us there.

This event is free, but please consider buying the book through the Astoria Bookshop to support local business and thank them for giving us the space to meet.

Note: you do not have to have read the entire book to attend.

There will be a very brief guided mindfulness meditation during this meeting. No prior meditation experience necessary.
results.name: Book Discussion And Meditation at the Astoria Bookshop

results.description:
The secret to having a loving, long-lasting relationship starts with understanding that everyone sends and receives love differently!


During this Meetup... we will be going over a detailed explanation of The 5 Love Languages as outlined in Gary Chapman's Book -- "The 5 Love Languages".

The 5 Languages are: 
- Words of Affirmation 
- Quality Time 
- Acts of Service 
- Gift Giving 
- Physical Touch

During the meetup -- not only will we discuss each of the love languages in a general sense -- we will go into specific detail of how to use a particular love language if that is the love language of your partner.

As an added bonus, you will also discover what YOUR LOVE LANGUAGES are!

All of a sudden -- it will make sense! How to save a failing relationship and how to build stronger relationships in the future ~ It all starts here!

RSVP now and bring a friend!

See you at the event!

- Mike Guerrieri 
Inspirational Dating, Fashion & Relationship Coach 
www.StyleCoachNYC.com

(The event will be FREE -- I request a $20 Donation to help cover room costs.)
results.name: The 5 Love Languages - The Secret Formula to Loving Relationships That Last!

IKEA, for those of you who may not know, is more than just a mere appliance store. It is a place of wonder and intrigue. A place where elite debutantes force their male suitors to take them on a first date. Join us as we browse the aisles and stare in amazement at the mysteries that await us inside. We will also be eating the finest, most exotic foods they have to offer us in a place the local natives call a "Food Court". Since this is a store where only the rich and powerful can shop, we will be wearing formal attire so we can properly fit in. This is a free event to attend but **YOU MUST WEAR FORMAL ATTIRE TO ATTEND THIS EVENT** This means a suit, tie, and dress shirt & pants for the gents. I'm going to be wearing a monocle as well, but this isn't required...unless you want to look superfly ;) 


See y'all there!!

results.description:
Weekly Ascension Classes with Pierre Dubois: level 1, every Sunday from 6:00 to 8:00 PM: “Life is suffering and all suffering comes from wrong perception”- Lord Buddha. 

In what state you and the world would be if at first all we seek to have the right perception? Difficulties and challenges would not stop, but our fear based reactions to them would cease to be. All tensions, stress states and unbalanced forces in the universe seek to achieve equilibrium. Translation, what we all want is to merge with God.

This weekly Ascension Class provides you with all the knowledge, consciousness raising, love, support and fellowship that you need to assist you in your transformation toward being the next God. Goddess, Christ, Buddha, Krishna, Brahma, Vishnu, Shiva, Moses, Mohamed, Mahatma.

For those of you who can not be in New York City for the classes, you can participate in a phone conference call with the class.

Call in number [masked] and the access code is [masked]#.

PayPal $20 http://www.iammonad.com/classes001.html

About Pierre

Pierre Dubois holds two advanced degrees from Columbia University and is a registered architect in the state of NY, where he has been practicing for 25 years, focusing primarily on nonprofit affordable housing. He is also the founder of Gaiaville®, the first sustainable intentional community of its kind. Pierre started his journey toward ascension at the age of 11, and strives to explain with science the ‘magic’ of the spiritual and supernatural. He was initiated in Mystery Schools, studied all world religions, belief systems and spiritual movements. Throughout his extensive studies and travels, he discovers that no matter how we express it, we all have the same desires: find love, fulfill our purpose, leave a positive footprint behind and ultimately experience merger back to God.

A gifted healer, spiritual teacher and counselor, Pierre is also a certified life coach and hypnotist, regression therapist, channel, and Minister. He pioneered the groundbreaking Celestial Light Healing® method and specialized in healing the healers and energy workers. Believing that “the path toward illumination is a solo act, but not a lonely road”, Pierre has helped countless people on their journey of healing, expansion and ascension, by teaching classes weekly, from the very heart of his home in New York City, and offering workshops and lectures throughout the country.

http://www.iammonad.com/

At our speed dating event, we expect around 50 men and 50 women ages 20s & 30s. Each man and woman will go on a 3-minute mini date with each other. On a "match card" that we will provide you will let us know who you liked from among the people you met. If the same person picks you in his/her match card, we will send you each others' contact info the very next day!

Oscar viewing party at Gesa's!  This meet up is on Roosevelt Island and if you're not familiar it's very easy to get there  -  Best way is Roosevelt Island stop on the F train (1  stop from Manhattan ) or you can take the Roosevelt tram  

 Please download and bring your filled out Oscar ballot !  I will try to have a few copies on hand as well.  www.ew.com/article/2016/01/25/oscars-2016-ballot

Drinks/Food

-BYOB :  please bring what you plan on drinking! 

-Dinner:  rather than have people bring stuff we thought it be easier just to get together and order takeout. We plan to order from Gaw Gai ( really good Thai food !)  if you prefer something else let me know and I'll be sure to find a couple options for you that deliver to Roosevelt Island

Please bring two dollars cash for meetup.com fees. 

Looking forward to seeing you guys! And thank you Gesa for hosting us!!

results.description:
Please join The Animals’ Battalion in protesting Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus. at the Barclays Center arena- LET’S SHOW THEM THAT ANIMAL ABUSE IS NOT WELCOME IN NEW YORK!

www.ringlingbeatsanimals.com



WHEN: Sunday February 28, 2:00PM – 3:00PM,  6–7PM

WHERE: In front of Barclays Center, 620 Atlantic Ave., Brooklyn, NY 11217 accessible by the 2,3,4,5 trains (See this map.) http://goo.gl/maps/IVX0G

Ringling Bros. and Barnum & Bailey Circus is known for its long history of abusing animals. In 1929, John Ringling ordered the execution of a majestic bull elephant named Black Diamond after the elephant killed a woman who had been in the crowd as he was paraded through a Texas city. Twenty men took aim and pumped some 170 bullets into Black Diamond's body and then chopped off his bullet-ridden head and mounted it for display in Houston. Ringling Bros.' cruel treatment of animals continues today.

Elephants in Ringling's possession are chained inside filthy, poorly ventilated boxcars for an average of more than 26 hours straight—and up to 100 hours at a time—when the circus travels. Even former Ringling employees have reported that elephants are routinely abused and violently beaten with bullhooks (weapons that resemble a fireplace poker) in order to force them to perform tricks.

To learn more about Ringling's lengthy history of abusing animals, check out PETA's factsheet. http://circuses.com/pdfs/RinglingHiddenTruthFSetc.pdf

There will also be protests every day Ringling's will be at the Barclay Center.
results.name: The Animals’ Battalion: Ringling Brothers Circus Protest @ Barclays Center

results.description:
IMPORTANT MESSAGE:
Event postponed to Sunday 2/28/16, 6pm due to emergency travel and weather restrictions this weekend (1/24) AND Super Bowl Sunday events (2/7). Thank you for your patience! Greetings Christian Entrepreneurs Family!

I hope you all had a great start to 2016. I believe that we can all expect some great things from God this year and I would like this group to be a committed group of enterprising believers! A brief introduction, I'm Grace and one of the new Co-organizers of this meetup along with Nicole M. After the Organizer stepped down, Nicole took up the baton and asked me if I'd like to join her as Co-Organizer, to which I thoughtfully agreed. We look forward to meeting you all soon!

I think it would be great to meet in January to start to build the personal connections that God-willing with grow within the year. We are currently planning some events but would love to hear about the needs, interests and preferences of the group!

On Sunday, 1/24/16 at 6pm, I'm hosting a communal dinner party at Hope Hill and you are all invited to attend. As a seated communal dinner we really have a chance to connect. I'd ask that you come with your business cards and be prepared to share one of your favorite books or scriptures that helps or has helped you in your faith-filled Entrepreneurial journey. This will be one of our few meet & greet events to start off the year.

If any of you are doing the Daniel Fast then you may find this event more interesting as it is a meal inspired by the Daniel Fast and is Vegan in nature. The African Table: A Vegan Paradise is an entrepreneurial outlet for me as a Chef & Food Educator.

I hope you can make it & Stay Tuned for other exciting events. May God expand our territory this year in Jesus name. Amen.

If interested in attending, please visit http://bit.ly/1VTYvz4 and use code: "ChristianEntrepsMeet" for discount

results.description:
This month we'll be going to Paulaner German Restaurant and Microbrewery.  You can have a sausage plate with potato salad for $14.  A menu is here</a>.

A $5 DEPOSIT will be required to RSVP, which will be *REFUNDED* *IN* *CASH* ten minutes after the event starts.  No-shows and latecomers will forfeit their deposit.  You will receive an electronic full refund if you cancel your RSVP more than 24 hours in advance.

Please don't come without RSVP'ing.

Topic 1: While you wouldn't know it from reading the evening news, the rate of human violence has been decreasing steadily -- a 20 year old today is less likely to die a violent death than any of their ancestors, as "The Better Angels of Our Nature" by Steven Pinker and "The Moral Arc" by Michael Shermer have illustrated.  But <a href="http://ieet.org/index.php/IEET/more/torres20151213">this source suggests that their optimism is misplaced, and the human race faces new dire dangers.


Topic 2: 2 books, "Coming Apart" by Charles Murray, and "Our Kids" by Robert Putnam, describe how America has become more class-stratified than ever before, and lower class Americans, including whites, have become increasingly dysfunctional.  Note that Charles Murray has said some unpopular things about race in the past, but in Coming Apart he avoids that minefield by discussing only upper and lower class whites.  Our Kids stresses that college education, rather than race, is now the big divide among Americans - college educated whites and blacks are very similar, as are whites and blacks without a college education, while there a large differences between those with a college education and those without.


Topic 3: Proponents of the idea that climate change is a serious and important problem have traditionally promoted simple solutions - a shift to existing renewable energy sources.  Bill Gates, along with several other billionaires, are bringing up a significant point - existing renewable sources aren't up to the task.  We need major breakthroughs, and large-scale funding for basic research.
results.how_to_find_us: I look like my picture, plus a mustache, and there'll be a sign on the table.
results.name: German Food, Human Survival, Class in America, Climate Change

results.description:
Melanie is a very special girl. Dr Caldwell calls her "our little genius."

Every morning, Melanie waits in her cell to be collected for class. When they come for her, Sergeant keeps his gun pointing at her while two of his people strap her into the wheelchair. She thinks they don't like her. She jokes that she won't bite, but they don't laugh.

The Girl With All the Gifts is a groundbreaking thriller, emotionally charged and gripping from beginning to end.

If you have any questions or want to know how many are attending from all groups please contact the event host at [masked]

It is Hollywood's biggest night of the year! There are some amazing films up for awards. Join a fun group of members and friends as we gather in midtown to watch all the action from the red carpet to the best picture award.  We will also have games and prizes, ice breakers, drink specials and more!

The night will feature:

- A special section set aside for our group to watch the show on dozens of huge screens.

- Separate checks for all

- Ice breaker games

- A pick the winners contest

- Drink specials 

** 7pm red carpet, 8:30pm telecast **

Come for dinner and drinks and leave at your leisure or stay for the whole night!

Can I come alone?  Yes, 98% of those attending will be coming on their own.

What to wear: Casual

See you There!!

results.description: The Good Soldier: A Tale of Passion is a 1915 novel by English novelist Ford Madox Ford. It is set just before World War I and chronicles the tragedy of Edward Ashburnham, the soldier to whom the title refers, and his own seemingly perfect marriage and that of two American friends. The novel is told using a series of flashbacks in non-chronological order, a literary technique that formed part of Ford's pioneering view of literary impressionism. Ford employs the device of the unreliable narrator[1] to great effect as the main character gradually reveals a version of events that is quite different from what the introduction leads the reader to believe. The novel was loosely based on two incidents of adultery and on Ford's messy personal life.
results.name: "The Good Soldier" by Ford Maddox Ford

results.description:
Each week dozens of CRC members and friends gather following the 5:30 mass at Holy Trinity to socialize, network and connect.  It is a great way to meet others in the group in a fun and casual way.

This week we will be going to Firehouse Tavern who has donated to our charity events in the past.  Hang out at the bar and socialize or sit and have a bite to eat with the group, separate checks are no problem.


We will have the Academy Awards and Red Carpet Special on all the screens with sound


Can I come alone?  Yes, Sunday is the best time to come on your own as almost everyone comes on their own. 


Do I need to be a member of Holy Trinity Parish? No many of our members belong to other parishes.

What if I went to the earlier mass?  Not a problem, come for the gathering and enjoy food and drink

The group will meet on the sidewalk after mass (approx 6:30pm) then walk over together or you can meet us at the restaurant.

Dave is the host for this Sunday.

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
The Annual Banff Mountain Film Festival World Tour is returning for 18th year in NYC for four nights at the Peter Norton Symphony Space, 2537 Broadway at 95th, 7:30 pm, Sunday, February 28th and Monday, February 29th; Tuesday, March 1st and Wednesday, March 2nd, 2016. 

Doors open at 7:00 pm. Arrive early and hear alphornist Barbara Oldham at 7:15.

Note: The film menu will be the same on Sunday and Tuesday; a completely different film menu will be shown on Monday and Wednesday (see film menus below). Tickets are $24 in advance and $27 at the door on the day of the show. Group sales of fifteen or more tickets purchased in advance are $21 (only at Symphony Space). Tickets are available now at Symphony Space and at our retail partner, Paragon Sports. Symphony Space Box office: 2537 Broadway at 95th, 212.864.5400. 

Tickets are available for purchase at the Box Office or by phone Tues. through Sun., 1pm - 6pm; or online at <a>www.symphonyspace.org.</a> Note: on each day of the show, the Box Office will be open until 7:45 pm to sell tickets, if any are still available). Paragon Sports, 867 Broadway at 18th,[masked], ext 2. 


Tickets are available for purchase at the Specialty Counter on the 2nd floor or by phone: Mon. through Fri. 10am - 8:30pm; Sat. 10am - 8pm; and Sun. 11am -7pm. Note: Tickets will not be available at Paragon Sports the day of the show. Day of show tickets (if available), must be purchased at Symphony Space. Can’t make either of these four dates or if Northern New Jersey/Rockland County, NY would be more convenient, we will be at the Lafayette Theatre in Suffern, New York on Tuesday, February 23 and Wednesday, February 24. We will offer two different film menus. For additional information, contact us at [masked] To see the awesome 2016 Banff Intro video go to:

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=bHnqUQ1c6yc&feature=youtu.be

NEW YORK CITY
Film Menu
Sunday, February 28th and Tuesday, March 1, 2016 The Important Places
Best Short Mountain Film
(2015, USA, 9 min)
Filmmakers: Gnarly Bay, Forest Woodward
www.gnarlybay.com
Parental Guidance: coarse language Using a mix of old 16mm footage and new visuals, a son rediscovers the necessity of returning to and protecting “the important places” in our lives. The Last Dragons
(2014, USA, 10 min)
Filmmakers: Jeremy Monroe, David Herasimtschuk
www.freshwatersillustrated.org
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory An intimate glimpse at North America's Eastern Hellbender, an ancient salamander as mythical as it is real. And in many waters, myths are all that remain of these sentinel stream-dwellers. Darklight (special edit)
(2015, USA, 5 min)
Filmmaker: Rachel Franks, Matt O’Connor, ZacRamras, Mike Brown
www.sweetgrass-productions.com
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory In 2014, the award winning film Afterglow followed skiers down impossibly lit, virgin powder slopes in the dead of night. Get ready for the sequel, this time on two wheels. Unbranded (special edit)
People’s Choice Award
(2015, USA, 46 min)
Filmmakers: Dennis Aig, Phillip Baribeau
www.unbrandedthefilm.com
Parental Guidance: coarse language Four men and 16 wild mustangs set off on a 5000 kilometre journey across the American West from Mexico to Canada. In the spirit of true adventure, whiskey is drunk, tempers fly, tragedy strikes, and the bonds of friendship hold fast. But can the journey help save the plight of the wild horses roaming on public lands? Only time will tell. Nature Rx
(2015, USA, 1 min)
Filmmakers: Justin Bogardus
www.nature-rx.org
Parental Guidance: no advisory Is life a little too mundane or overwhelming? Feeling tired, irritable or stressed out? Maybe Nature Rx is just the ticket. Kroger’s Canteen
(2015, South Africa, 8 min)
Filmmakers: Greg Fell, Dean Leslie
www.theafricanattachment.com
Parental Guidance: General; coarse language In 2014, Kilian Jornet won the Hardrock 100 mile race through the San Juan’s of Colorado. Along the way he stopped at Kroger’s Canteen – an aid station perched on a tiny ledge, 13,100ft above sea level. This is a story about that aid station, about the people who make it happen, and about the spirit one can only find at the Hardrock 100. Denali
(2015, USA, 8 min)
Filmmakers: Ben Moon, Ben Knight
www.benmoon.com
Parental Guidance: no advisory There's no easy way to say goodbye to a friend, especially when they've supported you through your darkest times. Women’s Speed Ascent
(2015, USA, 4 min)
Filmmakers: Keith Ladzinski, Chris Alstrin
www.3stringspro.com
Parental Guidance: Coarse language Mayan Smith-Gobat and Libby Sauter knew that the women's speed record for the ascent of The Nose on El Cap was theirs for the taking. Crushing the old record after just a few days of attempts, Mayan and Libby put their names in the record book of the infamous route in the Yosemite National Park. Paddle for the North (special edit)
(2015, New Zealand, 27 min)
Filmmaker: Alexander Behse, Simon Lucas
www.paddleforthenorth.org
Parental Guidance: coarse language On an adventure of a lifetime, six young guys paddle to some of the most remote rivers in North America. It's a 1,500 km, 63- day mission to truly discover the secrets of the north and to show the world why some places are worth preserving before they are changed forever. Paradise Waits (special edit)
(2015, USA, 7 min)
Filmmakers: Teton Gravity Research
www.tetongravity.com
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory How do you celebrate winter when snow finally falls? Freeskier Tim Durtschi takes tram laps at Jackson Hole and big mountain skier Angel Collinson rips up some Alaskan lines. NEW YORK CITY
FILM MENU
Monday, February 29th and Wednesday, March 2nd,[masked] Hours in Mexico
(2015, USA, 9 min)
Filmmakers: Joey Schusler, Karl Thompson, Thomas Woodson
www.joeyschusler.com
Parental Guidance: coarse language Fly to Veracruz on a Friday, rent a car, climb the third-highest peak in North America, ski down and return to your desk Monday. How hard could it be? Curiosity
(2014, USA, 13 min)
Filmmakers: Aimee Tetreault, Renan Ozturk, Tim Kemple
www.camp4collective.com
Parental Guidance: no advisory How does curiosity inspire ultra-marathoners Rory Bosio, Timothy Olson and Hal Koerner as they prepare for the Ultra-Trail du Mont Blanc? Their artistry gives them lots in common with local artist Andy Parkin. Sounds of Paragliding
(2014, France, 4 min)
Filmmaker: Shams
www.shams.fr
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory Listen to nature's harmony while aerobatic paragliding pilot Théo de Blic dances to the sounds of the sky. Voyagers Without Trace (special edit)
(2015, USA, 46 min)
Filmmaker: Ian McCluskey
www.nwdocumentary.org
Parental Guidance: General; coarse language In 1938, three Parisians pushed off from a Wyoming riverbank to attempt the first kayak exploration of the notoriously wild Green and Colorado rivers—and they recorded their journey, creating the first colour adventure film. The reels went unseen for 75 years, until Ian McCluskey spotted the trio on a roadside marker, sending him on his own adventure to discover more. The Warmth of Winter
(2015, USA, 6 min)
Filmmakers: Ben Sturgulewski, Philip Drake, ErmeCatino, Stephan Drake
www.sturgefilm.com
Parental Guidance: General; no advisory Outside, the snow flies and the wind roars. But here, quiet and safe in the candlelight, the warmth and the wood wrap around you like a blanket, and the mind melts into reflections of days gone by. Take shelter from the storm. Sit down by the fire, have a drink, and take a load off. There is no warmth like a warmth found in winter. Bluehue
(2015, UK, 5 min)
Filmmaker: Natasha Brooks
Website: www.tashbrooks.com
Parental Guidance: nudity Natasha Brooks swims naked year-round in the cold mountain lakes of Snowdonia, Wales. Through this she finds solitude, grounding and a deep connection to the natural environment. Winner of the British Mountaineering Council’s 2014 Women in Adventure Film Competition. Eclipse
Best Film – Snow Sports
(2015, Canada, 31 min)
Filmmakers: Anthony Bonello, Switchback Entertainment
www.switchbackentertainment.com
Parental Guidance: coarse language The odds are low, the risks are high – photographer Reuben Krabbe is determined to capture a photo of a skier in front of the 2015 solar eclipse in Svalbard. But the weather’s bad, the guide is sketchy, the pressure is massive and the skiers just want to ski. unReal (special edit)
(2015, USA, 12min)
Filmmaker: Teton Gravity Research
www.tetongravity.com
Classification: General; no advisory Imagine a world where you ride the perfect trail perfectly, and sometime snow isn’t the only stuff that falls from the sky. When you spend all of your time at work dreaming about mountain biking, which life is real? Note: Film menus subject to change DISCLAIMER

Participation in activities is strictly voluntary and group members assume all risks in connection with activities; per Meetup.com's Terms of Service Agreements, organizers and hike/trip leaders are released from any and all forms of liability related to events.Full text of our liability waiver can be found on the following page:

http://www.meetup.com/Adventure-Outlet/pages/Risks_and_Waiver_of_Liability/

results.description: We meet every Sunday night from 7:30-8:45 pm at South Mountain Yoga. We do a 20 minute guided meditation (usually one of Thich Nhat Hanh's), walking meditation, and a 20 minute silent sitting. Jean also picks a reading. At the end, there is time for sharing (optional) as a way to practicing listening and speaking about issues of mindfulness in our week, sittings, and daily lives. No experience is necessary.  There is a suggested donation of $10. Please try to arrive on time and refrain from wearing fragrances.  Cushions and folding chairs are available or you can bring your own. Please note: many sangha members attend the group without responding here on meetup.

results.description:
New Swing Dance Session With Spencer @ The JCC in Manhattan

334 Amsterdam Avenue, New York, NY @76th street

 with  Spencer Weisbond

Six week, progressive session : Jan 24, 2016 - March 6th
Sun
7:30PM - 8:30PM & 8:30PM - 9:30PM
# of Sessions: 6
Except:  Feb 7th No class!
  102: Advanced Beginner -  7:30 -8:30pm Advance in Jitterbug and East Coast Swing by learning more involved patterns with harder footwork. Build your dance vocabulary and partnering skills. This class is the prerequisite for Lindy Hop (level 3), which is the grandfather of all swing dances and has 8-count patterns. No partner needed


  103: Lindy Hop﻿ Pre-Intermediate 8:30- 9:30pm
Bring all your moves together into complete sequences. Learn new eight-count patterns to make your dance more intricate and expressive.  

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]
Level one is now on Wednesday nights!
  Register and pricing below:

  Level 102:  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452342

Level 103: http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=643452358

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3400 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a> <a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135393">

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408"></a>

results.description:
Interested in speed dating on a Sunday Night? This event Sunday night is for men and women at The Cupping Room Cafe.  

At present we need men and mainly men (aged 40 to 55 although there's a little flexibility in the age range). Also don't worry if only a few people sign up on the Meetup as people will be attending from different sources.  

Grab friends and come along to The Cupping Room Cafe to meet other energetic NYC singles, and pick out those you feel a connection with and would like to meet again. This promises to be a lot of fun, so you're highly encouraged to come down. To get your spot, you must:

(a) RSVP on the MeetUp site

(b) please also e-mail me directly at

<a>[masked]</a> to say you want to come and kindly give your age and first name.

As this is a speed-dating event, and the balance of men and women is very important, I will need to correspond with you briefly by e-mail to confirm your attendance.  Please note that you are only confirmed once you get a reply from me (i.e. from [masked]) ; also tickets are free for a limited time but at anytime you can register at the New York EasyDates website for $25 with promo code MEETUP-25.  

If you're looking for more details about this event, please visit the New York EasyDates website. Hope you can make it!

Regards, 

Daniel

results.description:
I want to thank everyone who came out for this, What a great show and an amazing meetup. we had so many people we couldnt accomodate all but its was a great show and i hope everyone met each other. Were gonna continue doing this as long as the club lets us. I met some of the most fun and amazing people, the comics were a full top Comedy Central line up too. For those of you who havent been to this, This is a special Meetup, we finally got a deal with Stand Up New York the hottest club in New York City to let us in free of charge and see comics like Amy Shumer, Godfrey, Kevin Brennan and top names, this is NOT an amateur show like alot of the meetups. I just ask that everyone who Rsvp's really do their best to show up AND MAKE IT ON TIME. as you know I dont charge for this meetup so come out see the hottest comedy show and maybe even make some new friends. this sundays line up includes the below.

This week, Ashley Morris hosts a show with: Gary Vider, Seaton Smith (Comedy Central), Chris Distefano (MTV), Vlad Camaano (NBC), Jon Laster (Comedy Central) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up New York Free, 2 drink min

This week, Ashley Morris hosts a show with: Gary Vider, Seaton Smith (Comedy Central), Chris Distefano (MTV), Vlad Camaano (NBC), Jon Laster (Comedy Central) and pretty much any comic you see on Comedy Central these days drops by and shows up on the lineup who knows who might drop by usually its Amy Shumer or Judah Friedlander.

I will be at the front end of the bar by the iphone charger as usual to meet with everyone and give you tickets for free admission and have everyone sit together so we can all share laughs. Try to be early the show starts at 8 and everyone sits at same table but i do this earlier so all of you can meet your fellow meetup members. This is a 2 show ticket, so if you show up for the 8 you can stay for the ten also which has a different but also comedy central lineup. Or if you would like to come for the 10 you can just say meetup at the door and they will point you to me.
results.name: Comedy Central Meetup at Stand Up New York Free, 2 drink min

results.description:
5v5 indoor gym soccer

With a smaller field and fewer players on a team, the quick-paced indoor soccer game helps players keep in shape and sharpen skills during the cold winter months. 

Why play with us:

Teammates are highly supportive & everyone gets involved in play.Play is at a good level, but not too competitive. No rough playing is ever tolerated.It's a friendly & diverse group. Meet new people and make new friends.   Share a laugh, conversation, and talk about your favorite soccer player. It's a fun workout indoors. We sometimes go out after our games.

Play according to your own schedule! Frequency of games make it simple. Unlike soccer leagues, there is no commitment for a season.

results.description:
We've planned this now as a weekly meetup, so that everyone in the group can get together even if the moderator can't be there.

If Darren can't make it to introduce everyone (he can't this week), could someone please take it upon themselves to 1) stake out the big table a little early, 2) Lead a go-around-the-horn o? introductions at 8pm, and 3) Time the 60 minutes of writing time and let everyone know when it's 9 pm.

As always,

Please RSVP only if you can make it, and update as soon as possible if your plans change. We have had far too many no-shows.

You will see progress in your writing project by spending the minimum of a single hour per week on it. This is your practice/focus time, so I hope to see you there.

Join other writers for an hour of focused writing!

7-8 pm - Show up early, stake out a spot and either socialize or get a jump on writing.
8:00 - Start. Introductions, and we'll share what we're working on
8:05 - Get down to business. An hour of silence and solid writing!
9:05- Brief follow up. People are encouraged to share experiences & ideas, network or take off as they like. Feel free to keep writing if you've got the momentum going! Be aware Argo closes at 10pm.
If you're spending too much time THINKING about writing, come and join us for a session of focused writing. It may just be "pipe-cleaning" for now, but you'll feel better showing up at the page. No one will see what you've written or give you unsolicited advice.

WHERE: Argo Tea Cafe, Columbus Circle Subway Station. 1792 Broadway.

SOME TIPS:

Argo has plenty of outlets - we will be on the back, large table.
Seats are hard to come by, and I can only save so many, so please, come on time! If you come late, we might have already started.
The music and occasionally nonmember conversation can be loud, so bring headphones too.
WiFi is available with purchase.
It's a little chilly, so if you get cold bring a sweater.
And it goes without saying that buying a cup of joe or a snack from Argo for being nice enough to host us will bring you good writing karma.
If you aren't sure you can make it, please don't RSVP! Come on time or even a little early, as it can be difficult to save seats.
results.name: NYC Shut Up & Write Meetup! - Columbus Circle

results.description:
Ok folks, after quite a long break away, we're back again to let you have a great time being being horrible people with a rousing game of Cards Against Humanity. Because so many of you enjoy it, we would never deprive you of this for too long and will be resuming the monthly schedule of opportunities to be horrible. I'm sure we're doing a great service providing a safe outlet for these urges.

We'll be playing at The Uncommons, a tabletop gaming cafe. If by any chance Cards Against Humanity isn't your thing, they literally have a menu of dozens of games for you to enjoy, along with more typical menus for things like food and drink. For the small fee of $5 plus tax, all of these things will be available to you for the entire evening (The games, not the food and drink).

So come out and enjoy the guilty pleasure of being acceptably horrible with a card game, or play another game and sit in quiet judgment of the rest of us (both options have their appeal). Either way, join us for some fun games and good company this weekend.
results.name: Cards Against Humanity

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs. One game is 55-60 minutes. Be early. Every player rotates as a Goalie for 6 minutes, timed it with an electronic scoreboard. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt, indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. 

Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence. No charging, no displacing with your arms or body to gain the position on the ball. No running into the opponent. Play the ball, not the player. Time it, don’t foul it. 

Refunds will be honored only with a minimum of 24 hour cancelation.  No refunds for late cancelations; no exceptions. 

The school entrance is located on East 109th street between 2nd and 3rd avenues (near 2nd avenue) on the south side of the street. You'll see a row of 5-6 metal doors. Open the door or ring the buzzer (on your right) and someone will open the door for you.

For questions,  use the MEETUP message and notifications tools. 

Post pictures and videos at:

Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/Futsalacrossamerica?ref=hl

Twitter: https://twitter.com/FutsalAcrossA

Thank you for being part of Futsal Across America.

Enjoy the game!

results.description:
10,000 PB&Js is a volunteer led organization meets each week in White Plains & the lower east side to make and assemble several hundred meals and then distribute them in small teams throughout Manhattan to the homeless. 

The PB&Js and Hershey Kisses are their starting point: a means to begin a conversation, to listen and lay the foundation of trust necessary to offer more substantial help.

This event is for PB&J DISTRIBUTION:


Volunteers gather on East 11th for orientation, then break up into teams of 3 or 4 volunteers who distribute food, clothing & toiletries on pre-assigned routes. Finish times vary by team: some will be done before 11 pm and other teams might work until midnight. 

THIS IS A RECURRING EVENT!
10,000 PB&Js typically feeds a couple hundred neighbors each Sunday and would be thrilled to extend a up to 6 distribution spots for our group each week!


TO JOIN
Please email P.J. directly at [masked]. Or check out their Meetup group: www.meetup.com/10000PBandJs
results.name: Volunteer with 10,000 PB&Js

I am offering an Energy Transmission on Sunday Nights at 10PM, especially for weight loss!

Good nutrition is the core, for good health and successful weight loss, and good energy nutrition is important as well.

This will help you to relax, recharge, replenish, and will help you with stress eating, cravings, and to keep focused, and to feel better about your body and yourself.

A special and delicious vitamin essence, will fill you up with good nutrition, which will help you fill up with the good stuff, therefore you will feel more satisfied with less food, and helps you to absorb the nutrients your body needs.

This will also relax and strengthen your adrenal glands, and help to revitalize all of your glands and organs.

I really hope you enjoy this gift, and if you have any questions  concerns, please let me know.

I will have this each and every Sunday at 10PM! And, in the comfort of your own home.

It's that easy, and then you can just relax and enjoy! Do not worry about falling asleep, because the energies work great while you're sleeping. They will work even if you are distracted or if you forget.

Jae

*** If you haven't joined our Facebook group yet, make sure you do! That's where a lot of the action happens: links to our photo albums, extra workouts, happy hours, random funny meme postings, you name it!

facebook.com/groups/therisenyc

----------------------------------------------

This one workout will keep you amped up all week long. Seriously, give it a try and you will be hooked!


The exercises may change from week to week, but it is always a Tabata-style interval workout: 20 seconds of high intensity work followed by 10 seconds of rest. Then repeat! Exercises include sprints, burpees, squats, situps, box jumps, step ups, pushups, dips, and other “no-frills” exercises.


Warm up beforehand by running, biking, or walking. We start promptly at 6:30 AM and the workout only lasts 31 minutes. Show up a few minutes early to meet people and get yourself pumped up.

meta.description: Searches for recent and upcoming public events hosted by Meetup groups. Its search window  is the past one month through the next three months, and is subject to change. Open Events is optimized to search for current events by location, category, topic, or text, and only lists Meetups that have **3 or more RSVPs**. The number or results returned with each request is not guaranteed to be the same as the page size due to secondary filtering. If you're looking for a particular event or events within a particular group, use the standard [Events](/meetup_api/docs/2/events/) method.
meta.title: Meetup Open Events v2
